description:
After a less than stellar experience at Scala's my partner and I decided to explore more of the Sir Francis Drake and made our way up to The Starlight Room. It was still early in the evening and the place hadn't really picked up yet, but we loved the mood and the unbeatable views overlooking Union Square. 

We got to talking to the host, Robert, who is awesome and a huge reason this lounge is getting five stars. He was warm, friendly and encouraged us to come back the next night a little later in the evening when the DJ would be in. 

We returned the next night about 9:45 and the atmosphere was definitely more lively. This lounge seems to cater to a diverse range of people. It isn't just a "hip, young" establishment; we saw plenty of patrons well over 30 years old there. It has a bit of a more classy, cabaret sort of feel with the large, red velvet booths and lighting. The DJ was fine, most people stayed on the floor and the selection of music was good and the atmosphere maintained without much lull. 

One thing I will say that counted against this spot is the staffing. The night we came they seemed VERY understaffed and the waiters were running around like headless chickens trying to get to all their guests. There was a wait for a table and after we were seated my partner and I waited a bit to be seen. Fortunately, the host, Robert, went above and beyond bringing us waters and my partner's drink orders, checking in on us, and making sure we were taken care of. We ended up having a wonderful night and will absolutely return when back in San Francisco.
author: Kate H.

description:
After attending an event nearby, my friend and I decided to stop by Starlight Room for a quick drink. We walked in Thursday, June 28th around 11:30pm. I believe it was close to closing, so we easily found a small table by a window.

We were here for less than an hour, so just grabbed one round of drinks. We got a Bud Light, I believe a Jameson & Ginger, and a bottle of Acqua Panna. (I didn't get the round, so not sure of pricing.) The views are nice. I believe it's on the 21st floor, so you have a nice view of the city. The vibe here is very old school and throwback. Even the booths feel like they are from a different decade. I think they normally have live music, but since they were closing soon, it was rather quiet. I didn't mind since I just wanted to enjoy the view.

A good quick stop. I haven't been here in close to a decade, so it was fun revisiting an old spot.
author: Elena N.

description:
This was a very interesting place. We were staying at the hotel and took advantage of the "free cover" before 8. 

We initially walked up to grab a drink and check out the dance area. I ordered a gin and tonic which was average, to say the least (kinda watered down) and a wine. 

We also ordered some chips with a french dip (kinda tasted funky) and some sweet potato fries (delish). 

The views are spectacular. Almost a 360 view of the city with glimpses of fireworks from the distance on certain days.

This was a mixed crowd with a mixed vibe. Some people were having dinner, others just drinks, and other others here for the dancing part...that was interesting. They have a dance floor and a dj I believe, it just seemed like a random combo. 

I'm not from the area and many locals recommended this place so worth checking out if staying near Union Square.
author: Adelina M.

description:
My husband and I were in San Francisco a couple of weeks ago and decided to see the "Sunday's a Drag" show at the Starlight Room. The show itself was great, so this review is about the billing experience.

We went online and checked out availability for the show on October 21. Tickets were available, so I purchased them. But when I got the confirmation, it said the tickets were for October 28. I immediately called the Starlight Room, repeatedly. I finally spoke to a human being, who said this was the responsibility of the vendor, CrowdTorch (Vendini). I called them and learned that they wouldn't open until the following Monday. So I went back online, used a different credit card to avoid confusion, and successfully purchased two tickets for Sunday the 21st.

When I finally heard back from Vendi, they told me the opposite of what Starlight had said, and told me to contact the Starlight Room directly. So I called back yet again. I was told that the manager would reverse the charge for the tickets, and I was forwarded to her extension. I got her voicemail, left her a detailed message, and that was it. I never heard back.

Because it was evident that the Starlight Room was more than happy to have me pay double for the show, I disputed the charge with my credit card company before the 28th. I thought that might get the Starlight Room's attention, and it would also open up some more tickets for them to sell legitimately. Nope.

This means we paid nearly $350 for a drag brunch, before alcohol and tips. The unprofessionalism with which we were treated was inexcusable, and unless there's new management, we won't be back.
author: Brian B.

description:
Really love this place and the breathtaking views of the city, Good music and services. But my biggest annoyance is that the dress code is not enforced.
If your going to be a classy club management should make sure front Security/Guest services do there jobs and enforce this.
author: Ric M.

description:
This review is specifically for "Sunday's a Drag," a Sunday brunch buffet located in the top floor of The Starlight Room near Union Square. The decor is about as tacky as they come, but it certainly fits with the vibe of the performers and the show. 

"Sunday's a Drag" is an opportunity for you to be graced by the presence of some fabulous, vibrant, and colorful drag queens. I could not recommend this experience more. The cost of $60 per person is well worth it for the food accompanied by an unforgettable show. The main hostess, Donna, will have you laughing with her corny drag jokes, her sultry singing voice, and details of her colorful personal history. The other drag queens will strut their stuff and sing and dance and interact with the audience and have you laughing your butt off.

Now, if you are a stiff, I am not sure why you would even be reading my review of Sunday's a Drag. Just stay home. But if you are comfortable with the possibility of some drag queen intimacy, then wake up and show up to Sunday brunch. If you want the "full" experience, make sure you grab a seat right around the stage. But even if you don't, you are not safe! The drag queens definitely make their way around the whole seating area to make sure everyone gets their own personal interaction. ;-)

My husband was in the hottest seat of them all, being the only man seated around the stage, and also being directly next to the steps from the stage to the seating floor. He got many drag queen tits in his face, a kiss on the lips, a lap dance, and more. My glasses managed to have drag queen lipstick all over them. We were laughing the whole time. Highly recommended for something different or if you are just into drag. It's a great, intimate show. An unforgettable experience! Do it.

That said, the food isn't that good. But you're not there for the food. For reference, I am a true foodie and still recommend this brunch. If I were providing a star rating based on food alone, I would provide 2 stars. The experience is a 5 though. So overall, a 4.
author: Chelsea S.

description: We went here for our friends anniversary. The view is gorgeous, loved the decor as well. The host, I wish I could remember his name, lovely man with a great personality. We enjoyed the drinks, music and dancing. Great environment.
author: Irene G.

description: This is a special occasion kind of place, and romantic. View of union square and the city. The hotel is gorgeous and the decor just brings you back to more simple times. Take the elevator up to the Starlight Room and enjoy a cocktail or dine with your special someone. It's a destination spot for sure.
author: Mary M.

description:
A nice place to check out to check out if you want a nice view and place to relax. The DJ was alright and playing a mix of dance, hip hop, and EDM. The set flow was not the best and we all had to stop dancing for a few songs because it kind of threw all of us off. The drinks are made well and the décor was nice.

Can't beat the view, but there are plenty of places out there for better music and better drinks.
author: Camera P.

description: The view was to die for! But they should clean windows often so it's a little clear to see outside. The place was amazing. Drinks were strong and I loved it! I went on a Thursday night and it was a good crowd. I had fun by myself but danced for a while and enjoyed the view of San Francisco at night. Definitely wanna go back there during the day.
author: Jorge E.

description:
A group of friends took me here for a night out in the city for a birthday celebration. I liked this place and enjoyed ourselves for few hours until we decided to leave for the same reason.

I would probably come here again BUT WILL NOT dress to impress.

DOWNSIDE: 
I wish you are true to your statement and would enforce the dress code like it says on the website;

ACCORDING TO YOUR WEBSITE:
"Dress code strictly enforced. What does that mean, you ask? Dress to impress! We love a great suit jacket and cocktail dress, however don't feel pressure to go full cocktail-style. Use your best judgement, but please no flip flops, work boots, shorts/cut-offs, extremely baggy jeans, jerseys or baseball caps. All bags must be checked."

Statement on the website is misleading.

We dressed to impress for this place (as stated on your website) but later that night, when the music started & crowd started to flow in, a group of young ladies with ripped jeans, crop tops, shorts & flip flops were & group of  guys with T-shirts, sagged jeans, tennis shoes & they all smelled like pot were let in. 

How & why was this allowed?

We all decided to early for the same reason. This place became a typical dress down club.

MANAGEMENT: PLEASE KEEP THE CLASSINESS IN THIS PLACE & STRICTLY ENFORCE YOUR DRESS CODES.
author: Jules M.

description:
I am selectively observant. For example:

1) I drive manfriend nuts because he can leave a present for me out in the open for weeks and I will show no inkling or interest in peeking.

2) But, if he asks a question I can't answer, I must Google until I find the answer.

3) I stayed at this hotel for a week and others within spitting distance and it never occurred to me to wonder what the Starlight Room was, despite the sign on the side of the building.

I met some friends up here for drinks. It reminds me of a smaller Signature Room back home in Chicago. There's a stellar view of the city and a nice sized dance floor with a disco ball; unfortunately when we were here no one was dancing because they were playing some bad disco. Drinks are a little pricey, but you're in a hotel that's a touristy destination. It's dark and dim making it a good spot for an after dinner cocktail; probably better on week night if you want it to be low key.

If you're visiting the city; it's worth a trip up for a drink. While it intends to be a classier place, there were plenty of people dressed casually, so don't let that keep you away.

FYI: Gratuity was included on my tab for 1 drink.
author: Mary T.

description: Such a sexy place. Love the view and the fries! Gets a little toooo Sexy for me after 10. You have been fore warned
author: Ivan M.

description: Loved this place! Great music, interesting drinks. Must go spend a romantic afternoon with that view!
author: Glorimar A.

description: If you are looking for bumping and grinding and young and hip place this is not the place! Yes this place is gorgeous views in the city but this not like your average club. A lot of people come here are well over 30 years of age. It is defiantly a lower key vibe here and the young folks would not appreciate it. Overall it isn't a bad place to hang out, have some drinks and soak up the views. There are plenty of places to check out in the city and this is defiantly one of them. Will it be your favorite spot? Probably not but worth the visit for sure.
author: Anne R.

description:
This review is specifically for the Sunday's A Drag brunch. I'm not usually a buffet kinda gal, but this brunch buffet was legit! I got plenty to eat before the show.
But enough about food...the real reason to go is for the queens. The host, Donna Sachet, sings old standards -- no lip sync, very delightfully classic cabaret style. The queens who do lip sync are ON IT too. My parents especially loved Ms. Holotta Tymes; she was hilarious.
Of all of things I've taken people to when they visit SF, this is one of my favorites. The family that drag
brunches together, stays together!
author: Vanessa H.

description: Great place to sit back and enjoy the sites. Old fashion med cocktails, wonderful service and the Host checking is in was fabulous.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Trashy. Overpriced. Understaffed.

Look at their website first and then go one evening and it's a total bait and switch. Poor tourists and locals alike were treated to a huge disappointment. With a setting with million dollar views, the look of art deco throwback architecture and design is overlooked. Sad. Best to go in broad daylight. 

The minute you enter the "room" , DJ music is blaring on the south end of the room; to me it doesn't go with the intended ambiance, call me boring, but if you're about to enjoy a great SF view, great company, great music should complete the feel of being in an iconic San Francisco establishment. 

Service last night was horrendous, did not know drinks included gratuity, so we overtipped.

That night, bar bites selections were minimal and they ran out most of the selections!
911. You'd think management got this, but no. As much as I tried to look at things in a positive light, I couldn't it was just awful. You make the effort to dress up, meet friends, and enjoy a great outing, this spot was a totally miss. 

Bottom line: PEOPLE DON'T DO IT! 

NOTED ON WEBSITE: 
*Dress code strictly enforced. What does that mean, you ask? Dress to impress! We love a great suit jacket and cocktail dress; however don't feel pressure to go full cocktail-style. Use your best judgement, but please no flip flops, work boots, shorts/cut-offs, extremely baggy jeans, jerseys or baseball caps. All bags must be checked.

NOT.
author: Edgar M.

description: Super nice area and the music was pretty good, however I think the drinks are way too over priced. I ordered vodka with pineapple, a shot of patron and a corona and it was 40 dollars. Like no just not even worth it since my drink tasted like water
author: Roxana V.

description:
great view, bar, live music, dancing though it's a bit dark.
this is a nice spot for more mature older folks that prefers the low key and sophisticated ambiance.  definitely romantic and intimate, ideal for dates.
author: Jeene L.

description: Such a cool place - beautiful view. We walked into it on accident and ended up staying a few hours! It's definitely old - smells a bit moldy and dusty - but once you get past that, what a cool place! Try to get a window seat - it's worth asking. The service was ok. We had a goat cheese appetizer which was good. There is also an observation type area (maybe also a dance floor?!) with a phenomenal view of the city. Would definitely be worth checking out again when they have music playing to see what it's like then.
author: Alexa S.

description: Came here for a quick bite. Had some wine that was very tasty. . My date loved the sweet sparkling white wine the waitress recommend. . We each tried the different sliders.  Very good. The service could have been better.  After my Freind ordered,  she did not even ask if I wanted anything, just scampered away. Now that I mention it, why did I tip well.  Great view and would be fantastic at night
author: David G.

description:
showed up early on a weeknight with my fiancé to meet some friends. the host was quite friendly and personable and let us choose between the west (sunset) view or east (city) view. we went with the latter and toasted some bubbly as the lights came on in the city...

the only weird things were the numerous tourist families that brought young children to see the view... kinda killed the vibe. also we ordered the french onion dip + chips which was tasty, but i had to ask twice for more dip because they literally served us a spoonful for two people.
author: Lorraine Y.

description:
Star light, star bright,
The first star I see tonight;
I wish I may, I wish I might,
Have the wish I wish tonight.

I wish to get a drink with a fantastic view of San Francisco. and *POOF* The Starlight Room appears!

Located on top of floor of the Sir Francis Drake hotel, The Starlight Room is the perfect place to bring a date if you're trying to impress. The venue is pretty huge with a bar up front, tons of tables and sofas, and even a dance floor on the other side. It does have that old school classic feel, but I think I prefer The View's modern look instead.

The huge windows allow you to see all the sparkling lights of the city, giving you a really romantic setting. Drinks are definitely on the expensive side, but you are paying for the view and the bougie crowd (lots of cougars and older men).

They have a Drag Brunch Experience every Sundays at 11:30am and 2pm that I'd love to check out sometime!
author: Christine S.

description:
Dancing! Weird guys trying to get in between you and your friends! Besides that the Starlight Room is nicely located- on the 21st floor of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel.

Most people were dressed up in heels and cocktail dresses while the guys wore slacks and sport coats and finely tailored suits like my honey who was wearing Armani. 

Great views of the city from the dance floor.
author: Maria M.

description: Unfortunately my friend and I arrived late to the "Sunday's a drag" brunch. I only grabbed a small plate of food and sat down. Brunch is only served before the show ... and the show itself was nice. Was this all really worth 80 bucks? Not really.... like the show wasn't even that long. There was no alcohol included in the brunch... so I kind of felt like I wasted 80 bucks. Not fun. Oh well. This was my first drag show and I'd love to see more in the future.
author: Nikita B.

description: On a Friday night, I'd call it trashy. It felt more like a strip joint than a place to have a drink and maybe a dance. Music loud enough that conversation was difficult at best far away from the dance floor. I was embarrassed to bring my out of town friends ... and apologized to them.
author: jack l.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with a friend during Fleet Week to check out the view and sip on some complimentary bub (apparently available 9-10pm, but you have to remember to request a drink ticket). The view was indeed spectacular as others have mentioned, but I am not sure if I would be in a rush to come here again just for that with the $20 cover unless there was some event. 

Dance floor is small, but charmingly decorated with a lit starburst pattern radiating from the center of the floor with small lights twinkling here and there. Very pretty, especially with the disco ball hanging from a mirror ceiling reflecting everything. I have to say that the ventilation was a bit lacking though and my friend and I could feel the level of mugginess quickly rising as the crowd came in around 10. The windows could use a good wipe down as I was able to discern many a finger/hand/forehead? print on the glass, lol.

Waitstaff seemed quite nice- particularly for the folks who had tables reserved. Music was upbeat enough to dance to but I don't think people were brave enough to break out any moves with the limited crowd just yet. All in all worth it to check out once I think, but it'll take something more to get me to return.
author: Yen D.

description:
There are plenty of places in the city to go see a modern dj. Most of them are pretty great.

The starlight room is supposed to be a throwback to a better time. Live music, and people of all ages enjoying themselves together. The place is now "ghetto" compared to what it used to be.

Making yet another copy of the night scene you can get anywhere in SOMA is a REALLY bad idea. 

The reference to the couple from wichita... I know why they had a deer in the headlights moment when they came up here. They were expecting funk, swing, and other danceable music that works for EVERYONE- normally served up LIVE at the starlight room.

I was surprised when I got up there and there was no cover.... but NOT surprised when I saw what was going on- a half empty starlight room with a pretty lame/mainstream DJ.

I asked someone on staff if they still had live music (since this was prime time- a Saturday night). They said no, not any more.

I just turned around and left. 

Yes there are a couple of cool places in the city where you can have this experience. But nothing would top the starlight room of ... what... last year? It's a shame.
author: Greg C.

description: Had an amazing time here. Can't wait to go back. Great music. Beautiful view. Grown & Sexy.
author: Ashley W.

description:
An oldie but a goodie.

The space?  A mix of old world refined masculinity, w high end hotel, w posh & glam.  And bling.

The bling?  The view.  

It's 360 degrees & 21 floors up.  Just drop dead gorgeous.

The food?  Meh.  It's really about the space & the view. 

The vibe?  That really depends on what night you visit.  Unless you want a packed house, full dance floor, & to grope or be groped, don't go on a Friday or Saturday night.  The busy nights mean long waits & a huge crowd.  Often, it's a huge crowd of unsophisticated drinkers, if you get my drift.

Service is hit or miss.  But as a rule, it's better to order at the bar yourself.  Assuming you can get to the bar relatively smoothly & squeeze in.  If it's really busy, it's a zoo & this is not an easy task.

I hadn't been by in a couple of years.  But happily, despite the fact that it was a Saturday night, it was nice & quiet.  This is the way to go.  Show up around opening, which is 5:00.  We walked in before 6:00.

After all these years, this is still the spot to enjoy a drink while you awe, from high in the sky, at this fair city.  Before dark, you can see everything.  After dark, you see a billion lights.  Win win.

A must for a date night.  And it's pretty fun on a girls night.  Stick w the classics, like martinis, negronis, manhattans, & champagne.  Sugar bombs & trendy cocktails will further slow your service down.  The bottom line here is distinguished, despite what kind of crowd it might be. 

If it is date night, you'll be too busy canoodling w your significant other to care if the service is slow.  Get a booth!  Wink wink.

The view is 5 stars of course.  And the sheer romance of literally being up in the stars can't be beat.  But mixed w the unreliable service & lackluster offerings?

3 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: I attended the Sunday Drag Brunch.. a delightful and fun show and the setting was very intimate. The entertainers gave lots of attention to the audience which was very fun and their acts were lively and energetic. We enjoyed every act and Donna the MC was fantastic and her comedy was top notch. I found the food at the brunch to be excellent as was the view. I am a vegetarian and was happen to find so many things to dine on. I think its one of the cities best kept secrets. I also enjoyed being able to support SF drag queen entertainment. They are a terrific group and bring so much to San Francisco.
author: Ann A.

description:
No cover charge if you're a hotel guest (yay!), which I wasn't. But my homies were, so we got in for free!

Tons of people. And, as I've rarely experienced, the demographics were all over the place. I was no where near the oldest person there and others looked like they were on their way to a college rave later. People dressed up like they were at the opera earlier, people dressed like they were straight out of a mafia movie, and people dressed like they just wanted to dance.

I somehow managed to keep my tube top from falling when the DJ kept putting on Rihanna songs but ultimately, I was thirsty, impatient, and getting old. There were so many people squeezed onto the dance floor and the line to the bar was long. 

It was a fun half hour though and the view is nice.

If you're up for some great people-watching, checking out the view, and Rihanna music, find a friend with a room key and check it out!
author: Loli L.

description: We came here for a girls day to see the show and have brunch. We had so much fun, the view while getting our brunch was beautiful. The food was very good, they have lots of different options to choose from. They do have bottomless mimosas for $40 per person, our group did purchase the mimosas and it was worth it! The show was pretty funny and entertaining.
author: Stephanie O.

description: Situated at the top of the building with an amazing view. The atmosphere is very upscale and elegant. The offer signature cocktails, small bites and a dance floor to dance all your worries away.
author: Ricky E.

description:
This USED to be a fun spot to dance in SF......

I think Stevie Wonder could have mixed the music better from his Mac ...... in his sleep..

Tacky - tacky - tacky...... save your $20. Cover charge and dance in the shower.  

It's cleaner and a shower tunes radio could mix better....
author: Julie Z.

description: Five star view , five star service, would absolutely come back any day/night.  I was here for a private wedding event so I don't know what it's like during normal business hours.
author: Max H.

description: It's a beautiful bar. Expensive drinks...elevator will not work before 5pm. Nice place for sunset, but you have to time it right,  especially now in November...
author: Petra B.

description:
This review is based on my experience with the Sunday Drag Brunch. At first, I thought it was a little pricy ($60 per person). After attending the show, the fabulous drag performers are totally worth it. The food is ok, it's a brunch and plenty of food for 2nd or 3rd servings. 

Make sure to call and make reservations because it's a small place and it gets packed, people were turned down because they didn't have reservations. I have been to a few drag shows and I have to give these performers props for being fabulous, funny and amazingly looking.  Also, the hostess ladies did a great job with the drinks and seating people, it didn't go unnoticed. 

If you're in SF and looking for a food time with food included, definitely hit the Sunday drag show. It's a nice treat.
author: Veronica M.

description: It's on the top floor and gives you a spectacular view of the entire city. Interesting crowd though. I would only recommend going just to see the view and then you better get out or you'll be trapped by a gaggle of older women, prostitutes, and pervy old men
author: Kevin K.

description:
3.5 stars

THE VIEW IS TO DIE FOR! Seriously!! Came here for my friend's birthday & we had a good time. I'm a huge hip hop person & it wasn't played until past midnight... Though, it was only on for 30mins. So, while I was waiting for hiphop, I just took pictures of the view. When you walk in, you'll get a whole panoramic view of the heart of SF from a bird's eye view!!! Extremely breathtaking especially at night with all the lights on!! The view is 5 stars, but the experience was 3.5. The bathrooms are clean by the way with hooks for you to place your things. Just don't forget about them!
author: Gwyne P.

description:
Rarely do I write a one star review, but when I do, the one star is surely warranted. 

Long story short, we came here as an "after party" to a wedding. The bride had pre-paid for all of us to gain entrance, and we were all given wrist bands. Apparently the people who sold the wrist bands had not communicated with the incompetent "bouncer" manning the entry on September 20, 2014. 

As guests of the wedding poured out of the elevators, all wearing wristbands, this "bouncer" proceeded to swear at us, using incredibly rude and foul language, and humiliate us. There is never a reason to swear at a customer.

Hey dude, did you ever think to speak nicely to guests or ask management what was going on? Guess not. 

About 30 minutes later we were finally let in, turns out the wristbands were pre-paid! Oops! They made a mistake, no apology was offered. 

We proceed to go in and sit down and unmarked tables, ready to order drinks. We saw other tables marked reserved, so obviously didn't sit at those. Another incredibly rude staff member stomps over, treats us like 10 year old children, yelling at us to get up and move. The flippen BRIDE on her WEDDING NIGHT was sitting there, but still yelled at and made to move, no reason given. (?)

After that, I chose to leave. No place that treats me like that is going to get any of my $. I just feel bad for my friend, the bride, who had a gorgeous and amazing wedding prior to the Starlight Room. She shouldn't have to put up with that kind of crap on her wedding night, especially when she had previously pre-paid for her wedding guests to gain entry. 

I would rather have my eyeballs gouged out with a hot metal spoon than return here.
author: Melissa J.

description:
Sundays a Drag Baby!! Well not at the Starlight! It's a Sunday's Brunch & a Drag show! Holla!

Was in the Bay Area and wanted to do something fun for my birthday,  so went to Sundays a Drag down at the Starlight Room, made reservations for the 2:30pm show, seating for the brunch started at 1:30 and they do serve brunch up to 30 mins into the show.

I was pretty excited to combine 3 of my favorite things, my birthday, brunch and drag show all in one day, knew this had to spectacular.

Let's dish! 

1st up the food:

I felt fancy so I had to get the Waldorf salad darling because everyone is having it, and it was great, in fact I forgot how much I loved it. Also tried the Eggs Benedict, they tasted good, egg was cooked perfectly but they were sparely on the hollandaise sauce, man I love that golden yellow sauce, don't hold back!  I also tried the chicken and waffle, a veggie omelet, a truffled deviled egg, some roasted red potatoes, a scone with sweet butter & jelly, maybe a lil chocolate & dark chocolate cake and some chocolate covered strawberries DON'T JUDGE! It was my birthday damnit and I was starving haha. 

To drink, had water, coffee and a Bellini, the Bellini was perfect, went well with brunch. 

The show was great, I enjoyed it, there were 4 acts all together, and everyone did a great job. I loved the outfits; saw a few that I should flaunt haha. Just a great show for a Sunday afternoon. I would come back to Sundays A Drag in a heartbeat! 

After the show they opened up the curtain and allowed us to just enjoy the view, just so beautiful checking out the city views.
author: Monica O.

description:
I've had two very different experiences at the Starlight Room:

The first was a weekly weekday happy hour hosted by a drag queen. The crowd was mostly gay men and the dance floor was goofy and energetic. The drinks had (still pricey) happy hour prices between $8-$12. Had I rated Starlight after this experience, I would have given it 4 or 5 stars! 

Unfortunately, I also went to Starlight last night on a  Saturday night... 

Firstly, there was a $10 cover. Then, the drinks were between $12-$16. The crowd was primarily older hotel guests who looked bewildered to be back in a "club" after 25 years in Wichita. The dance floor was mostly empty, with a bunch of dudes leering at the few people who decided to dance. All in all, it wasn't our scene, and we had to spend a lot of money to learn that. I'll definitely be sticking to the far more fun drag events at Starlight. Womp.
author: Paloma N.

description:
He said there is a place in San Francisco that has a nice view. Although I'm pretty done with the city view, I thought the effort he put into this evening was admirable. I went along.

PARKING
Good luck. San Francisco parking is horrid.

LOCATION
Starlight lounge is located inside at the very top of Sir Francis Drake hotel. No sign or markings outside of that Sir Francis Drake hotel unless you had been there before or the physical address is in hand. 

Once inside there are signs to direct you to the Starlight Lounge. It can be easily missed if you don't tend to read signs with small fonts or simply just too intoxicated to bother.

INTERIOR
Classy. The decor, deep red/black/grey, dimmed lighting creates an intimate ambiance. It's a small and long lounge where with about 70 people you can easily fill the place up.

Cover charge (not sure it's the same every night) is $20 per person. The only reason I know this is because my date paid for us and it was the first time I actually worried about the entry fee (perks of being an club photographer at places where you know the owners)

Upon your entry, you face a long and most busy bar. On your right (and of the bar) you have the restrooms. Once you walk down the long lounge you will find seatings/dining tables on your left and right. There is a small corridor on the left hand side that leads you to the dance floor near the DJ booth (which I have to mention trained wrecked last night 8/15/15).

If you decide to continue straight rather than take the corridor lounge/booth area, you will eventually hit the dance floor anyways. From there, you can already see the view of San Francisco city. 

I was informed that the bar next to the dance floor is a new addition (since last year).

What I first notice when I walked in was how warm it was. I knew instantly that the lounge had no ventilation and perspiring before I hit the dance floor was a guarantee. Make a mental note: great time to wear less clothing if possible.

SERVICE
I did not encounter the staff very much, but the security and bartenders all seem pretty professional, fast and warm. No complaints there.

MUSIC
I was too preoccupied with my date, but I can definitely remember how horrible the DJ was. I sure hope he's not a resident there, otherwise I'd be sure to avoid this spot at all cost.
*Smooth Transitioning did not exist in this DJs skills.
*song selection would've been okay if he didn't kept playing the remixes/bootlegs rather than keeping to the originals (wouldn't hurt to play the originals rather than all remixes)
*I wonder if they know anything about bpm?
*and if I remembered correctly, there was both opener and closer (what are the chances to bomb with both DJs; I'm not sure if the DJs that spun on this night was selected by a promoter or a Director of Marketing, but let's try to invest a little more $$ for a more talented DJ and I know there are plenty in the bay will accommodate to your budget. Expand your horizons yo!)

(Luckily, I don't base my ratings on the DJ- otherwise I would give this place a 1 star)

VERDICT
It was an fun night. The company I was with made it fun. I wish i could've danced more, unfortunately the music transitions made by the DJ(s) was so off beat (and often sounds like it was thrown in randomly) that I couldn't dance for no more than 30 seconds that I spent most of the night standing and talking and sitting down and talking.
author: Cathy N.

description:
Went here to celebrate a birthday. When we receive the bill they OVERCHARGED US $600.00!!!!!!!!! They must of thought we extremely intoxicated and won't notice. We confronting the managed and he gave us 
a simple I'm sorry and automatic %20 gratuity was applied. Honestly will NEVER go back. San Fran is an amazing place with much better placing to go.
author: L J.

description:
I am someone who values kindness and beauty of spirit, and the Starlight Room embodies this. 

I'm an actor and singer, and a few weeks ago, my director invited me to join some of the cast at the Starlight Room on top of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel to celebrate our sold out friends and family opening night for our 20th Anniversary production of the hit musical comedy "I Love You, You're Perfect, Now Change." One cast member's mother was in town from Vegas, staying at the hotel, and I am so grateful for this introduction to this romantic and beautiful lounge.  It was surreal having a glass of champagne, and dancing high above a beautiful and foggy San Francisco below. I made a post on facebook about our experience, and to my surprise, the social media person for Starlight Room commented on my post, congratulating our production, and invited me to reach out next time, saying that I would be added to the guest list. 

Well, backstage, the night before our last performance, I asked my fellow cast members if we'd like to go again after our last show, to celebrate our successful 11 show run, and all were enthusiastic! 

I sent a message via facebook, this was very, very late in the wee hours of Friday night/Sat morning, and again to my surprise, I received a very kind and enthusiastic reply right away, welcoming our group and inviting me to email Linh Pham, director of food and beverage for Sir Francis Drake Hotel to work out details for my group. I requested a table, and a few bottles of champagne for our group, and sent a list of our guests, Linh's reply was so kind, I just had to include it below:

"Good evening Katherine,

Thank you so much for reaching out and contacting me about joining us on what sounds like such a momentous occasion.  First of all congratulations on such a successful run we are honored you have thought of us to celebrate again.  We look forward to hosting you and your guests.  We will absolutely extend our deepest curtesy and have express entry to all of your guests.  I personally will reserve a table for your arrival. I am on site tomorrow and will handle your reservation personally.  If for any reason you need any additional assistance or request please do not hesitate to reach out to me on my cell.  Again congrats on a great run, break a leg on the closing and get ready to have an amazing night. "

Linh made me feel like a dear friend in every communication, I was touched that he went so far as making his cell phone available to me, and made me feel in every communication, that I felt completely welcome, valued, and that our group would be cared for at every turn! 

That night, I put on my favorite little black satin dress, my favorite dancing heels, our group walked from the theatre to Union Square, and as we looked up, we could see a glimmering star atop the Hotel, and that is the disco ball of the Starlight Room! 

I had been given a bouquet of roses earlier that evening, so as we walked, we handed out some to strangers on the street. 

We took the elevator up, I was greeted by name at the door, "Oh! Yes, you're Katherine from the show!" on Saturday nights there is a coat check, so as we checked our coats and bags, our table was already prepared, the size of our group had changed from the original plan, but the staff rolled so smoothly with the change that it was as if we had originally planned that number of people. We were escorted past the beautiful bar and large black grand piano to a gorgeous table with tall velvet seats the deep romantic red color of rose petals, and much to my surprise, my jaw dropped to the floor, because the talented pastry chef at Sir Francis Drake had prepared a huge, gorgeous cake, complete with the lettering "Congrats on a Great Run!" 

I will try to post photos here, and you can see more on my instagram: @unhasoo. 

My fellow cast member turned to me, and said something along the lines of, "I feel like we're with George Clooney!"

The beautiful and delicious cake was a generous and unexpected gesture that was so appreciated by us. We were in total shock and awe at the hospitality shown to us. 

Our waitress and every staff member was attentive, lovely, all handsome, beautiful, sweet people. 

We sipped champagne, danced, Linh introduced himself to me, and I had the opportunity to thank him and the staff for making our night so memorable, and he told me about their upcoming direction for amazing performance experiences and exciting programming, which I anticipate will be magnificent too see come to life. 

The view on the dance floor is breathtaking. We met nice people in town from all over the world, people of all ages. 

I had a few roses left in my bouquet, so I gave one to our waitress, one to another manager, the woman at coat check, and to a few other guests at Starlight Room. 

I cannot think of a more romantic place in all of San Francisco to smile, and celebrate with the people I love most. 

Thank you, Linh and every one at Starlight Room!
author: Katherine P.

description:
Starlight Lounge is both good and awful.

The wonderful part of the Starlight Lunge is the view from the Starlight Lunge. It is magnificent. The location is the top floor of the very old Sir Francis Drake Hotel. 

The Saturday and Friday night music is now a disc jockey who plays r&b, rap, Justin Bieber,  Justin Timberlake.  The quality of the music changes from good to awful in a heartbeat depending on the whim of the dj. I did not care for it.

The Starlight Lounge was much better with live bands. Now the dj cover is $10. The live band cover was only $15.
author: Robert H.

description: Jay and ash are the SHIT great bartenders come on a Thursdays they play music that cuss #mixwithnyx
author: Nicole N.

description:
After we left the Cheaper Than Therapy stand up Comedy Show, we wanted to check out the Sir Francis Drake hotel and bar. They both are few feet away from each other so it was an easy walk. The hotel entrance is stunning. It reminded me of Chicago's The Drake hotel. 

First impressions let us imagine the Starlight Club would be more of a speakeasy. First impressions were proven wrong once the elevator doors opened. Music was bumping, a DJ was playing, people were dancing under the disco ball, it was definitely a party. Drinks were flowing. Everyone was having a good time.
author: Erin J.

description: Old school SF music and cocktail lounge. The atmosphere is authentic old SF and the music and drinks are top notch. Be forewarned, it's touristy and pricey but there are few places like it.
author: Tim A.

description: Went here with some friends yesterday it was the most fun I've had in a while the view is awesome I loved it!!!
author: Victoria A.

description: Some real aggressive dancers out there. Saw someone toweling himself off afterwards. We've all been there before. Good view of San Fran. Weird crowd.
author: Rachel J.

description: I have to say I was not expecting much at the "Sunday's A Drag" Show and Brunch in the Starlite Room, but really left having felt well entertained and pleasantly full on good food. We were impressed by the staff at the Starlite Room in particular Shane (Asst Manager). He helped me on a telephone inquiry earlier last week and introduced himself after the 2:00 pm performance. He was personable, informative and skilled at working with the public. We also appreciated the performers who I think actually love San Francisco...the City.
author: Dian K.

description:
Located on the top of the unique and legendary hotel Sir Francis Drake.   I need to quit drinking so much because I don't remember the evening...wait the door girl was a total knock out!  Tall blonde with gorgeous red Dior lip stick......the servers were eye candy!  I remember some Red Wine a cheese plate and old fashioned cocktail....oh yes it's all coming back before I blacked out.  I was dancing by myself and gyrating like a drunken fool...I think the DJ uploaded a video on Vine and hashtagged it #stupidwhitegirl 

Great people watching!  Impressive View of the City.  This place is nostalgic only the Real Deals "Get it"
author: Mary S.

description:
A group of 7 of my friends and I celebrated a regular ol' Saturday, by booking a VIP booth and dancing the night away. The service and experience was beyond exceptional that I had to write this review.

First off booking the VIP booth was extremely easy. Response was made in a timely manner, all of my questions were answered and all of my requests were accommodated.

The night of, the Floor Manager came downstairs to the lobby to meet us and whisk us up to the top floor, no line, no hassle-pure VIP treatment.

We were situated as requested, near the dance floor and had a great view. All the ladies were able to leave their coats at our security guarded booth while we spent most of our time dancing.

Our waitress was very accommodating and punctual. We thoroughly enjoyed all the drinks and food we ordered with no surprises when we ultimately received our bill. We felt our VIP night out dancing was well worth it!

Thank you Starlight Room! We will be back!
author: Maricele P.

description:
When one hears the words, "The Starlight Room" at the top of the Sir Francis Drake hotel, one has an image of timeless sophistication. One has expectations of wonderful service and classic, well made cocktails.

Not what we experienced at all.

We went up the The Starlight Room after seeing Wicked on Saturday night. First there was a $10 cover charge to get into the bar, which we paid, since we weren't ready for our night to be over. They took away our half empty bottles of water and said we couldn't bring them in. Ok, ok - they don't want anyone sneaking in booze let alone water that they can overcharge for.

The place was hopping. There were a couple different parties going on along with loud dance music. The music was great. It was turned up just one notch too high, though. And the DJ never even played a full song - 15 to 30 seconds of each song. Too sporadic.

I ordered drinks from the bar for 4 of us. $50 (pre tip) later, we went off to find a table, which we found. Hurrah!

Halfway through our cocktails, my husband puts his hand close to the candle and asks, "what's this?" Considering how dark it was, it took us a minute to realize it was a dirty (bloody) band-aid that he had pulled out of his cocktail.

After we all gagged for a moment, we got up to leave. We couldn't get anyone's attention to discuss, so we walked back up to the door to discuss with gentleman taking everyone's cover charge. We left our cocktails on the table as we weren't touching them again.

We showed him the bloody band-aid and told him what happened. All he asked was, "where's the drink?" When we told him they were on the table, he shrugged and just did not give a crap.

We walked out after paying $100 for what? A horrible, disgusting experience and truly poor customer service. But I guess if you are The Starlight Room on the 21st Floor of the Sir Francis Drake, you don't have to give a damn because people will still show up.

We went across the street to our hotel bar, where we had a great time without disgusting band-aids in our drinks and staff who seemed genuinely interested in all of us having a good time.

And no, I will not be returning to The Starlight Room. Ever.
author: Aimee B.

description: Such an amazing gem in San Francisco. None of our friends knew about this place but glad I came. Great drink selection (a bit pricy) but an amazing view. I can't wait to come back here to go dancing on top of the city. Seemed to have good music before we left. Will return.
author: Ranee W.

description: Fuck this place. Was a decent enough venue, nice view, sure. Bartenders suck. And, when it's time to go, you will be muscled out by asshole bouncers. Gotta pay your tab? No matter. Not welcome. Jerks. If you're a sheep or an idiot, go here.
author: Kees B.

description: I've been going to the Starlight Room for many years. It's my go-to place for the holidays. It's got that old school San Francisco feel and the views of the City are spectacular. However, this time was not one of my better experiences. I made a reservation for 15 over 4 weeks ago and asked about food options, (I'd been several times but always for cocktails) I was told they had appetizers. Last night they said they only had 3 items available, as they were out on of everything else. Really? Holiday time, place is packed, there's 15 of us and we're paying top dollar for cocktails and they only have a grilled cheese , crudités & burrata. $14 grilled cheese that was dry, $14 crudités that was a smattering of raw old veggies, 2 small bowls of hummus that looked like they slopped it into the bowl and some dry pita bread on one plate and some dry raisin bagel chips on the other plate. Half of my s ended up leaving to eat somewhere else. Wow not what I expected for such a high end place. I always rave about the Starlight Room but felt totally let down this time. Guess I'll be looking for a new place come next year.
author: Kim P.

description: We went for the Drag brunch last weekend.  Drag show was fun but the food was meh.....kinda pricey for what we paid.  Coffee was lukewarm and the buffet was too.  The only thing I would recommend was the roast beef.  Shoulda gone with the fresh omelette and that.
author: sally M.

description: Great place for an amazing view and great drinks.  Staff was very friendly!  Highly recommend on a clear day
author: Yvette S.

description:
I went here with a friend for a drink and to check out the place and whilst I was impressed with the view I was disappointed with the fact that the place was full of blokes and not enough women. I was not out looking and besides I had my gorgeous friend with me who was attracting a lot of attention lol

The ambience here is nice and they charge a $5 cover charge and the drinks are super expensive like $12 for a gin and tonic. The dance floor has a beautiful view and mirrored ceiling and a disco ball which is cool. The DJ was ok but nothing exciting. 

The place is a tad too dark for my liking  and once you start dancing you can feel the heat and I was sweating like crazy. They have a terrace but it was off limits and that made me feel claustrophobic. 

I would probably come back here but given the choice I would go try other places first.
author: Sam S.

description:
We were so happy with the VIP service and how Rikki who scheduled it made us feel throughout the process! The Starlight Room is swanky, kitschy, and cool, and the vibe was absolutely perfect for my wife's post-dinner birthday celebration! Great service (Colette was wonderful), great drinks, excellent music and dancing to truly spectacular views are the perfect elements to add up to a great time! The dance floor was very hot (as in steamy, as in there was actually evaporating water collecting on the glass windows) but it was roomy enough to accommodate the crowd comfortably and offered lots of energy. 

Something we noticed and truly appreciated was the eclectic mix of groups enjoying themselves here. The club brought together a veritable plethora of different races, ethnicities, ages, socio-economic status, body shapes and sizes, orientations and I'll bet there were even some vegetarians there! Seriously, from the very well dressed sexy people (of many races) to the break dancing older Korean gentleman at the next table to the group of large women in tight dresses to the couple that looked like they wandered off a farm, it took all types and all types were having a blast at this modern day speakeasy!

Very reasonably priced by comparison and well worth it, if you have a special night to celebrate, this is a highly recommended place to do it. The staff was perfectly dressed, styled and tempered to give the feel that among their ranks were Greta Garbo, Jessica Rabbit, all band members of the Big Bad Voo Doo Daddies, a young Jack Nicholson and every cool guy and girl you knew in high school. Our group came here at about 11:30pm after dinner at Waterbar and it was a perfect compliment to finish out the evening!
author: John T.

description:
I was staying at The Sir Francis Drake Hotel, which houses the Starlight Room, so I figured I should check it out. I figured, if nothing else, it is on the 21st floor and should have some great views. 

Being a Saturday night, they had a DJ and a cover. Be prepared to pay 10 bucks or 5 if you show your room key. This is certainly a place for a slightly older crowd looking for a fun club experience. I'd say most people were like me and over 30. You could tell they recognize this by the extensive bar selection that had plenty of quality liquor. While tempted by one of the 5 varieties of Macallan, I stuck with simple Hendricks and tonics. I got the same bartender each time and he gave great service and was practically pouring my drink by the time I'd reach him on each trip. Prices were typical of a hotel at $9.

Overall, this place has an old school lounge feel with plenty of felt booths, but I spent most of my time on the medium sized dance floor with an energetic crowd and DJ. The views are great, but not worth doing if they have a cover. If I'm looking for a place to dance the next time I'm in SF, I'd certainly come back, but would look to some place like Bourbon and Branch if all I was seeking was a cocktail lounge.
author: Zach C.

description:
Great place for drinks and small bites with a view of the city. Of course, it all comes at a higher price but with the scenic view and fun music it's a great once in awhile splurge and great spot to hang with friends. 

The food there is actually quite good. I tasted their fried Mac n cheese and their chocolate dessert and liked both. Portions are small so don't come with an appetite! As for the drinks I wasn't quite sure what to get so our waitress made a pretty good recommendation for me based on my likes. I forgot what it was but I enjoyed it :) FYI the menu on their website isn't always up to date and one time they did not have the ice cream on their menu that I wanted to try so you could be in for a bit of a disappointment.

The crowd is definitely older but the parties thrown by outside promoters bring in younger people so you'll get a good mixed crowd on those nights. It could get really packed and when it does good luck flagging down your waitress! We were ready to pay our bill and head out but she never came by. In the end we went to go find someone ourselves to take care of it for us. 

The times I went both with and without a reservation, weekday and weekend, I lucked out and got a table by the window. I would recommend making a reservation just to be sure you get a table and one by the window for a nice view. 

I haven't tried the brunch but it sounds like a fun thing to check out. Definitely in the evening Starlight is a nice spot to hang with friends and could be a romantic spot for couples as well!
author: Carnita M.

description:
I always wonder why this place isn't busier than it is when I go. But then again, I only find myself here during the week. I never really see promotion for the place (even from the djs). But it's a great place to lounge, go on a one on one date, and dance! 

When you arrive you come through the elevator, on the top floor of a hotel, fancy! When you walk in the bar is right in front of you. Does get a bit crowded, and there's only one bar. So know what you want before getting to the bartender. It's a big space. The dance floor is far from the bar, which is perfectly fine. 

The dance floor is amazing! You're over looking all of San Francisco(Windows everywhere). The view is great, and great music. The dance floor can be bigger. 20 people can make it packed already. 

I don't think the focus is to make this place popular/mainstream. Which I like! Because you can bring a one on one date and be able to talk. It's a great way to cap off a great night.
author: Gustavo A.

description: Went to see the Sunday afternoon brunch show.   Food was delicious- show was AMAZING.  Is definitely a must see if going to the city.
author: Genevia R.

description: Love the location, I love The View of the city, the people attending are always down to earth, grown and sexy.my only issue is... the DJ sucks!
author: Brandy L.

description: 2 stars for an amazing view, after that, the Starlight Room is a fail.  My husband has been wanting to take me to the Starlight Room for years, he grew up in SF.  We belong to the middle aged crowd, along with most of the crowd that was there.  The entrance fee was $10.00 each, ok fine, not really a big deal.  The coat check was $5.00 per coat....are you kidding me!  The music was gawd awful, people were shaking their heads and walking off.  The dj wasn't even looking at the crowd.  Its too bad, this could be a great place to spend an evening dancing, but the management is more worried about getting money for a coat than hiring a decent dj and playing age appropriate music.  30 minutes later, we couldn't take it anymore.
author: Heather V.

description:
This Lounge is located on the top of this historical hotel (Sir Francis Drake), it's very classic with some modern touches. Sometimes you feel like your lounging in the 1920's and 1930's and maybe you would run into a Don Draper lookalike. lol

I'm use to go going to the bars and lounges in Las Vegas so I'm use to chic and trendy. This would be nothing but a yawn to me but the 180 view of the city was breathtaking.

They have 3 different areas in the lounge:

1. Bar area: It's a bit small and it gets packed during the weekends because of the live bands and DJ. Bartenders are friendly but they have a limited selection, I tried to order an AMF but they were short on 2 liquors. Boo!! So I ended up order a Jack and Coke and sorry to say that was watered down! I can taste more coke then Jack, I ordered 2 more Jack and coke and sprite and I still felt no buzz. I was pissed but I didn't want to complain, so I just stuck with beer. I asked the bartender what kind of beer they have and he said, Coors Light, Budlight and Heinkein. 

Really? Just three different kinds of beers. 

Psssh!!

**WARNING** DON'T PAY WITH YOUR CREDIT CARD OR YOU'LL BE CHARGED $50, EVEN IF YOU BOUGHT ONE OR TWO DRINKS AND PAID LESS THEN $20. YOU'LL STILL BE CHARGED $50!! TOTAL BS!!


PAY CASH OR PREGAME BECAUSE THE DRINKS ARE WATERED DOWN!! 

2. Dance Floor: The size of the floor was meh and the DJ was lame playing music from 70's, 80's, 90's and some top hits. I was hoping he'd play some house or trance music but you can always get everything. Lots of tourist and Francisco locals here at the Denton Lounge. 

3. Table Area: One side of the lounge has an area to sit down and just relax with friends, spouse, bf, gf and etc... 

Great to have a conversation while having some fine wine or beer and admiring the Downtown Skyline, Union Square, Bay Bridge and from a distance you can see SFO.

I wouldn't mind coming back for the lounge and looking at the city view. The cover can be expensive at $10 for what you get here but hotels guests get in free if you show your room key.
author: Paul B.

description:
Love this place go at least once a year, 
 so fun crazy great view! Always hot though great music view is amazing before the windows fog up!!
author: Mina G.

description: This is a fantastic bar to visit when in San Francisco, even better if your staying at the Sir Francis Drake.  The bartenders are great, the view from the 21st floor is good and they have a hopping dance floor and good vibes throughout the club.  I will be coming back whenever in the city.
author: Kelly P.

description:
Very nice, quaint place with some superb views of the city. The photos don't really do it justice because there is a Macy's out one side that doesn't look too attractive, but the views go 360 degrees around the room and some of the historic buildings you can see off to the south are gorgeous.

3 stars because I wasn't impressed with their "signature" drink - the Cable Car - it sounded sweeter than it ended up being. Maybe that's just me. The service was very courteous and attentive, but the price is really expensive just for drinks, but we determined it was worth it for the views. At 9pm they bring in a DJ and the place gets more of a loud, nightclub feel, but it's a cool place to hang out.
author: Josh E.

description: On the 21st floor of the sir Francis drake hotel is this wonderful starlight room.  Being in my 30s I can't just go to the places I used to go to get a nice a drink and dance. The bartenders were nice and the drinks were good.  I had rum punch? I think one was enough! The music was not for everyone. I enjoyed it due to liking music from the 70s.  It was an older crowd, but it was def better than dealing with the prepubescent minded individuals just out to get a number and saying how great you are, though you only stated what city you're from.  amazing night for the young at heart. Cheers!
author: Sonja P.

description: I will be totally honest and say this place customer service was extremely rude!!! Do not go here !! The host who was an older black gentlemen, seemed to be gay, was very , very rude!! I overheard him accuse the other guests of removing his reserved table sign. He then accused my friends and I of taking his signs.. He was very argumentative, accusatory, ghetto, low class, verbally aggressive and hostile.  We were still being polite and he still treated all of us with a very nasty attitude!! He proceeded to kick us out because we told him he was unnecessarily  rude!! I cannot imagine that why he still has a job there!!  I feel sorry for all the guests and staff that has to deal with him everyday!!  On top of all this, this place is old, and smells like mildew.
author: Ally N.

description: Where do I start!...Tried to celebrate my bday with some dancing but the Dj sucked so bad no one really was dancing. He didn't even know how to do a request or a bday shout out. He had no idea what he was doing! His music sucked. His mixing sucked. It's really to bad because the location is really great. This place needs to hire better Dj's!!!!
author: christine a.

description:
The views are spectacular and the DJ that was there played all the best jams and there was plenty of room to move and dance, but the drinks are SO EXPENSIVE! My partner and I had two cocktails each (Moscow Mule and Old Fashions) and the bill was $60...

That is my only complaint but everything else was pretty great.
author: Nicole G.

description:
I attended Sunday Drag brunch many times before, for the 11am sitting, and have enjoyed it. So for my bday, I decided to take a group of my friends. When making the reservation, I reserved for the 2pm sitting.
I was uninformed, that if I booked that time, I should arrived earlier to have my guest, and myself eat...one of my guest, literally walked into the kitchen to ask for food. 
Once talking to the manager, he seemed insulted that we asked for an explanation, (he did discount our ticket) but After paying a bill, well over $600, I had to pay to take everyone to eat elsewhere.
I love the drag brunch, I've been there plenty before, in the morning, I was looking for the amazing experience, for myself on my bday, and my guest. Unfortunately, that wasn't the case this time. 

For future, I think a reminder to come early to eat, would be ideal.

I've try to contact the manager again, and no success, I've been ignored...
author: Cisco M.

description:
This review is for the 2016/2017 party - 
AWFUL
The price  VIP $250 per ticket - what do you get ?
1) private bar - BUT the line was longer than the non- VIP bar
2) Alcohol- there was some top shelf liquor, however the champagne was swill.  It was not even their house sparkling.  - I drank nothing 
3) Food - originally  the event boasted: Cold seafood buffet, dessert cart, cheese & charcuterie options - NOTHING 
4) Organization -  The door was very poorly organized- we initially received the wrong wrist band.  They doorman had no scanners for the electronic tickets. 
5) DJ- who was this guy ?!?! The crowd was mid - thirty to sixties......when the DJ played Michael Jackson, 80's music or classic hip hop the dance floor would fill up.  But it seemed like right at the moment the crowd was getting into a groove he mixed in something that cleared the floor. I've never experienced anything like it !! 
6) Good points - not overly crowded, excellent view, good confetti poppers that covered the dance floor at midnight 

I'll be back to the Starlight Room for a drink and the view.  But never for an event.
author: The Entrepid M.

description:
What a great place to have brunch. The food and service was excellent. The hostess was attentive and friendly. And the drag show was top of the line entertainment.

Food - Buffett style. Great variety and well cooked food. Chicken and waffles. Eggs Benedict. Omelette station. Bacon bacon bacon. Fruit. Sweet goodies. 

Hostess - set the tone for brunch by being personable and attentive to all tables. And compliments to her style. She was stunning. 

Drag Show - for started the drag hostess was INCREDIBLE! Funny, charming, talented...I could go on forever. All the queens put on a show that killed. They stayed by the entrance after the show to take pictures and were sassy and fabulous. I'd easily come back again and pay the $60. It's worth it. Mimosas were $11 

Atmosphere is nice. Views of the city are amazing. Very old school and retro, but well kept and maintained. On the 21st floor.
author: Tanya B.

description: I was very disappointed not being able to get tickets for New Years celebration , as a hotel guest who pays $500 a nigh you would think it's not gonna be a problem,but think again. Other then that I always enjoy my time here, very fun and entertaining drag queen show for brunch every Sunday, even took pictures with them after the show,brunch food was just average almost boring.
author: Anastasia F.

description: Came here on a Saturday night around midnight. Didn't order any drinks or stay long but the dance floor was hoppin with a DJ and decent music. Seems like a fun place to go for a night out dancing, while being able to avoid the packed clubs.
author: Roya K.

description:
What a Drag! Most of the gals were entertaining. Some of the ensembles could have been more entertaining to me if the choice of music were to have been more upbeat. It seemed as if most of the audience did enjoy the entire show.  The gals definitely did interact with the crowd quite a bit.  They did not discriminate against genders, which made it fun. 

As for the food, it was simply delicious! My favorite was the salmon with cream cheese on toasted bread.  There were a variety of foods to accommodate everyone's diet.  

Although I will not be visiting Sunday's Drag again, I will definitely recommend others to step outside their boxes and give it a try.
author: Suzy H.

description: First review ever( bartender) do not typically write reviews. WATCH OUT! I was charged for $600 of champagne I did not order. When confronted about the situation, no apologies, just automatic 20% gratuity(  wow, it was also my birthday, and they knew that). Management completely unapologetic, great location! TERRIBLE SERVICe & management.
author: Jeremiah J.

description:
My roommate had her birthday brunch here (for the Sunday's a Drag show) and I thought it was a great way to celebrate!  The buffet brunch had a good selection.  There was bacon, salads, eggs benedict, potatoes, an omelet station, and mini pastries.  The drinks, unfortunately, were not a part of the deal.  The average price of a cocktail was $11.

And I thought the ladies rocked the show!  I wish it was longer.  As the hostess said, they've been doing the show for 8 years so they're doing something right.

I should mention that there were 13 of us, so we were charged with a 23% service fee.  I thought the standard was 18% for parties over 6... we didn't question it.  I do recommend this place, but be sure you have about 4 in your party.
author: Vira P.

description:
Pretty view!
We pretty much took the elevator all the way up, looked out the window, and took the elevator all the way back down.
It had expensive drinks and seemed like a 40 year old and up dancing club.
Too clubby for me.
It's too bad though, because a drink while looking at that view would have been nice.
author: Vicky S.

description: Absolutely fantastic! We were in San Fran this past week for our honeymoon and husbands 40th birthday and the Starlight Room was one of the highlights of our trip! We stopped by twice once for after dinner drinks and the view and then on Saturday night for dancing and drinks with DJ Walt Liquor. We had the time of our life! I wish we would could remember our waitresses name because she is the best we have ever had!! Keep up the good work!!
author: Marilyn P.

description: The service wasn't so great even though it wasn't particularly busy when we arrived on a Friday night around 8pm. It helps to have reservations because the place does get packed quickly.  The views are amazing and its great for a romantic setting. However; I found the decor drab and tacky.
author: B P.

description:
I had purchased tickets to the New Years Event on Eventbrite, but me and my two friends got sick and were unable to go. I wrote them an Email which said I was sick and to ask for a refund and they flat out refused. Even though they were no where near sold out and were still selling tickets.

Clearly a greedy and non-caring business. Will never go there again.
author: Angel J.

description:
We just had the best time at their brunch drag show. We went to celebrate my friends birthday and I'm already thinking up reasons to go again!!! Here is why you need to go:

1. The food was delicious! A great variety of real food, not Leggo waffles. Bacon, sausage, smoked salmon, variety of parties, omelette bar, etc. very good. 
2. The staff is pleasant, friendly and attentive. 
3. The show is SO MUCH FUN! It was racy, yet classy. They work the room, so everyone has a good seat. They 'play' with the males in the audience, but nothing too sexual or offensive. I'll the women in the show are great, but we really enjoyed Donna Sachet and Hollata Tymes.

Donna is funny and sincere. She is a star. Holatta is a hoot! She is fun to watch and really interacts with the audience. 

I can't wait to go back and I really recommend this show for a great and entertaining Sunday brunch.
author: Susan H.

description: They don't deserve one star. Worst customer service ever. They are so rude here. Why even waste your money in this establishment?
author: Devina G.

description: I finally made it here for the first time after living 22 years in the neighborhood. The space is absolutely gorgeous as is the ambiance and the breathtaking views. I wasn't however impressed at all by the bar staff, except for the Asian man that first helped me. He was friendly and professional. The other two gingery hipster looking dudes with their fancy hair cuts both acted like they couldn't be bothered. If I'm paying $14 for cocktails I would at least like to be treated like a welcome guest and not like you're bothered by my presence. (even a simple hello and thank you would have gone a long way). In spite of the aloof service, we had a nice time. Sadly I likely won't be going back any time soon, unless a really special occasion arises and my guests insist on going. I'll just make sure to steer clear of certain bar staff.
author: Mister F.

description:
I came here to see Hubert Keller so I can't really say what it's like on a regular night. The venue itself is kind of small, but you do get spectacular views of the city, and the interior has a cool Art Deco style design. It was really nice to grab a table and enjoy the view and music. There weren't too many people so we were able to move around on the small dance floor also.

I really wasn't expecting Hubert Keller to be such an energetic DJ. He seemed so composed on Top Chef Masters, but the man behind Fleur de Lys knows how to party! He was fist pumping, clapping, dancing, and was just really getting into it. There also was a live saxophonist that played along with Keller's EDM set, which added a cool acoustic effect. His energy was infectious, and it looked like everyone had a good time. I know I did. Now I feel more inclined to try his restaurants. 

I also want to apologize to the pretty, blonde waitress for questioning her about whether I got the correct drink. I feel like such a dick. Sorry.
author: Nei N.

description: I'm writing this as I sit here and have sat here for 45 minutes without being acknowledged by a server. I went to the bar to order and received a less than welcoming response. Place is outdated. Other than the view, which you can stop by to see, I wouldn't waste your time. Pro- no cover to see the view, con- just about everything you wouldn't want for your bar experience. Recommendation- Stop by, see the view and go somewhere else!  This just in, we stopped a server and asked about service. She explained this isn't her section and she thinks our server is having a bad night. Then she said at least she hopes that's the case. Ha!
author: Corey J.

description:
The Harry Dean Stanton Starlight Room has always been a good-ol time for drinking, dancing, and humanity-watching.  

The view from the front, back, and even restroom windows is incredible, and not just your ability to peer into rooms on many floors of the adjacent Marriott, but your vista of much of SF.  

The diversity of ethnicities present, as well as age groups, makes the place all that more interesting. Seems to be about 50:50 tourists:locals, with "locals" being anyone who drove or took BART there for the night, as opposed to flying in from somewhere.  

Dance floor features everyone from 21 to 80 having a good time.  Stiff drinks, friendly staff... yeah, it all clinches the deal.
author: Erik S.

description: I came in Friday night for the first time hoping for amazing experience. The view was great but there was a mishap with the bill and when I asked for the manager who's supposed name is Chris he never came around. I waited for an extensive amount of time to get no response. Thanks for the view, but the slow service is not up to par for the price.
author: J A.

description:
I enjoyed my time here! 

There was a $10 cover, but they accepted cash, credit and debit! 

The view is AMAZING. You can see a panorama of the city!

The drinks were good!

The music at times was a bit outdated and slow, but I went with a fun group of people so we found a way to make do with the dance mix. 

Another slight complaint is that my sister put in at least two song recommendations, and the DJ played none of them... 

Also, the dance floor is a bit too small. 

Overall I can't complain tooo much though since I had a great time! I wouldn't mind returning to starlight room for another dance-filled night, although I'd definitely like to explore other lounges/night clubs first.
author: Shalini P.

description: Shane, Patricia and Collete were great but the DJ was not only rude but made us pay to request a song? We flew here from LA to celebrate a bachelorette party, had table service, spent over 1k and it was nothing but disappointment. Sorry to say but please don't waste your time.
author: Eugene J.

description:
Required visit if you're in San Francisco for the evening. 

Great 60's cocktail lounge vibe here, and great views of the city. You probably won't spend the whole night here, but you have to have at least one drink.
author: Kt G.

description: Starlight lounge - what a gorgeous view and wonderful atmosphere however we reserved with a guarantee spend of $300 for what we thought would've a fabulous night of dancing . Rap .. Rap and yet more Rap . When we requested some disco music or something you can actually dance to we were told "no he could not possibly play that kind of music to this crowd" by the arrogant , rude DJ . Who did he think this crowd was ? we were a big group and he insulted us and continued with more Rap , Rap  ....So I think I will never go back .. Music was just awful , awful .
author: Sandra F.

description:
My friend was slipped drugs in her cocktail; thank God I was there! Ladies, watch your drinks! I don't care how expensive they are, buy your own!! 
*** an edit to my original note. This happened quite some time ago. The Starlight Room is an iconic representation of our City...very cosmopolitan. We will return!! We've learned to be vigilant. If you see something, say something.
author: A R.

description: I thought the effort put into the show was fantastic, but there was so much slow music played. I didn't need to be put back to sleep during this mornings brunch. I didn't know what to expect, but I was pretty entertained. I've been to other shows at home in LA that I also love. Food was exceptional, but at $60 per person, I expected a little bit more. Mixed cocktails were $12-13 and made with a nice kick! My total bill came out to about $110 after tax and tip. I wouldn't exactly come back, but I'm glad I went! View was amazing!
author: Sandy T.

description:
Santa here!

I visited the lounge Friday and Saturday night to check out what all my elves were raving about.  Wow!  The place is classy, like the old style lounges of 50 years ago. I was impressed by Derick the manager and all of the beautiful staff. 

Most of the guest come dress to the nines, which of course, added it's charm all the more.

Two birthday parties, 100 photos and a few drinks, plus dance, dance and more dancing - Santa was happy. 

Go there and enjoy life.


Merry Christmas!

Santa
.
author: Santa C.

description:
I believe I tweeted, "Brunch, cocktails, and drag queens performing 'I touch myself' Happy Sunday to me!" following Sunday's a Drag brunch at Harry Denton's Starlight Room. 

It's a decent brunch selection with a made-to-order omelet station. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LzE02ibQ8hQR7cm2us3rfg?select=vERjfE8hEAqDta1BuCnlqg) The buffet included eggs Benedict, salads, breakfast sausage & bacon, smoked salmon, deviled eggs, roast beef, pastries, fruit and more. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LzE02ibQ8hQR7cm2us3rfg?select=HPSnD-4yp9TAHR2xPgHlcg) Coffee, tea, and juices are also included but you should probably grab a cocktail before the show. 

It is a really fun experience and a nice way to spend a weekend. The jokes can be slightly naughty but tame by regular drag show standards so first-timers need not worry. Just bring your sense of humor and an open mind and let the girls entertain you. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LzE02ibQ8hQR7cm2us3rfg?select=pOWaMHboevBXLdTPa8V4Wg)

All in all, Sunday's a Drag is good clean fun that is also just oh so San Francisco. I mean come on... brunch, cocktails, and drag queens performing "I touch myself." Happy Sunday to me!
author: Jon L.

description:
Love this bar!!! A classy place with the best group of bartenders, great drinks, fun DJ and dancing...not to mention the view (it's located on the 21st floor of the Sir Frances Drake hotel). Each time my Mom, sisters and I visit San Francisco we end up at this bar and have the best time. It's great for all ages, and in prime location next to Union Square.

Bar manager, Ryan Hall, and his crew of fabulous bartenders- David, Kenny, and Jay are spot on! They all make great drinks and we've had nothing but over the top service every time we've been there. Hands down my favorite bar in San Francisco. I definitely recommend the Starlight Room if you are looking for a nice spot to have great drinks and dancing.

We will definitely be back next time we visit the city! Thank you Starlight Room! :)
author: Marissa H.

description: One word. Amazing. This is most definitely the best view from a bar/club/restaurant I've ever been.
