Top of the Kimpton property, The Sir Francis Drake (amazing also), it's an amazing vibe in reds with stunning views. Had apps and a few drinks earlier in the day. Delicious. Returned later in the evening for dancing. Amazing again. Your dancing right next to a window peering out over the city. I will be back 100%
author: C F.

description: Have never encountered such a rude and condescending doorman as the one working the Starlight Room, this evening. You should be concerned about how you treat hotel guests. This hotel has likely lost our business, due to his antagonizing treatment . @kimpton #kimpton
author: Jeudi B.

description:
Location: Starlight Room, San Francisco, California, 9pmish, Friday night.

DoorRobot: You gotta take off your baseball cap to come in.

Me: I don't play baseball.

DoorRobot: That's a baseball hat.

Me: No, It's a Taco Hat. And it's part of my outfit.

DoorRobot: Well you have to take it off if you wanna come in.

Me: Well I'm meeting a friend and she already ordered me a drink so you'll have to inform her that you are refusing my business because of my Taco Hat.

DoorRobot: Let me talk to my manager.

ManagerRobot: You need to take off your hat. The rules are right here. We are trying to keep this place classy.

Me: Classy joints don't have posted rules. You need to take off your pants. This is fun.

ManagerRobot: I'm trying to negotiate with you.

Me: No, you are trying to undress me. My outfit is only negotiable if you are willing to take off your pants, first. That's how this works.

ManagerRobot: This negotiation is over, you need to leave.

Me: Fantastic, I see my friend coming now. Your place sucks and I wouldn't stay if you paid me. We were only coming here as a joke anyway. You lose.
author: merkley m.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night around 10pm and the line wasn't very long so I thought the place wasn't that busy, WRONG. Once we made it up the elevator to the 21st floor we saw how many people there actually were.  We waited in another small line where our ID was checked and luckily didn't have to pay the cash cover since we were on a guest list. Thanks Sebastian! This place is gorgeous! I definitely felt fancy as we were walked over to the table where he had bottle service. Everyone that worked here were all dressed very classy and had great customer service skills, checking back often to see if we needed anything. 

The starlight room has a great view of downtown. It looked beautiful as all the buildings outside were lit up against the dark foggy sky. I'm sure it's equally as beautiful around dinner time here. There are plenty of tables and seating that are reserved for bottle service. The dance floor is a little small so I'd definitely recommend getting a table with a group of friends. Otherwise you'll be stuck on the dance floor the whole night where it started to get really hot and cramped. Around 11 it was so hot the windows were fogging up and you could no longer see outside. 

I've read that there's generally an older crowd here but on this night there was a good mix of younger and older.  It was a lively crowd and the music was good. The DJ played top 40 and that's what I like!
author: Cassandra C.

description: This bar wouldn't let us in because too many colored people.  I'm white but my group was not.  I have no other rationale as the bouncer only said he couldn't let us in
author: Ari V.

description: I don't really care about the food or drink - the view is awesome, and it is a great place to go dancing.
author: Greg F.

description:
Review of "Sunday's a Drag":  
I would give 4 stars, but added another star for just what it was, and how hard they try to please their clientele.  The cast is small, just 4 people, but since there are a lot of costume changes it seems like 20.  The MC and performer, Donna Sashay, was hilarious.  She quickly engaged the audience and had us laughing from the git go.  We were a bus load of folks from Petaluma, some 50 in all, and she made great sport of that pretending to have never heard of our town.  The show lasts about an hour, but was a lot of fun.  They are trying to establish the show as a San Francisco experience, and they depend a lot on word of mouth recommendations to advertise the show.

Review of the brunch.  
The buffet, preceding the show, was first rate.  It was a full on brunch, including a omelet station featuring custom made to order omelets.  Plus prime rib cut to order. There was salads, desserts, and coffee.  Included was a cocktail of our choice, and my Bloody Mary was too strong but that was my fault for not choosing the mimosa or other choices.  

Overall, the fixed price of $45 for everything.  It was a good value, including food, show, tax, tip, and alcohol.  The entertainers sat at the door after the show to chat with the crowd and pose for pictures.  Nice touch!
author: Marshall W.

description: To add to the negative New Year's reviews on this venue's list: Champagne was included in our ticket price but nowhere to be found. Bartenders poured, but advised we should contact management for a refund. Shane, the manager was contacted, and he agreed to refund, but never followed through. He went completely MIA despite follow-up phone calls and messages. I'm now contesting this charge with my credit card company, the results of which are as yet to be determined. Anyway, long and the short of it: This business does not follow through on its advertisements and agreements, nor on its customer service promises. If you go here or buy tickets for any event, do so at your own risk. Although I love the venue, given this bad experience and the better understanding I now have of what runs their show, I won't be able to return.
author: Corey L.

description: Despite us calling ahead, the manager refused half of party when the place was not crowded. He told me he had "the right to refuse anyone." He did not give any reason why but refused half my 30th birthday party crowd. By far the most disrespectful establishment I have ever been to especially because they used race as a reason to turn people away. Very disappointing especially because I used to love it there.
author: Judy T.

description:
My friend and I went for the first time the other day.  We mainly wanted to see the view and have drinks - so this review doesn't include food.  On first impression, the place looks fancy, but after you settle in and begin to look around, you actually see that the place is old and needs refreshing.  There's a delicate balance of elegance and tacky-drag queen-cheapness about the decor.  The place is more or less clean, but I did notice dust on the vents on the ceiling.

We ordered drinks from the bar and the staff were courteous and professional.  I bought a glass of champagne and paid with my credit card and noticed they do a $50 authorization every time the card is swiped.  Keep that in mind because if you order 3 drinks, your account will temporarily have a debit of $150 until the actual fee of say... $30.. posts to your account on the following business day.  That's a big deal if you have checks coming through or are on a budget.

Anyhow, it feels like the place is more of a tourist trap than anything.  The venue doesn't really command the price of the drinks.  It's nice to go there for the view and have a drink or two, but that's about all it's worth.
author: Shaun W.

description:
Awesome Parties with Coworkers & Friends in a Truly Eclectic Space!

SITREP

I usually don't find myself partying in Union Square to be honest.  That usually happens in SOMA or the HAIGHT.  However, when work events (Conventions: GAG) or even holiday soirees in downtown San Francisco end early, it's often fun to be able to just traipse through the Union Square Hood and head to the Starlight Room (even better if there was an early evening of Ice Skating mixed into an early night, and now it's refreshment time!)

SETUP

The Starlight Room is located on the 21st Floor of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel, and it is a TOTAL TRIP back in time to a more swanky, quasi-speakeasy feel.  I love it.

The music is usually cranking a wonderful mix of oldies, disco and some retro, along with the mainstay of pop and R&B.  [Note:  if you are looking for a rave, house or really young clientele, this is NOT your place.]

WORK CREW

There is something here that a very diverse group of coworkers will enjoy here:  music, plush surroundings, comfortable seats, private alcoves, sparkly dance floor, astounding drinks, pleasant eye candy of all ages, genders, and denominations. ;)

HOURS

Unless you are part of a private event, you are pretty much out of luck getting in on a Monday Night.  [sometimes I wish I could since I would like to start here in the early evening, and then I just end up at DNA Lounge for Death Guild which goes late.]  But this is why it's important to check the calendar ahead of time so you won't be disappointed.  

SPECIAL EVENTS

They have a very cool Drag Brunch on Sundays, and most nights you can enjoy the mixing stylings of DJ Dave Gillis.  So it's hard to go wrong if you are looking for something that everyone will find a piece of that they really like at different times of the week.  

THE LOWDOWN

I really do love the Starlight Room, brought to you by Harry Denton.  :D
author: Michelangelo S.

description: Went to Sunday brunch. My first drag experience and it was a blast. The host was awesome and very funny. The other drag performances were also very entertaining. I've read a few negative reviews about the food and I completely disagree. The brunch was one of the best. They had a wide variety of options from fruit, bruschetta, bacon, sausage, omelette etc. The corn beef was amazing!!! Worth every penny!
author: Derek Y.

description:
Came here with my sissy for Sunday's a Drag ($44.95 per person, not including gratuity).  Made reservations for the 12PM show and brunch was served at 11AM.  Reservations are probably recommended since the place is somewhat small and most tables were filled up when we were there.  

The starlight room itself was pretty and gaudy; old school like.  Tables were a bit close and space was cramped.  I was also a bit disappointed that I didn't really get to see the view since all the curtains were down.  

Food itself was presented nicely, but it was just okay.  The buffet area was small and I wish they had a bigger selection.  They had an ommelette station, a carving station, and platters of french toast, eggs benedicts, chicken and waffles, pastries, fruits, sausages, bacon, and salads.  I know, listing it out sounds a lot, but it really wasn't   

The show itself was quite entertaining and they really try to make you laugh.  Not sure if I'll come back though, trying it out once is kind of good enough for me.  

20% gratuity will be included on your bill, regardless of party size.
author: Samantha C.

description: Went here for Sunday Drag Brunch. We made reservations for 11 people, (a week prior) but unfortunately they sat us at 3 different booths, all apart, facing the walls, not the stage. Very disappointing. We were told our original table for 11 was given away to another party in error. We did arrive a little late, about 20 mins before the show started, but still giving our reservations away is unacceptable. Also, they ran out of food so make sure you get their early otherwise you'll be stuck paying $60 for green salad, bacon and sausage only. I give it 3 stars because the performance was amazing, fun and the manager did give us free champagne and a discount on the tab to make up for everything.
author: Jenelle A.

description:
SF spot that you have to go to at least once in your lifetime! I love what they've done to the place, it's much nicer than the old Starlight room. The food is....hmmm... to be expected for a hotel on Powell St. - it's OK! Not saying it's bad but I just wasn't "Wowed" that's for sure. But honestly, let's get to the real reason I go here... That AMAZING view of my beautiful city!! It really is breathtaking and having a cosmo with my girls, listening to top 40s feel good music, atop a downtown somewhat swanky (work with me here) hotel, staring out into the BEST CITY in the world (clearly I'm a native) - you just can't beat that w/ a bat! :) 

I'll likely come back again if I have to take out fam or friends from out of town... like I said, you just have to see it at least once in your lifetime!
author: Christine L.

description:
Had an awesome bachelorette brunch here at the "Sundays are a Drag" brunch. We got a table right near the center of the room, and had a great time watching and interacting with the fabulous drag performers. It is a VERY interactive show :o) Host Donna Sashay is funny and charming, and the other performers were equally hilarious and engaging. My favorite was probably Cassandra Cass because she's pretty much Real Life Jessica Rabbit. Plus, her costumes were gorg.

The brunch part was super yummy too. Eggs benedict, prime rib carving station, chocolate covered strawberries, a variety of pastries, salads, and other breakfast items (bacon, canadian bacon, sausage, eggs, etc.). We also made sure to order plenty of mimosas as well. That really adds to the experience ;)

Got to take pics with the performers afterwards as well. LOVED IT!
author: Evonne L.

description: Well Sunday definately wasn't a drag!  Took my mom to see the Starlight Lounge's Sunday brunch Drag performance. Call ahead and schedule reservations for the show.  I called the Tuesday before and are seats were ok but the space is a lil tight since it's only set up for this on Sundays. It's a base fee of $60 per guest for brunch and to see the Queens perform. We went to the 11:30am show,  you show up at 10:30 when they start up the elevators for the top 21st floor at Sir Francis Drake Hotel, and brunch buffet starts at 11. There was a good selection of food. Salad,  carrots,  bacon,  sausage,  corn beef and hash, oatmeal,  omelet bar,  and pastries. There's plenty of food to go up again. All that's included in your base price but you then pay for any alcohol you order,  tax,  and gratuity. Everything for the two of us with drinking a carafe of bellini's and tip was $200. A carafe was definately too much for two because by the end of the show I was almost drunk but had a great time and the hostess of the show was funny and entertaining and the ladies were hott, especially the first one,  she looked like more of a woman than me!  :P It was an overall fun experience.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Was here on a Thursday to catch the sunset with a few cocktails. Great service and though we only caught a few numbers, the blonde singer was really good! Will be back to hear more of the music
author: Jenny A.

description:
Two drink minimum per guest per table. Our blonde snooty waitress was kind enough to remind us repeatedly. She wouldn't even bring glasses of water unless we ordered drinks.  She then got an attitude when we closed the bill without buying all 18 drinks. We had a party of 9 people. Two of them couldn't or didn't want to drink for one reason or another (designated driver, pregnant). Other than the blonde waitress's nasty demeanor. The music was great. The drinks were made well. All the other staff there were very helpful. From the man that checked id's, to the coat check lady, to the maitre d, to the bartenders.  I've been here several times and never encountered such a rude waitress. 

So the low star rating is purely based on her service. 

I'll be back but won't be getting a table...
author: Keith E.

description: This place was amazing! I planned a surprise birthday bottle service with Chis Cashin and he did an amazing job of setting us up. Perfect view of the whole city and the Service was perfect. Always made sure we were taking care of with everything we needed. The DJ was exactly what we needed. We were all in our early to late 30's and the music felt like it was catered to us. Awesome dark red lighting but not too dark. Highly recommend this place. We had a blast. I do recommend staying in the rooms in the hotel as well. The Hotel made her birthday extra special in so many ways.  Not gonna lie just having to head downstairs to go to bed was a real treat. Thank you Starlight Room we are definitely gonna come back
author: Wade Y.

description: I don't like to rip a place apart, but what happened to the Starlight Room? It's super pricey to reserve a table and the drinks were crappy.  We came to dance and the DJ was terrible.  I mean terrible.  Very disappointing.
author: brigitte m.

description:
What can I say except I never laugh out loud or LOL and I did this Sunday morning!
What a fantastic performance, I had the time of my life.  We even met Harry and he is larger than life! 

The food was very good, the service outstanding, but we didn't go for the food or service, that was an added bonus, we went for the performance and we will go back when we visit San Francisco again.

The performers were engaging, entertaining, talented and beautiful.  The majority of the patron's were women, stagette's, birthday's or celebrating something a special occasion.  Don't wait for a special occasion, take your lover, your best friend or your parents, it's a hoot!

Can't wait to go back!
author: Denni P.

description: Nice view and interior with an old world hotel charm and plush red booths. The crowd is mostly tourists but still worth coming as the venue is great. Our waitress was extra rude and she kept on bringing us bills that were higher than what we ordered and didn't state anything apart from the final number which suggests it is their (her?) usual way of adding stuff you didn't order and enforcing high tips she didn't deserve. This practice should seriously be looked into by the management.
author: Aga K.

description:
The show was really fun, I wish it had been longer and had more than 4 performers...
The food was meh....the potatoes were boiled and mixed with what seemed to be leftover tough corned beef. There was hardly anything vegatarian, which is hard to do at a buffet.
The salmon sliders were tasty...
I think it was a bit overpriced
author: Chris H.

description:
There doesn't seem to be a separate category for the "Sunday's a Drag" brunch, so note this review is for the Sunday brunch not for a nighttime drink.  

First off the food is great.   Arugula salad was amazing and a "pastrami salmon" should not be missed.  So just the brunch is worth it.    The drag show is amusing at best - as the performers largely lip synch with the exception of the hostess.  There's the usual "make the bald dad in the corner uncomfortable" gag and the "is anyone here from out of town" sort of cliche stuff.   It's an "only in San Francisco" experience but come mostly for the food and the fun.  Would recommend.
author: Bill W.

description:
Oh how I do love the starlight room!!!!

This was my 5th or 6th time here. A definite must for me when I go to union square. This is one of the best views in SF.

We arrived around 1pm on Sunday after some shopping. What a great choice! It was drag queen Sunday, like all Sunday's! We were seated at the bar & offered prime seats for the show for free! Nice!!!!!!

The bartender was great. He asked where we were from. Me, being a resident of the east bay was not nearly as interesting as my friend from Idaho. Why!?!? Because the owner is from Idaho. He came over about 5 minutes later, told us some stories & bought us a round. How very awesome is that? 

Such a great time at the starlight room, as always! A must go place in union square.
author: Laurie R.

description:
The room was still beautiful and the drinks delicious.  But when I get dressed up and spend $14 for a cocktail, I want to feel like a grownup.  Granted it was the week before Christmas, but since when are troops of screaming children welcome in an upscale cocktail lounge.  There were a couple of large families.  Several of the kids were crawling around underfoot, some were playing games on the dance floor.  The games involved a lot of squealing and running. The waitress was nicely dressed and glamorous, but the man who cleared the next table was dressed like a slob - shirttails hanging out, no vest, jacket or tie.  

This place should decide what it wants to be: either a swanky evening spot with very expensive drinks and a sophisticated atmosphere or a playground, but not both.
author: Linda S.

description:
So, considering I came here on halloween  which may be a bit bias considering the place was more packed for an event than usual. I went there that night for a friends combo Halloween/ 30th bday party and the party was too fun. The space is pretty small for the amount of people they packed into the event. The promoters also give discounts for admission to some people but not others even if you are in the same party, so that was lame! For a party of 15, my friend got a table which gave us ladies some breathing space from the small dance floor and sweaty people. 

I didn't see any views. All I saw were the surrounding buildings of union square, but maybe I was at the wrong part of the lounge. Overall, music didn't start getting great til half way through when they played classic hip hop tunes that got the people moving. 

The costumes were great to see on everyone. It was fun seeing how creative people are. The hostess of our table was gracious and dressed very nicely. She was great at her job. 

I'm not sure if I would come here again, without a specific reason like a friends birthday but you got to try everything once, right?
author: Ramla J.

description:
Classy spot for a drink, or three. 

Having walked past the Sir Frances Drake dozens of times without thought to step inside, I was impressed by my discovery of the Starlight Room on the 21st floor. The views are amazing. We enjoyed the panoramic view of the sunset through some SF fog. After sundown the lights from Union Square shine brightly from the mirrored ceiling above the dance-floor. 

Let's get to my particular interest though - how were the cocktails?

1) Barkeeps Whimsy #1. 3.5 out of 5. At the time of visit The Starlight Room was celebrating bourbons and ryes. With a mind toward seeing what our barkeep for the evening could do I put my fate in their hands and challenged them to produce something with a rye. What arrived at our table was essentially a dressed-up old-fashioned. Good, but not inspired. I'll admit the bar was set pretty high here. 

2) Smokey Local. 4 out of 5. Excellent drink, although I have a taste for smokey peaty Islay whiskey's. Ardbeg is a personal favorite. The Sherry and maraschino flavors smooth out the smokeyness of the whiskey and makes for a solid drink. This one might not be for everyone, one of those in our party did not care for the smokey flavor.  

3) Barkeeps whimsy challenge #2. 2 out of 5. Inspired by the Hell Fire on the menu, requested something spicy. Received essentially a moscow mule with some jalepeno tequila thrown in. Flavor wise this was lacking for me. Would have liked to see more creativity. Could have use more fire from the drink. 

4) Sazarac. 3.5 out of 5. Not on the menu, after the last foray simply felt like moving back toward whisky based drinks. Sazarac was what I would expect.  

5) Derby's Delight. 5 out of 5. Wild Turkey, Blackberry, Mint, Lemon, Simple Syrup. This is the one I'd come back for. Loved the way the individual flavors come together to compliment the wild turkey. Added flavor without becoming overly sweet.
author: David G.

description:
Interesting place. Went there on a Wednesday night, it was crowded because of an event that was happening nearby. Mature crowd, didn't see many college-like kids. 

Excellent view, especially at night ( hence starlight room!)  It's located at the top floor of a hotel. The dance floor is small, but had great surround view of the city.

Plenty of seats and tables for those who want to chat with friends, rest, have a small bite. It's not a typical clubby place, i like having the option of being able to find a seat easily, and not being disturbed there as a female.

Bar staff was nice, cocktails were great, typical drink prices at place like this.
Overall nice experience. Go for the view at least once! I think it'll be a nice place for holding a birthday celebration.
author: Lianne M.

description:
What the hell?! When did this place turn into a hyphy club with a $15 entrance fee?! It was really busy and I know the views are amazing but it's way too stuffy & crowded. So hard to get to the bar. There were older people dressed up as if they're going to a gala mixed in with young people who were wearing nothing but what seemed like a long t-shirt. 
We ended up going downstairs to the lobby and then elsewhere for a drink.
author: Alina S.

description: Great views of the city.  Cheesy dance music, over priced drinks, douchey patrons but fun for a few drinks.
author: Mike M.

description: Great spot to take your out of town guests. Had a great time at the Sunday brunch drag show!
author: Tania D.

description: I was visiting San Francisco and found this place close by my hotel and don't regret going inside. The place is ok but the view and staff are awesome. The bartenders have excellent customer service skills, the DJ plays great music and their drinks are great. Next time I go back I'm definitely going back.
author: Ricky C.

description:
You know, as weird as this may seem, I actually find this place a bit catchy. Yes I'm a fan of this club. First off, you take this nice walk up the Sir Francis Drake steps to the lobby. Here you encounter a mini lounge bar just to start things off I guess? Then you take the elevator 21 stories up to the very top. Wala! You're here at Starlight. 

Punch in your ID and you're in. The first thing I noticed was the nicely old fashioned yet glamorous bar. It looked like it flew out of an opera scene. Then I walked around with tabled here and there, rich white folks socializing, company parties late at night, and then I see the dance floor. The view is amazing from here! The best view of Powell and some parts of Union Square. 

The crowd wasn't my type though. It seemed like a cult gathering full of rich folks. The DJ was ok. He played some good music. The lighting is dark and it sets the mood for lounging here. I'm actually thinking about gathering some people of mine and chillin up here for a bit. I kinda like this atmosphere?! LOL
author: Allister D.

description:
if you are staying at the drake already, and want a lively place to grab a drink, a bite, and listen to live music...its definitely a default choice. i dont agree with a "discounted' cover to hotel guests, but it is what it is.

we came up to this top level lounge on the first nite of our stay around 11pm friday night. the place was happening and seating was very limited..dance floor was full. quite tough getting a window table to enjoy the spectacular view. there was a very lively cover band playing a wide assortment of top 40s music from different eras. it was loooooud, but fun.

shared the baked mac n cheese - totally different that i expected. they are 3 fried breaded macaroni balls rather than regular baked version. delicious, no doubt, but a little small in the portion.

Quite the extensive specialty cocktail menu...you really cant be disappointed by any choice. they are the typical high prices ($12-$14) but high end ingredients and thoughtfully made. however my final tanqueray 10 and tonic was just as delicious to me and a much larger portion.
author: Heather W.

description: For the Sunday drag brunch, it was very pricy for the food and the show was ok. It's something you can check off the list of things to do in SF.
author: Kelli W.

description: There are few times in your life you go to a restaurant to have an all star experience, but Starlight staff really disappointed us and turned the experience with into a "let's walk out of here ASAP". From chaotic order taking to delivering cold food, they really worked hard to get a bad review and they succeeded. If you want a great customer service, you should stay far away from this place!!!!
author: Ashish U.

description:
Bad service, bad drinks, overpriced... Would avoid going here...
Mixed up the reservation... Orders were a chaos... Cocktails had more of the
Mixers and almost no alcohol and the bar tender was offended when told the truth..
Guys there are definitely better places to go in San Francisco...
author: Sugandha U.

description:
The night view on top of St Francis Drake Hotel was brilliant. The club ambiance is classy. Love the cocktails and food, and price is not too crazy as expected in a hotel like Drake. 

Would love to come back!
author: Shell J.

description:
Really love this place. We parked around the corner at 450 Sutter which is a 24 hr parking facility. Its tough to park around the hotel on the street, and Union Sqare garage is hit or miss, so try the Sutter garage. 

We arrived to the Starlight Room about 8pm this past Saturday and stayed until 12:30. We got in before 8:30, so there was no cover charge. We were lucky enough to get a window table. I love the lounge itself with the sexy old school vibe, lots of  deep red texture carpets, high back 50's club style table settings, the shimmering gold bead curtain details, and romance in the air with the stunning views of the city through the walls of glass windows. 

The music was very relaxing, slow grooves and classics perfect for the mood and atmosphere of the dining and cocktail experience. Our first server was Kendra. She is very elegant, and beautiful, and really took care of us for the first couple of hours. Every member of the staff the first shift of the evening were spectacular. We got to watch the sunset, and enjoy small plates by candle light. We tried the deep fried mac and cheese, the crab cakes, the chicken nuggets and the shrimp cocktail. I ordered mojitos and the husband ordered chocolate martinis. The food runner and the busboy were both wonderful, although I didnt get their names. Each of the small bites were delicious and great cocktail bites. 

We were there to celebrate post nuptials with friends of ours. They arrived about 930, so we closed out our dinner tab to the tune of about $150 including tip. Kendra and staff of the first shift made that worth every penny.

We secured keeping our same table for the dancing part of the evening by handing over our credit card for the tab and were passed along to the second shift, which I will call the dj shift.

 Alessandra was our server for the second shift.  Although the uniform is the same, the service level did come down a notch. There were no smiles, and the elegant service converted to a cocktail service. We did not feel the same treatment, but more the standard 'are we ok here?' Type of attitude. We were with a bride and groom and it would have been nice to have some sort of acknowledgment of that, with a smile and a personalized feel, but I digress. For the prices we are paying, we just expect more. I can go to a bar and be served anywhere, but the. Starlight is classy and patrons want that...

 There were two Dj's I think. The vibe changed from romance to party time. The crowd was an interesting mix of 30 somethings to 50 somethings. The music was 90s to top 40, and Im not a big dancer by any means, but they got me out on the floor a LOT! We ordered two cocktails each, average of 12 bucks or so each. Our bride and groom sat at an adjacent table with a couple of their friends. I am not sure what they ordered. 

As mentioned, The second shift server was not at all nearly as attentive. My husband even had to go to the bar to get a drink for the bride and groom as we waited quite some time for her to serve us... After a lot of fun dancing had by all we were ready to head out. Around midnight or so we asked to close our tab. Alessandra asked if we wanted to combine our tab with our friends table. Um, no, we have separate tabs as secured by our card. No smiles, no thank you, just heres your tab and see ya type of attitude. A TOTAL turn off considering we dropped 200 dollars here tonight! What a disappointment!

 The brides shawl, which had been in the back of her chair the entire evening went missing. While the wonderful manager and door staff sought to find it for her, Alessandra seemingly hounded the bride and groom, by going back over to their table grabbing the tab and putting it in the grooms hands to get them to settle it. Um, how rude! They arent going anywhere darling, they are working to try and find her cover up since she IS in a wedding dress and it would be nice to take home the accompanying cover up for her dress on her wedding night. Just sayin!

All in all the experience, minus Alessandra, was wonderful. She loses a star for you. We will definitely be back, we just will request not to be seated in her section.
author: Kelly H.

description: Phenomenal views and fun atmosphere. We went on a Friday night and it was a diverse mix of people. Lots of ladies in dresses, but also in nice jeans, heels and sexy top. And more single guys than expected - thought it would be mostly coyples like us. Drinks are expensive but the music was a great mix for dancing
author: Jenny R.

description: I recently attended a Sundays a Drag show for my first time and I really enjoyed myself. The ladies all did a amazing job performing and interacting with the crowd. Friendly service and of course Ms. Holottatymes was so hilarious as well. I can't wait to come back!
author: Myra B.

description:
Such an amazing view!
Cocktails were a little on the expensive side but were delicious. 
Fun dance floor with great music. 
Good if you're looking to lounge around or get on the dance floor!
author: Dana D.

description:
Ducked in here for a drink to see the view on a weekday night.   Didn't pay a cover, did buy a glass of wine.  It was good.  There was a disco ball and a big view of union square park.  Both cool things.  

This place has a very cool old hollywood vibe.  it's fancy, and a place you go to be fancy.  I wouldn't spend all night here drinking, but I would tell someone to go here and grab a drink if they are in the city.
author: Chris M.

description: Disappointing. After having an amazing dinner at Farallon my friend and I walked over to The Starlight Room because we had heard good things. After being greeted kindly on the lower floor we found our way to the elevator at up to The Starlight Room. Immediately we were greeted by the bouncer who checked IDs and reprimanded me about my pants. Apparently wearing dress pants here is frowned upon. He went on to call them sweatpants (again, 400$ DRESS pants from Neimans) and told me he'd give me a pass this time but to not wear them in the future. Like I'd be returning after that. Regardless we walked into the area where we were not greeted or shown to a table. We walked around the empty room for a minute before selecting one with a view. The waitress approached us shortly after and we placed our drink order. 15 minutes passed and we still didn't have our drinks. And in that time a couple came and sat down near us and no one had even come to serve them and they were getting angry as well. Finally the lady came back with our drinks. Mine was okay. Subpar. No one approached us again for another 20 minutes so we decided to put the money for the drinks on the table and leave. Safe to say I will never be returning. Should have taken a cab to one of other other locations suggested to us. Lesson learned.
author: Brooke H.

description: Completely unimpressed with what this buisness has turned into. I used to come in frequently after work for drinks with colleagues and recently decided to revisit The Starlight Room... A lot has changed. New staff for the most part though I recognized a familiar face behind the bar. Micheal Pagan was running the show when I was a frequent guest here and was disappointed to find that he had no longer been with the buisness.  The drink menu has changed from what I remember  bringing in new cocktails and removing a couple of my favorites. Can't beat the view from the dance area, however, not amazed with the lack of professionalism when you see the new floor manager Chris slinging back shot after shot with the DJ that evening. I thought I was walking into a buisness that prides themselves on a world class view, apperance and staff. Not anymore. Starlight is full of escorts waiting at the bar for you to take them home and a manager who clearly can't hold his own liquor while on the clock. (Not a good look)
author: Korbin T.

description:
This place gets 4 stars for ambiance and decor. Atop the Sir Francis Drake Hotel, the hotel is gorgeous, and once inside Starlight, the views from the venue were . My only concern is accessibility. Leave the venue before the rush or you'll be waiting for a while. 

There were a lot of out-of-towners the day that I went. Music was good. Overall pretty good night out.
author: Liz H.

description:
This place has great ambiance and the views were amazing.  The service was pretty awesome, especially the guy at the front.  He was really gracious and accommodating.  The waitresses are in long, black prom-like dresses and the door guy was dressed in a tux!  As the Yelp reviews already mention, I saw some cougars and older white men with their younger Asian female counterparts.  But not too many.  Most were tourists or groups having a drink.  They played hip-hop music and have a dance floor.  This place has a lot of fabric (i.e. is dusty) and I kept on sneezing after awhile.  

Good place to grab a drink with a friend around Union Square!
author: Chris L.

description:
Halloween 2014 party was wayyyyyyyy too packed and hot and steamy and the windows were fogged up. 
o noooooooo.

wait half hour to get in line to get on elevator to get up. o mannnnnnn

The place truly does look nice. Red. Velvet. ETC.
I'd be down to come back in daytime to eat or check out view.

Needs a 2nd chance.
author: Veranna N.

description: This review is for Sundays a Drag brunch. It's a fun environment but a very small room. Brunch food was just ok. The performers varied. The emcee was the only one who actually sang. Everyone else lip synced and danced around.  The "Single Ladies" performance was very good.,,she had the moves down. And Cassandra was amazing as she was stunning with a great body, but her talent seemed to be just how great she looks as a woman. I also don't think she's technically a drag queen as it seems she may actually be transgender. But I'm splitting hairs. It's a fun way to spend a Sunday afternoon, but probably not something I'd do twice.
author: Veronika G.

description:
Stopped by here on a Tuesday night with some coworkers. The place was practically empty, which is apparently not usually the case. Our waitress was very friendly and made some drink recommendations to my coworkers based on the type of liquor they wanted, (rum and whiskey). I ordered a glass of wine. 

I tried both of their drinks, a Cable Car, and a ginger whiskey drink, I didn't catch the name of that one. The Cable Car was fantastic. The rim of the glass was coated in cinnamon and sugar. 

For a snack I ordered the Mac and Cheese crisps. Which were fried Mac and cheese squares with bacon. They were pretty good, I just wish they had been a little hotter. 

The view at this place is absolutely amazing. I definitely plan on calming back to check it out on a weekend night.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
The bouncer at the door was really nice. He says that it mainly depends on who's near the bar. If there's young people, most likely a lot of the younger crowds go in, but if there's an older crowd, then older crowd go in. Also, cover is based on how packed the room was. We went there at 9 ish and it was pretty dead ($5 for cover). People were still having dinner. I was starving so we went out for food hoping that it gets happening at 12 ish. 

On the way back we saw three girls walk by ready for the fun night out but to realize that they were just leaving...and my friend and I was like if they're leaving, upstairs must really suck. And yes, it did! but we made the best of it.

I mean at some points it was good towards 1 o'clock. The crowd was very mixed. There was even a wedding and there was bunch of cliques (meaning more than 4 people) and not couples. Probably partying it up after work (since it was a Friday). 

The music was mostly 90s. Not a lot of current top hits and I swear the DJ couldn't mix since he played the whole song from beginning to end. The view is nice though, you can see Union Sq from the top, but that's about it.
author: Crystal H.

description:
I visited the Starlight Room last night (12/13/2014) on a whim and first time visit. Being the holiday season, there were lots of families waiting to get in with me at 6:00 p.m. Due to the fact that I have kids and don't care to be in "kid friendly places" (mine are grown), it was a pleasant surprise. The staff was super friendly and attentive. I was with a date and we both enjoyed the view, decor and ambiance. This place reminds me of an old skool place where mobsters, gangsters and back room politicians would plan and connive during the Roaring 20s. Red velvet curtains, high ceiling windows, crystal hanging from the ceiling, recessed lighting, skyline views and piano! I felt like lighting a cigar and sipping some $800.00 cognac. But I don't smoke cigars and drink my money.   

Our drinks were basic: Amaretto de Saranno and Stella beer. We also had raw Tuna Dip with chips. The chips were bland and reminded me of the Holy Wafers provided at communion. They were flavorless and the Tuna Dip could have used some added flavor. But it was OK and edible. 

The bathrooms were super clean and the lint free paper towels were good enough to wash/dry my car with. I would come back for drinks with a stunning view and super friendly staff.
author: Dee Was Here Z.

description:
If you're going to Union Square in the evening, stop by the Starlight Room. The décor is interesting and they have a big disco ball in the a dancing area. There was no music when I went most recently. The service was very  courteous and we got a window table. There was actually a plug on the wall so we were able to sneak in a phone charge while we were there, too!

They have a great selection of cocktails that are reasonably priced given the incredible view and location. 

I just love stopping in here! Taking in that view and having a cocktail just validates why San Francisco is one of the greatest cities in the world!
author: Daphne P.

description: I enjoyed this place. Went to celebrate a friend's 40th birthday on a Friday night. I'm 29 and it was nice to be able to dance with all these different age groups, I've even seen some people older than my parents. Perfect place to unite cross generations because their DJ is very smart. He knew how to mix in the old with the new. Good, wide selections of drinks and a beautiful view.
author: Jason S.

description: The Starlight Room is one of my favorite places in San Francisco. I've been coming here since 2001 and I've made many happy memories here. I love the elegant décor, the fact that it is a bit more upscale and requires it's diners to actually dress up a bit. They also have a pianist sometimes or a DJ spinning music other nights. The view is killer and so are the drinks.
author: Sarena P.

description: Great Ambience but nothing else... Quite a disappointing experience. The price to experience ratio is in inverse proportion... High price and low experience. Cocktails are not into any good standard... Slow service... We were served cold food...lee just felt like getting out ASAP...
author: Abhijit U.

description: 2 stars for the music. DJ doesn't accept any request. That's fine. But pls play a variety of music. When you see nobody dances on the floor you should know the customers disapprove your music selection. A non stop fast beats for hours is annoying. Will not consider this place anymore
author: Joyce C.

description: I celebrated my 40th birthday party here and had a great time dancing. Very upscale place. Great ambiance and the service is wonderful. The only thing this place needs is a no poop policy on the "ladies" restroom door. It's a club not a gas station females really! I had to go 21 floors down to a non toxic bathroom.  Not the clubs fault in any way. But just thought I'd put it out there! Music was great and it was packed. It was St Patty's Day weekend. Robert is again, the hostess with the mostest. Even remembered us from last year's visit. Overall this place is highly recommended by me and my friends.  If you can get a VIP table..totally worth it. Thank you for hosting a fabulous evening stress free!
author: Janet M.

description: Had such a fab time at the Sunday drag show! I hosted a bridal shower party there and everyone left with a huge smile on their face and an even bigger buzz. Great food, yummy drinks and fierce queens is a recipe for success for any SF weekend. Thanks ladies!
author: Carissa D.

description:
Step back in time here! disco, swing, 80's rock, they throw it all at you and do it pretty good!
If you are a tourist it's something to see and for residents something you have to do once (maybe twice if  the mood hits you) 
Great view of Union Square.
author: Kevin K.

description: Love the view and classy:) love my cocktail too! We went there last friday night for our friends birthday lilibeth shout out for her !!we had different kinds of cocktail serve best mixes taste ever,really just good for the night. lots of giants fan and KC came too!Thanks to Kendra she's very nice and excellent service we all had a great night!everybody is friendly:)
author: MG B.

description:
First time here and it was decent. Not what we expected. It's a small venue with only one bar. Drinks were ok they were pretty pricey. Got a vodka with pineapple and it was $12, the cup was pretty big though. The place smelled really bad!! In the bar area. It was horrible, I had to sit by a window to get fresh area. I only stayed since we had to pay $10 cover. 

The dance area was pretty small. Dj was alright. He played a lot of variety and a lot of throwback. I thought this place was an open venue, but it was closed off and the Windows were foggy. The view was ok not the best of sf.
author: Genie G.

description:
The brunch is good if you're not vegetarian. Not a lot of vegetarian options and my friends visiting were vegetarians. They were really nice and made them a waffle since the only kind they had out was a chicken waffle. 

The show was fun! It was the first time y friends were at a drag show and it was a nice gentle introduction. It was a fun Sunday!
author: Wildeflower M.

description: My first Sunday is a drag! What a great performance event and brunch! Good food, loved the applewood crispy bacon, omelet made to order, and other buffet brunch goodies! And then the drag queen show begins! Tremendous entertainment, loads of fun! A great spot for visitors from out of town- recommended!
author: M B.

description: My friend and I happened to be walking by one evening and decided to pop into the Starlight Room. I know it's a novelty bar and has great views, if you can get a seat by the window, but the drinks just weren't that great, especially for $15 a piece and the company wasn't super fun. Maybe next time I stop in I will make a point of coming with a larger group of friends and ordering beer instead of the super sweet sugary mixed drinks behind the bar.
author: Casey S.

description:
Star light, star bright, 
The first star I see tonight; 
I wish I may, I wish I might, 
Have the wish I wish tonight.

*Opens Eyes**

WTH, I didn't wish for a room full of Sugar Daddies!!!

I was going to give Starlight Room 2-3 stars after my nightlife experience on 11/10; however, this wouldn't be fair since most clubs can't control the type of crowd they attract/bring in. I also had to take into account the company holiday party I organized here 3 years ago, hence the 4 Stars.

***N I G H T L I F E***
Since we had Veterans Day off, my friends and I wanted to party the night before. I remember hearing about Wed (Indulgence) Hip Hop Nights hosted by Sebastien Entertainment, so we decided to give it a shot.

LINE:
We got there at 10:30 PM and the wait was less than 2 mins.

COVER: 
Free before 11 PM, if you're on the GL; otherwise it's $10.

DRESS CODE:
Although no dress code was stated on the FB invite, SR is not a place to come rocking your newest kicks. It's a very classy venue, so dress to impress!

CROWD:
SUGAR DADDY AND COUGAR CENTRAL! The average age was about 50--I kid you NOT! There was probably a 3:1 ratio of men to women and the majority were tourists. It wasn't our scene, so we left to Infusion. I think the crowd is a result of the event being under promoted. 

MUSIC:
Top 40s, Hip Hop and Pop. Guest DJ Primetyme was awesome; good mixes and smooth transitions. The music was so good; we even contemplated coming back here after leaving to Infusion. 

BAR:
There's a main bar upon entering SR and a make-shift one near the dance floor. They have an extensive array of liquor including many rare and expensive ones. 

DRINKS:
$11 for top shelf liquor which is reasonable considering it's an upscale venue in a historic downtown hotel. Generous shots were served in cups. 

Bottle service was available for $150/ bottle for Absolut and $200/bottle for Goose which probably needs to be booked ahead of time from the promoters to lock in this price. 

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR:
SR is very classy and reminiscent of the 1930s with deep red velvet booths and draping, diamond chandeliers and staff decked out in a white tux and black bow tie. There are about 6-8 booths reserved for bottle service. The dance floor is pretty tiny and probably the size of 4 cubicles. There's PLENTY of dancing room as most of the crowd wasn't the dancing type. 

The main attraction is the GORGEOUS 360-degree view of San Francisco. It's truly breathtaking to see a bird eye's view of SF's landmarks and the city lights on a crisp night. SR is definitely a great place to bring out-of-towners or a date for drinks.

PARKING:
Street parking is difficult but not impossible at night. I got parking 1.5 blocks away after circling just once. Otherwise, there's valet parking. 

***P R I V A T E  E V E N T***
Since I organized a company holiday party 3 years ago, my review is very dated and lacks precise detail. However, the customer service was excellent and I didn't have a panic attack, so it's very noteworthy. (Do note that SR is open to the public at 9:30 PM.) 

Jaime, the Events Manager at the time was very easy to work with. She was very friendly, professional and responsive. She always responded to my calls and/or e-mails within 24 hours. 

I told Jaime our company budget and she gave us several options on how we can maximize our budget. She helped us work out a plan so that we can offer unlimited red and white wine. And, as a surprise she even had the bartender make a specialty cocktail with our company color which we handed out drink tickets for. 

We ordered 2 stations: North Beach Station (antipasti and various pastas) and Chinatown Station (dim sum dishes). Although the stations were suppose to be more like hors d'oeuvres, the food portions were very generous so everyone was well fed. I did have some doubts about the lack of authenticity of the Chinatown Station, but was told that they have Chefs that specialize in each region of cuisine. And, from what I remember, the har gow, sui mai, and char siu bao tasted similar to what you get in Chinatown, Sunset, or Richmond.

DJ Dave Gillis is SR's in-house DJ, so we didn't have to bother looking for one. DJ Gillis was very easy to work with as well. He sent me playlists to look through beforehand and played songs that suited our employees. Most of our workforce was engineers, so needless to say, there was no Flo Rida's "Get Low" or Kelis' "Milkshake". 

As far as the event went, it went off without a hitch. My former colleagues aren't party animals, but everyone enjoyed the food and getting to mingle with each other outside of work. I got commendation for days about how well the event went, but I have to thank the staff at SR for helping to organize a successful event that was virtually stress-free. 

All in all, although the nightlife crowd was not my cup of tea, I would come back to SR for the music and venue not without good company of course...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
This place scams their customers. I used my card to buy two drinks and even left a generous tip for the bartender, but when I looked at my bank statement, the charge was also 50 instead of 25.

Aside from that the crowd is not so interesting most of the time and there are a lot of tourists. It is very hot inside, though all this would be ok probably as long as they did not steal my money.
author: Marianna P.

description:
I have seen "The Birdcage" approximately 8,000,000 times.  Granted, my favorite part of that movie is any scene that Hank Azaria is in, but I also love to see the interaction between Robin Williams and Nathan Lane, as well as Gene Hackman dressed up as a woman.

My mother also loves that movie, for many of the same reasons.  So it was fitting that for her birthday, we come here for brunch.  My mother is somewhat of a fruit fly/fag hag.  The apple doesn't fall from the tree.

For the most part, it was good.  Nothing stellar in terms of the eats, but definitely tasty and worth it.  Drinks are a little pricey, but that's to be expected.   I got the deal through a Groupon (or something like that), so it took a bite out of the cost.  

Not the best drag show I've seen, but it's certainly fun.  The headliner was some redhead who did Reba, and s/he was spectacular.  i could have lived without seeing a Lady Gaga impersonation, because I'm still not convinced that the "lady" isn't tucking.

It's a worthwhile thing for guests in town, although I did feel sorry for the dude who got dragged in by his girlfriend.  Not the best place for a hot, straight, unmarried man.  

But what place is, really?
author: Pam S.

description:
I think "The Starlight Room" deserves 5 Stars,  Great view of the city! Good drinks & a nice selection of appetizers.
And how could i forget, Good Music! With a live DJ / Band certain nights.
author: Natasha P.

description: Turned away for wearing Birkenstocks. Would like to know when did sandels, like Birkenstock, become flip flops. Not to mention I doubt you would turn a women away wearing the same style!
author: Graham B.

description:
Came here on Valentine's Day with my boyfriend.  We got here around 6:30pm, I want to say.  We didn't have a reservation or anything, so we just sat at the bar.  

All the staff people were very nice!  The guy near the entrance was very kind and our bartender was just as kind.  I ordered the Chartreuse Swizzle and my boyfriend got the Highland Buck.  The bartender was crackin' jokes with us and was really nice when I was asking him questions about what alcohol he was pouring in our drinks.  

He made us our drinks in a few minutes and I was excited to try my Chartreuse Swizzle cause I had no idea what it was haha.  And boy was I mildly disgusted.  My drink had Velvet Falernum ...which apparently is made up of a bunch of herbs and things.  You can definitely taste all the herbs.  It was kind of gross, but this was my fault for choosing something with Falernum alcohol.  I'd avoid it unless you like your drink tasting like grass & herbs haha.  I drank it regardless, but I'd probably never get it again!   My boyfriend's drink was good.  There was nothing crazy in there and he liked it so it was a win.  

We also ordered their chicken nuggets with honey mustard sauce.  They were delicious! Problem is they only give you 5 small ball-shaped nuggets (for $9 ._.)  I was a bit inebriated at this point from my herby drink and probably could have consumed more nuggets than I'd like to admit..but I stopped myself from ordering more haha.

After our nuggets, we moseyed on towards the dance floor where the view was.  It was a nice view.  I'd imagine sunset would be very nice here.  We didn't dance but we  watched people getting their groove on on the dance floor.  

As we left, we saw that the guy near the entrance was charging a cover for entrance.  Not sure how much it was, but I guess if you get there early enough there's no cover!  I personally wouldn't want to come if there was a cover, but I had a really nice time, despite my poor choice in alcoholic beverage.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Eclectic crowd makes for some interesting people watching. Broad generalization would be tourists and 'bridge and tunnel', people having a good time, but the venue feels kitschy and not quite worth the $15 cover. 

I went during holiday party season, so quite a few cocktail dresses, in addition to typical SF jeans and t-shirt look. 

Nice view of Union Square from the dance floor, though it was so steamy in there that it looked blurry even after rubbing the windows. Semi crowded dance floor, and dancing itself was barely ok... music was eclectic to the point that the DJ must not have been watching the crowd (or didn't care) that when he drastically changed genres he lost half of his dance floor.

Might be ok with a table, but long wait at bar (though stiff drinks)
author: Aki N.

description:
worth it. just worth it.
excellent ambiance
I wasn't dissapointed at all.
I'm taking my parents here for sure.
author: Thankie S.

description: I love this place the drinks were delicious.. I ordered the cats meow which was excellent it wasn't to strong and wasn't all watered down my boyfriend ordered the ghost machine which was pretty good as well.. The customer service was great.. There was a tall black gentleman at the door who I just fell in move with I can't think if his name at the moment but all in all I will return when I visit from Southern California again
author: Brianna D.

description: Easter 420 Sunday is a Drag brunch buffet. Food was delicious and the show was very very entertaining. I can definitely see why the show has been going on every Sunday for 8 years. Thank you to Michael (producer) for putting on such a great show at a terrific venue
author: Anthony E.

description:
I really loved the view and the ambiance of the place.  It was $5 for cover when I came around 8:45 pm.

$12 for a Vodka Red Bull, but it tasted slightly sweet and great to me.  ( Our waitress asked me if I preferred a particular vodka flavor and I said no.) The waitresses wore classy but sexy long black dresses.  A few male waiters wore tuxedos.  There was seating and tables.

The live band that night was not my favorite, but they did have a DJ later on.  They do have a piano too, but they did not play on it that night. The dance floor had a mirrored ceiling, which reflected the little white lights on the dance floor.  (The ceiling looked like stars).  We loved the gorgeous views of all of Union Square and even the freeway lights.   It is a twenty one floor elevator ride up to the top, and it is in the Sir Francis Drake Hotel.  There were people there of all ages and styles, but most were in their thirties or older.

My friends and I loved the glamour of the place and will come back in the future.
author: Andrea V.

description: Good views, interesting vibe between nightclub, dancing and sophisticated bar. Couldn't quite work out which it fits into best. Cover charge against drinks prices a bit unusual.
author: Steve W.

description: 4 in our family went there for drinks on Saturday 8/13/16.  We were greeted promptly and given a great table at the window, which had a magnificent view of the city.  We had the Artisanal Cheese plate which was great.  The drinks were very very good.  I had the La Perla-Jacques Bezuidenhout, which is a margarita like drink with pear instead of the typical lime.  It was so good that I would return just for that drink.  All the people that work in the Starlight are dressed in old school loungewear on the formal side, but casual wear for the patrons seemed to be fine.  We had a great time with great views, drinks, cheeses and service and would return!
author: Bill H.

description: Great view of the city. Music was loud but conversation could still occur, not like at some other places I've been to on this trip. Wait staff were super friendly and accommodating. Bartender was adventurous and had some fantastic recommendations.  Sat near one of the many windows with an old friend and made some new friends while enjoying our cocktails (which were priced the same as most lounges).  Would recommend if you don't mind it being a bit loud, the service is good and the view is excellent.
author: Doc J.

description:
Just visited the Starlight Room, at 10p on a Saturday night, as an out of town visitor looking forward to celebrating my birthday at a classy establishment. Here are my findings:

$10 cover/person. Right off the bat, they charged me. 

Ordered two drinks from the bar, vodka tonic and rum and coke (well drinks at that). $19. Ouch. After the $10 cover?? I'm from Los Angeles and I still found that outrageous...

Music, straight out of the nineties, if not earlier. Only one song was played from this decade and that was Macklemore's "Thrift Shop". If you're looking for a hot spot to dance in, this is not it. Dance floor was filled with older folks who are probably staying at the hotel. Want to see 50 year olds jitterbug to Prince? This is your place! Plus the DJ clearly did not know what he was doing, as he would play one upbeat song, and then immediately play three songs that all you could do was step to. 

After all that dancing, I figured it would be nice to sit. NOPE. All the tables were reserved, which really takes away from the ambiance, when you can't sit in their pretty red booths (part of what drew me there in the first place).

All in all, a DISAPPOINTING experience. If you've never been there, I wouldn't go expecting much. I'm sure the drag brunch is great, but seeing as I already spent $40+ to be disappointed, I'll not spend the extra $90 to see if their drag queens are as good as ours.
author: Ashley M.

description:
If you live in the area, you've probably been thinking about going to the drag brunch forever and just never seem to get around to it. I finally I did, because it was for Easter brunch and I finally had the day off. 
I've been to alot of drag dining and I'd say its pretty safe to say you come more for the show than the food. But the food was great. Brunch buffet, everything was super tasty and good assortment. Food for the whole fam. But again, the food is just there to absorb the mimosas while you are being entertained by these lovely ladies. 
Donna Sachet and her crew put on an amazing show. At some points I was cry-laughing and some points just being in awe at how gorgeous these girls are. Loved every bit of it. 
GO.... take some out of towners and a sense of humor and an appetite for champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries.
author: Shvonne A.

description: i love this place! Good view, good vibes and friendly bartenders!  A S.F. favorite for sure. :)
author: Cecilia L.

description: 5 star view of Union Square and the City!  Worth the price of the cocktail alone!
author: Elise G.

description: If you like men in white suits and gold chains, this is the place to be! It was seriously a weird mix of awesome people and some pimps and hoes. I do not usually judge so it was fun until they changed the music from awesome dance music to just downright ghetto ones. Not cool. Everyone was having fun dancing to tall sasha and the dj's after him until they just had to switch the dj to their resident dj. I just had to leave. I believe this skanky lady had to request this type of music so she can dance like a stripper against the dj booth... trust me.. it looked more like she was scratching her back against it...Certain music attracts a certain type of crowd and I definitely do not want to be a part of a crowd that dances like they need to get a room. Never coming back on a Saturday night.
author: Sweet P.

description: Great view of Union Square. No cover if you make it before 9pm like we did. Our drinks were strong and pricey ($12). But we just wanted to check out the view so just had 1 cocktail each. It was empty when we got there so was able to walk around and see nice view, esp by dance floor. It gets 3 stars because there were a lot of old people and the music was for old people, played by an old woman. Nothing against any of that .. just so you know. Good for a quick stop.
author: Vol T.

description: Loved this spot - classy hotel, classy bar, great drinks, great view, great dance floor, and awesome music (hip hop was the main genre the night I was here).
author: Jenn U.

description: A group of girlfriends and I checked out The Starlight Room over the weekend, and I was disappointed to say the least. To me, the room is such an iconic place in San Francisco, but when we went in the place was a disheveled. The bathroom was un-kept (read: disgusting), and the dance floor was very run down. Not sure what they are doing with that $10 cover charge, but I will probably not be paying it again anytime soon.
author: Jane F.

description:
great view from up there.  soundsystem had great sound and DJ played disco beats old and new.  the crowd here is a real mix of old and older and odd and odder, with a few hotel guests coming up for a nightcap.

we had two vocka and tonic, bartender suggested chopin potato vodka (they don't serve Tito's), $25 before tip....  but we knew we were paying for the view.
author: Paul S.

description: Eh...came here with a friend last Friday night. Got in for free because bouncer or hostess think I was hot. Anyways, when I got into the lounge, the first thing I got was a drink. Drinks are expensive but good. The music sucked!!! Wedding music??? Lol for instance Electric slide and 70s disco? I could see my filipino folks dancin into those music hahaha I was hoping that they play some Hiphop music to pop my booty on the dance floor :) also they played older music that reminded me from high school such as 50 cent "in da club" and seeing older people dancing into it. In addition, I believe that this lounge is more an older crowds since I have seen a lot of those mingling around. Therefore, not really my scene. Although, props for getting in for free and a table from that hostess or bouncer ;)
author: CeeCee M.

description:
This place felt so cheesy. We went up to check it out and can't believe there is even a cover. Small dance floor, impressive view, a couple cool twosome tables by the windows, crappy music, go go dancers off to the side.

Been there, done that... Wouldn't go back.
author: Gary R.

description:
My friends and I came here a couple times.  I like that it has this amazing view of the city and always a live band playing.  It gets super crowded on the dance floor and everywhere for that matter...even if you get a table I always feel you need to fend for it and make sure no one takes it since everyone is eyeing for a seat.  Crowd here is pretty mix.  It makes it pretty entertaining to people watch with cougars on the hunt and playing the "is he/she in drag?" game.  

I haven't gotten many drinks here we usually just get a big punch/sangria bowl to share which I think is pretty reasonably price most the time.  Service however can get hard with tons of people around.  you have to flag down your server sometimes to get a drink and get the bill.
author: Kim D.

description:
A little piece of old-school San Francisco, smack dab on top of the Sir Francis Drake hotel.  Everything is red, red, red, from the curtains to plush booths to the hibiscus martini. 

I hadn't been to the Starlight Room before they redid their cocktail menu: now it's organized by era, and there are at least 50 concoctions to try.  At $10-12 per drink, it's not cheap, but there are a few gems there.  

The bartenders are talented and friendly, and the view is spectacular.  It's not quite on par with Alembic, Local Edition, Rickhouse, and Smuggler's Cove for fancy cocktails, but if you're a San Franciscan, you have to come here at least once to soak up the ambiance.  Go early to avoid a cover charge!
author: Jennie K.

description:
Sunday Drag Brunch = $45
Drinks at brunch ~$10 each
The look on your face when you realize the woman in front of you was a man = priceless

Front row seats, a plate full of food and lots of singing, big hair, and boobs.  If you're an Asia SF fan, I would recommend this show for brunch with out of town guests.  

The food was meh.  And the show is definitely entertaining for men - I feel like women aren't as interesting to the ladies on stage... but come for the experience. 

Afterwards, you'll feel motivated to go hit the gym because everyone on stage is in freakin' great shape.
author: Lisa L.

description: Great experience. Delish drinks. Great appetizers. Concrete jungle views. Amazing dancing floor. I'll be back.
author: andrew l.

description:
Came here months ago to celebrate my friend's 27th birthday with the "Sunday's a Drag." 

You should know, right off the bat, you're paying for the experience- not the food! The buffett, while extensive, isn't anything that makes you crave more. There's a nice spread- but it's a buffet after all. (I did think the custom-order omelette bar was pretty cool though!)

That being said, the show was absolutely entertaining. Those gals can certainly entertain! I wasn't entirely sure what to expect, but the lip-syncing costume wearing men in drag certainly kept us laughing and singing along. 

I had a good time, and we all enjoyed ourselves. It's a true SF experience.
author: Annalise F.

description:
I have a confession to make. This was my first "Drag Brunch". No, it does not involve cars (which I thought that was a possibility, but then I realized it was in SF). So, this place is at the top of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel with some pretty good views (assuming that it isn't foggy/rainy in which it was with this case). First off the food was pretty good. Nice spread, omelet station with the obligatory prime rib. Fresh squeezed OJ, and mimosas! 

As for the show, I have never had soo much fun at a brunch! No really, I thought it was pretty entertaining. It was pretty much G-rated so nothing really nasty. My phone sucked at taking pictures, so once my friend emails me the pics I will post them. So yes, I would say its worth the $45/person. Now when I go to Las Vegas, I just might consider something else than Cirque Du Soleil. 

It is recommended that you make reservations but don't be late because they might make fun of you.
author: Rob Y.

description:
I'd give it 4 stars if the busser did not put our dirty flatware straight in front of us, on a clean white tablecloth, when taking our plates away. I don't mind reusing my dirty flatware but it should be put on a bread plate or a napkin. Not on a white clean tablecloth. It was disgusting. People in my party (party of 8) were raising brows when they saw this happen.

The show was fun overall. The "lady" performing the Tina Turner was amazing.
author: Petka C.

description: Loved this place!  Who doesn't love the Starlight Room?  I spent NYE here and had the best New Year's ever!  My friend Robert and I stayed in the hotel(Sir Francis Drake).  I got divorced and Robert is a really hot, funny guy who I met at a single's dance.  I love funny men and he makes me laugh!  He also has the best swagger!  I love to watch him walk!  My Fellow Good Yelp Ladies, you know what I'm talking about right?  A guy who can swagger has the shoulder and butt action going on!  Watch a a quarterback walk. That's a swagger.  Oh, so anyway, back to the Starlight Room!   Dinner was fabulous, and included a bottle of champagne.  Dessert was wonderful and our server gave us extra chocolate things!  The band was Club 90, and played great dance music. The view of the city was spectacular from the 21st floor of the hotel.  Happy New Year to All My Fellow Good Yelpers!
author: Blondie R.

description: Madly in love with this wildly romantic, misty dreamy cloud-top paradise. I ascended into its heaven one twinkling evening on a tip from a local for a quick bucket of scotch. I don't know that Raymond Chandler ever wrote about the place, but he easily might have. The place impressed me as indelibly as my first kiss. Bedazzling. It still gives me goosebumps.
author: Wayne S.

description:
I got dragged here for a friend's birthday adventure on a Friday night.  I wasn't too impressed with the Starlight Room, but thanks to the trip I do know where to pick up prostitutes in San Francisco.  Seriously, this place should be renamed Harry Denton's Hooker Convention.  They even had a pimp there (or maybe he was just part of Run DMC) making sure his ladies were working their magic on everyone from the older gentlemen with their wedding rings still on to the eurotrash in tracksuits using prepaid mobile phones.

As a 28 year old lady, this place made me remarkably uncomfortable.  It wasn't the ladies of ill repute selling their wares that made feel dirty (I had lots of fun playing hooker or housewife). It was the mass amount of men twice my age who hit on me, a bad cover band, broken glass on the dance floor, watered down cocktails, and a weird musty smell that made me walk out shortly after arriving.
author: Lara O.

description:
A really cool place. It's classy, and a great place for drinks. They make an apple martini that uses real apple juice, a must try.

Good service and one of the best views of the City from up there. It's on the roof of the Sir Frances Drake hotel.  If in the are you should go up for a drink. View of the city (5) and drinks a 4.  Cver all a 3.5.
author: Ahmad B.

description:
Came here with my BFF for some drinks with a view. The view is to die! So romantical! Definitely a great place for a date night (HINT, HINT) ;) We were seated at a table with the best view. It was so pretty!! They have drinks from way back in the 1800's. I am obsessed with the Old Hollywood era & the history of this place fascinates me. The old Sinatra music they played was the icing on the cake. 

We ordered our drinks & because I can't stand the taste of alcohol I couldn't drink my drink so I ordered a glass of champagne. To our surprise a nice gentleman behind us with his wife bought our drinks. See,  this is why I love San Francisco so much... People are so nice!!!

Around 9:30 or 10 a DJ started to play some new & old R&B music & we wanted to dance sooo bad. But we were not about to give up our seats lol It was packed for a Wednesday night I was surprised. The crowd was perfect not to many old people not to many young. It was a good mix. We both said we would come back again.
author: Heather D.

description:
I went on 2/18/21012 with friends just to dance and have fun.  We are all in our 50s and we had heard this was a good place for an older crowd.  Now at fifty something, we are not dead!  We love dancing to all sorts of music, but the band was playing cocktail hour music (old Earth, Wind and Fire), not music to dance to and we were bored stiff until the band took a break and the DJ came on. It was amazing how crowded the floor got every time the band left!!  
Harry, if you want a hip, older crowd you need to get a new band on Saturday nights!  I won't go back again until you do.
author: Jane E.

description:
Know first that this *is* going to be a pricey venture.   I'm guessing that if you can't  afford it, that's by design - just stepping off the elevator of the 22nd floor, you know this is a classy joint.   Your first hint might be the beautiful creatures in elegant black evening gowns who greet you.   Perhaps it's the dramatic, smooth style of decor that in this place, on this floor, sinks you into a Casablanca mood, but in any other setting would look tacky and garish.   

If nothing else tips you off, the menu will.   But you're not coming here to drink or to get drunk, or at least you shouldn't be.  If you are, you're missing the point.   Come here to dance, come here to see the view, come here for the caramel gelato... but mostly, come here to be a part of the atmosphere.
author: WaitingIs F.

description:
Came here twice during my stay and the first night was rocking with a great fundraising party and a great DJ. Unfortunately you could not see out of the windows since they were all sweaty. 

The second night was great for happy hour and sunset with a more relaxed experience with a great view and a great chocolate mousse dessert.
author: Amber H.

description: We had a great time on a Friday night! Dancing, drinking and enjoying the view on top of downtown SF....  If im ever in town again I will return!
author: Carlos O.

description: This place has damn sketchy wait staff, my husband charged $250 on his AE and when he checked his bank statement, the staff added extra tip on his bill! Seriously, wtf. Can't imagine how often they've gotten away with that. My husband has reported them to AE to dispute the charge. Manager needs to figure out what's going here.
author: Ennie L.

description: Sunday Drag Brunch...Food is average, service was decent and the show was tired! Sorry guys but you are lucky to be getting the three stars. Great concept and amazing venue however the show's lady of the evening phoned it in! Be fresh, be relevant and give the appearance that you enjoy what you do!
author: Brook M.

description:
Worst business practices and horrible event planners!!!  
The staff stole my personal property!!!
author: Wendy W.

description:
While visiting a friend in the Bay Area for her birthday, Her husband made reservations for us to have a little night life fun at the Starlight Room in San Francisco.
We had reservations for a table by a window which over looks all of the city.  Once we arrived, we were taken to a table immediately.  However, it was located directly by the kitchen.  Which was very busy.  It was Very uncomfortable and had the feel of as if we were apart of the staff. With that being said we turned the table down and asked to be seated at something more inviting.  They ended up moving us to a table on the left side of the restaurant 3 table from the kitchen.  Without complaining we decided to take that table and enjoy the view.  Within minutes our awesome waitress Monica, asked for our drink order and gave some great suggestions.  The birthday girl had a rum punch, her husband Belvi on ice with lime, I had a tipsy rabbit and our other friend had an easy sippin!!!  All I can say is yummy!!!.  With lots of people celebrating Christmas parties, the section to the right of us was being reserved for a wedding.  As the staff had been trying to keep others from wondering over to the area we thought we would help out and suggested that they bring a velvet rope there to show its was a VIP reserved area which they did finally. Chris, the security on site took over the area and from time to time had to walk away.  So again we suggested to Chis that WE would help monitor the area, Since we were sitting right there, so he could handle other area's of the lounge. He was AWSOME!!! Now the mood changes when we get this so called host named Robert.  He comes over to the velvet rope and says to us, "We're gonna move you all. This is the worst table in the house."  When actually he wanted to give our table to another customer and place us back by the kitchen again!!!.
