So of course we refused and as he looked down upon us as if we didn't belong in this establishment, we asked Monica to send over the manager. When the manager came to our table not only was he personable but he was so friendly!!! It was if we knew him for years.  His name is Derick Opela!!!! He, Monica and Chris 5 Diamond for this spot.  However that Robert, this place could really do without.
Derick took exceptional care of us and sent us all a round of birthday drinks and treated us as if we were royalty.  With the 3 of them on staff we said we would defiantly return to this place.  It ROCKS big time.....even with that ol' evil Robert.
author: Tonia G.

description:
This place is such a trip.

It reminds me of hotel bars in Qatar - with the random assortment of people who all seem to look so out of place, but yet so in place here. I am always amazed how such a kooky group of people, all make their way out to the Starlight Room- to drunkenly and awkwardly attempt to dance on a dance floor  - overlooking all of San Francisco.

It's genius. That's what it is.

Seeing some unshaven hipster couple bust out moves beside a graying couple - her squeezed into a way too tight sequin dress - while he dons an awkward fitting Dockers blazer and tapered khaki pants,  makes me smile.  I love it.

I appreciate that the dance floor is just as entertaining as the phenomenal view - through the big glass windows lining the dance floor. And when I say phenomenal - I mean it - a breathtaking view of downtown San Francisco and Union Square.

But view and amazingly strange crowd aside, there is something off about the Starlight Room. While it's fun to visit on one off occasions - it's not the kind of place I'd necessarily roll into regularly.

There's a bizarre cheesy factor to the place - which can be exciting at times - because you never know who you're going to be standing next to, or talking to; but at the same time - it's just that: a surreal world - where you just don't really know who you're talking to. 

The Starlight Room seems strangely familiar - but at the same time - cold and unbalanced. It's not the kind of place that I would want to step into alone. There's just wayyyyyyyy to many strange characters walking around here.

My advice on how to best enjoy this space: dress up and go on a fun date here. Cuddle into one of their dimly lit booths. Or go with a group of friends who can appreciate quality people watching. Because this place delivers. And then some.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I've been here to dance in the evenings and brunch with the drags in the afternoon. Can't really tell you which crowd I like better. Both are awesome in their own way. 

Did you know they'll kick you out if you are sleeping? Yep, we got kicked out (deservedly so) because my drunk blond couldn't stay up. Prior to that, we had some strong drinks and a spin around the dance floor. Fun, fun, fun.
author: Chum L.

description: Great views, decent dj, fun time!  Dress up if you like, classy place.
author: Charmaine T.

description:
Sunday's a Drag...is fantastic. I see it at least twice a year...yeah it's that good and I love being a tourist in my own backyard! The brunch is good, a nice selection to choose from.  Fresh squeezed OJ and delicious pastries to top it off. The show alone is well worth the price of admission.  

My friends and I find excuses to keep going back: a friend from out of town is visiting, it's a friends birthday, it's Sunday!  The entertainers are all top shelve and Donna Sachet (host and performer) is a San Francisco treat! This is one experience not to be missed.
author: J. B.

description: I was there on Saturday night with friends. We were able to spot the table next to the window, yeah... and enjoyed the wonderful view through dirty windows. The service was ok, the first cocktail I ordered, was awful..sour and watery. I don't remember the name of it  as it was recommended by waitress. She was kind enough to take it away and recommended another one, which was much better. Music was good enough. Wish they serve appetizer after 10:00 pm, but the kitchen was closed. One time experience is enough.
author: Anna S.

description:
Let's break this down:

-1 star for $15 cover charge in the weekend
-1 star for super watered down drinks with warm glasses
-1 star for security rudely yelling at us to leave when it's not even 2am 
-1 star for the stuffy furniture and a limited bar

Basically, the remaining star is for the view.
Would not willingly come again.
author: Winson S.

description: No maraschino cherries, no blue cheese stuffed olives. Can't make a Brooklyn cocktail...are you even a cocktail bar bro?
author: Catie H.

description: I've been here a couple times now. There is a lot to love about Harry Denton's starlight room-- It's almost like a historical landmark of San Francisco.. with an awesome view of the city and Union Square. The lounge is draped with red curtains, that appear to be straight outta the 70s and there are typically plenty of places to sit, as well as tons of space on the dance floor to move around. Either there has been a dj playing music or a live band playing music every time-- this last dj on Wednesday night was okay. I don't know if I would ever plan a whole entire evening at this lounge, but it always a fun place to stop on a night around town. ;-)
author: Cassandra E.

description:
Dear Harry Denton,

I love you. There, I said it. I'm not so much *in* love with you, but I do love you.... Before you say anything, wouldn't you like to know why?!

Oh Harry, nobody throws a party like you! Your recent addition of "Sunday's A Drag Brunch" to the Starlight Room has made my partying life nearly complete. Now, If I could get my boobs to resemble those of Cassandra Cass from the show, well, I'd be set!

After a weekend of excessive partying in Fog City to celebrate one of my last nights out as a "Single Lady", my girlfriends and I settled in for a delicious brunch, and one of the BEST drag shows I've ever seen. I'm not sure what it is about Drag Queens, but I love them. Maybe it's all the work the girls put in to looking SO beautiful, the sheer showmanship of it all, or the fact that they just seem to LOVE to celebrate. And well, let's be honest, I WAS celebrating my last fling before that ring goes on for good!

The peach Bellinis flowed almost as well as the gowns, and the food was decadent. Fresh made omelets, juicy prime-rib, some of the best lox I've ever tasted, and brioche French toast to top it all off. 

But you should know, I was sad to have missed you at this performance. I know you enjoy a visit on most Sunday's. I hope you don't mind, though, when a woman sitting near me asked if her mate would recognize you had you been there, I chimed in with, "Oh, Mr. Denton is hard to miss. A fairly short and some-what stocky man with a great laugh, you'd know if he had been here..." And I ended with a heavy sigh, because I did miss you.

I hope to see you soon, Harry!

With love and admiration,

Lady Lauren
author: Lauren S.

description:
This was at the top of our hotel, I was hoping it'd be a nice place to hang out. The cover charge was ridiculous considering we were already in the hotel for the weekend. It would have been nice to have no cover charge if we could prove our room reservation.

We walked over to the bar and my 4 friends and I ordered drinks, I ordered water due to already drinking before coming and the bar tender seemed insulted. We watched as the bartender measured every single part of the drinks and didn't even fill the jigger with alcohol or juice when measuring then were over charged for said drinks (feels like over charged due to no alcohol content and the glasses filled MAYBE 1/2 way as well. )

We tried to sit down, and there were only dirty tables everywhere, underneath/on the floor of ours was someone's jacket in which we thought someone had left behind. After 20 minutes of sitting/chatting/drinking someone came over and claimed it was their table and kicked us out (despite the jacket there was no indication someone was there or occupying, the drinks were empty and dirty plates) as we tried to walk elsewhere a host finally seated us at "reserved" booths and the music was so loud you had to YELL over everything to basically talk to someone sitting next to you.

After maybe 30-40 minutes in total we walked out.
author: Kim D.

description:
A night out on the town lead us to the Starlight Room. 
Easy parking across the street; always nice when a gal is dressed up and wearing her heels! It was easy to find and the building has an old school San Francisco quaint charm with plenty of style. 
We had a reservation and got a nice booth. The host was so charming and sweet! What a doll! The table service was not bad for a nightclub that was pretty busy, we got there at about 9:30. 
The drinks were good and strong and the apps. were also tasty. We had the deviled eggs(creamy and crunchy with the bacon on top), prawn cocktail(classic large prawns with yummy spicy cocktail sauce), and the crab cakes(crunchy and well seasoned).
My favorite was the ambiance and the mix of people. The cocktail gals were all dressed in their classic sexy all black dresses and were beautiful. The view was great and the DJ was playing a nice variety of music. There is also a coat check if your so inclined.
author: Ness V.

description: Fun band and pretty view. I would love to order one of their punch bowls but I don't have that many friends to drink it with!
author: Virginia M.

description: Brunch is a Drag on Sundays is a HOOT! Really great show, delicious food and well mixed cocktails. Best show in town.
author: Jane L.

description: Feel like dressing up? You better or they won't let you in. Feel like getting drunk? Go elsewhere, drinks here are over priced. But if you are in the mood to enjoy some of the best views of the city then this is the place. Romantic atmosphere, quiet, place gives you an excuse to dress up. After a few drinks the DJs sound great. Atmosphere is disco, mirrored ceiling & disco mirror ball. Best way to get good service here is to tip well, once the waitress learns there is a good tip involved she will kiss your butt. Get drunk before you go here and save money. 5 stars for the view and some good memories.
author: Ron W.

description: Too formal to have such rude staff!  They made us feel so unwelcome that we just ordered a small plate and left immediately.
author: Sarai J.

description:
Pretty fun place for a drink, but not sure it beats the alternatives in the area. 

We came by on a weeknight and ordered two pretty tasty gin and tonics- a little pricey but not outlandishly so. 

The place is big and feels very plush- must be all the red velvet. It definitely looks like a "Starlight Room", I think I heard "fun-bougie" being thrown around. 

The view is nice, although it can't quite compete with The View (the bar) down the street.  There were a good number of people there but its spread out enough not to feel cramped. Patrons seemed to be in the 30-40ish range. 

We finished our drinks and were ready to head out when the waitress stopped by with two more cocktails on the house. I'm not sure what we did to deserve them (or who chose the drinks), but we were pretty jazzed (the Starlight Room demands words like "jazzed"). 

Mine was an appropriately cool old fashioned, my friend got something in a sugared martini glass that tasted like a snickerdoodle. We really enjoyed both- not sure how much of that was the free talking.

If I get comped drinks every time I come here this is a six star place, for now I'm leaving it at a solid three. It sounds like you have to see the Sunday performance to really experience the S-Room, so maybe I'll be back soon.
author: Ryan D.

description: A trip to "The Starlight Room" at the top of the Sir Francis Drake hotel seemed like a magical idea. I love famous, historic spots and often appreciate that they what they lack in modern features, they make up for with classic grace and service. Elevator service to the 21st floor was cool and we were looking forward to a cocktail and some music. After checking our IDs we were told that he was giving us a pass on the dress code. Really? There were people seated wearing old school jeans??? If you are going to allow someone in, don't ruin it by telling them you are not happy with their attire. No one offered to seat us. We picked a small table in the uncrowded room. A waitress appeared soon to take our drink order. The drinks were right off the cocktail menu but it took 10 minutes for them to arrive. By then we were growing impatient and hoped for a great drink. Mine was meh at best. I left $40 dollars on the table to cover the two drinks and we showed ourselves out. I've checked The Starlight Room off my list.
author: Larry L.

description:
I came to the Sunday's a Drag brunch recently with some friends to celebrate a special occasion. The show was a lot of fun and the food was pretty good, but we didn't appreciate the waitresses trying over and over to get us to buy their overpriced drinks. I had wanted an iced tea and they told me they didn't have any. Oh, come on! This is a hotel with several restaurants. 

Well, an iced tea was miraculously procured abut 3- minutes later, bu they never refilled our water glasses, despite several requests. 

Add the lousy service to the fact that a mandatory 20% tip is built in (no mention of that is made on the website or when you make a reservation), two stars is just about what the place warrants.  Oh, and we were a party of four - a small group that didn't warrant a mandatory charge in my book.
author: .Hon H.

description: It is so hard to find a place for middle age people to dance!  My girlfriend and I come to San Francisco twice a year to get away for some fun times. We happened to choose The Starlight Room this time because we were staying at the hotel.  We loved it!  Great view, great dance floor!  I loved the first DJ but the second one just played house music, which I don't care for.  We are looking forward to visiting The Starlight Room again when we come in March.
author: Carol H.

description:
I've only been here once on vacation on a Tuesday night and it was the PERFECT place to catch a drink with a great view of the city. The staff was incredible and very attentive. Drinks were tasty. The atmosphere is very old money feeling with comfy booths and thick window drapery which was a nice change of pace from all the ultra modern lounges that seem to be popular today.

I only regret not coming here on a Wednesday or Sunday. Maybe next time!
author: Tina P.

description: What a fun place to have gone for a drink - beautiful open view - didn't see the sunset but I'll try it again during the summer time ..seats could be a bit more comfortable but the drinks and small apps were great.  The service was prompt and on point ....they do shows here but I was too hungry to hang out for that.
author: JOE M.

description:
Starlight room is a great spot to celebrate a special evening out. Situated on the 21st floor of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel, the classy club offers beautiful views of San Francisco's city sky scape. Here, the rich, extravagant interior and luxurious lounge chairs are fit for a king. Perfect place to sit back, relax, and sip champagne or a signature "Cable Car" cocktail.  Bar bites include seafood snacks, gourmet pizzas, and fillet mignon sliders. For a sweet treat, enjoy a plate of fresh strawberries, rich chocolate sauce, and sweet cream frache. Nothing screams "special occasion" more! 

Continue your night on the dance floor. Live music playing all ages hits in a "wedding party" way. The intimate dance space is surrounded by large, open windows offering romantic 360* views of beautiful city below. 

Service is spectacular. The bouncers, bartenders, and helpful hostesses all go the extra mile to make the night one to remember. 

Be prepared to pay  the price for the room's royal treatment. Cover is 15 a person and cocktails are costly. But an evening at the Starlight Room is worth every precious penny. Guaranteed to make you're next celebration sweet - the Starlight Room is a delicious San Francisco treat!
author: Caroline J.

description: This place was just alright .. I mean it's on the top of the building of the Sir Francis Drake hotel and looking over the city, but if ur a bit older then me this lounge is perfect.. It's like a midlife crisis exploded up there.. Music was really good but just a very older crowd
author: John G.

description: Visited because if your from SF you have to go at least once. Glad I did but can't see myself going back until I am at least 40 since it's for the more mature crowd. I still enjoyed myself and the view was just as lovely as the pictures portray. I suggest going back for NYE based on the reviews it seemed like the place to be to ring in the new year.
author: Angelica M.

description: Harry Denton's Starlight Room is at the top of the Sir Francis Drake hotel.  While not completely panoramic views, it does have a great view, a fun DJ, and a disco ball.  The space is lounge-y, with a dance floor next to the windows.  After 10, a younger crowd came in for dancing.  I just went for drinks, and I loved my Savoy Bounce, while expectedly pricey, was strong.  Service was great - the man who escorts you to the table is hilarious.
author: Lia M.

description:
This used to be the place to party on a Wednesday night. It's gotten really old, however. Not old as in "Peter Pan Syndrome" 20-and-30-somethings. Old as in...Fifty-somethings.

Everyone has a right to party, but I'm gonna have to find a different Wednesday night scene.
author: Michael C.

description:
I was just there this Sat (Aug 1st) and it was definitely not a place I would like to return in the future.


I went to the Starlight Room, because of a friend's b-day party. I love the friend's crowd and the view. (The view is amazing... for the view only I would give five starts, but...) However, everything else was just not for me.

First, the dance floor is very small.

Second, the average age of the dance floor was 50+.... I am a dancer and it is nearly impossible for me not to dance, but this night, I didn't even move my feet... 

Third, I hated the crowd... for me there was no class and was not for young people. I have no problem going to older crowd, but this crowd really gave me uncomfortable atmosphere. I saw few couples making out when some people were still dining.

It was just NO NO NO for me. 
The view was great, but it was pretty much it. 
(I checked yelp before going to this place, and low ratings I saw pretty much said the right things.)
author: Sayaha A.

description:
Finally!  After living in San Francisco for 5 years, I finally got to experience the bar/club of the (in)famous Harry Denton!  I can actually see the Starlight Room lights flashing from my place and have always been curious what it was like inside.

Last Saturday, we came here for a friend's birthday.  I looked at the drink menu online prior to arrival so I knew I wanted the drink called Devilish - a sweet combination of apple juice, vodka and ginger beer!  I quite liked it (although my bf thought the price of $10 was a little over-priced).  The entry cover was $10 too - we're not big club-goers, so oh well, we can stand to pay a bit of a cover every so often.  

It was a hot day that day and with all the body heat and drinking, it was quite steamy in the Starlight Room.  We were tired and were getting slightly dehydrated so we headed out a little early.  Good times though and at least I finally got to experience this landmark bar & club.  Happy Birthday, Susan!!

Saturday night cover = $10
Devilish drink = $10
author: Maile N.

description: I've never eaten here, I can only speak for everything else. Coat check is always really polite. A long wait for drinks sometimes but it comes with the territory and the drinks are fine. We mostly come here for the dancing and the view- both are amazing!! Makes for a very romantic date night spot for couples who don't get out a whole lot. You get to people watch and dance and see some liveliness without having to stomach a nightclub. And did I mention the view is amazing?? Nothing bad to say about this spot.
author: Brianna C.

description: On March 27th myself and my brand new husband along with about 6 friends of ours stopped by here after a long day of celebrating our wedding. We were all staying at the hotel so we thought "why not?" and popped in wearing all our wedding finery thinking we would have one more drink before calling it a day. It was around 1am and we were all charged $10 to gain entry into a nearly empty bar. Some of my friends turned around and left before I realized what was going on. I asked the door guy if he was seriously going to charge me and my wedding guests $10 each to come in there at 1am, and he said "someone has to fill our pockets", as though it was money going to him. At that point some of the others had already paid, so we were in and I figured we might as well enjoy ourselves. I went to the bar and ordered a drink and they called last call literally right as I walked up. What kind of place charges a bride and groom $10 each to come in to a bar 5 minutes before last call? A shitty place. I will never go there, never send anyone there, never recommend it to anyone. Screw this place.
author: Jeannine S.

description: Miss seeing Harry Denton at this venue as he really made the place one of the fun "go to" places in the city for drinks. Here's to you Harry!
author: David G.

description:
WOW!!!

I've been at this beautiful hotel before but I've never knew about this lovely little place on the 22nd floor even existed! My friends and I came on a Wednesday night, I didn't really think people partied on a Wednesday but apparently they do! I don't know if there was cover or how much it is because our group did bottle service but these bouncers/security men are all dressed as if they're Secret Service or something with their suits and ear pieces. 

Anyways, as we were led to our booth, I was just in complete ''awe". The view was soo pretty! The dance floor wasn't big nor was it too small. It was so cool to be dancing the night away while the huge windows let you stare over the city. The crowd, however, has to be the most random and weirdest set I've ever seen--all in one place. But, hey...we are in San Francisco. 

So, if you're ever in the area on a Wednesday, definitely check this place out!
author: Dung N.

description: This place was inside the Sir Francis Drake Hotel. Very cool inside. Great music, great drinks, and the coolest view of San Francisco! I loved the fried Mac and cheese squares they had for an appetizer. If you are in the city visiting I recommend you come here even if it's just for the view & a drink!
author: G B.

description:
First time I've been here so I have nothing to compare with to how it was before.  But the view is AMAZING! You can see the entire downtown SF area. Gorgeous red and gold walls with velvet booths and chandelliers galore.  Very classy.

Cant give this a good review because one...they use pisco for their drinks and its a bit on the sweet side for me. I did enjoy the Glenfidditch tasting tho. I could've given a review for the food, but honestly I didn't have any!!!  All I had was a little cube of watermelon with a hot pepper on it.  Thats it!  They needed more tray passers. They had more waiters coming out to collect glasses than to serve food.  If this reflects the service at this place....I think I'll pass for now.
author: Gina S.

description: I've been to Sunday's a Drag at the Starlight Room several times now.  The food is great, the view is beautiful and the show is so much fun!  So many of us live in or near San Francisco and never do the "tourist thing."  I absolutely recommend this being one of those things you actually try.  The show is different each time.  Everyone raves about the bacon...and hey, it is good bacon, but ALL of the food is delicious!  Come, sample everything and enjoy being entertained for an hour!  (Call ahead, though, since the shows often sell out!)
author: Lori M.

description:
I went for Sunday's A Drag and it was FABULOUS! 

The performers were all excellent - Cassandra Cass was TO DIE FOR in her Jessica Rabbit dress. The MC was very good and overall the ladies were all extremely entertaining and funny. 

The buffet was also quite good - there was a good variety of food including an omelette bar and a carving station. The drink specials of the day were also very good - definitely old-timey and fit the vibe of the Starlight Room perfectly.

The views were beautiful even though the sun shades were down. It was really nice to be able to see the city from so high up. 

I thoroughly enjoyed myself as did the party I went with. We will definitely be returning as this was one of the most enjoyable and entertaining afternoons we have had!
author: Andrea C.

description:
I recommend the "Cable Car" cocktail, a special cocktail design and invented by the world famous Bar Chef Tony Abou-Ganim. In the San Francisco, Harry Denton and his clubs are an institution This place has is no different, it has wonderful city views, great atmosphere and ambiance.

The service is incredible, the Bar Chef's are professionals and make outstanding cocktails. The staff is gracious and accommodating.
author: Brian S.

description: The inside was neat and atmosphere was pretty good but they had the worst music the night we were there. One Pitbull song after another, mixed in with some early-2000s hip hop hits (not the good kind). Meh.
author: Marta S.

description: Loved it....Have gone to 2 events at this place; the service is amazing, our waitress was the best
author: Vivian L.

description:
Came here with a group last night and I was bored before I paid $15 cover. Starlight is a lounge area on the top floor of the Sir Francis Drake, a design which really needs to be remodeled. 

The place is a mixture of Peppermill that once was in Daly City and The Cafe which is a gay club in the Castro. Once one walks in there is a large bar on ones left and coat check and restrooms on the right. Walking in further is tables filled with people eating. So if your here for food, your going to have a bunch of people walking around you trying to squeeze into a tiny dance floor. And if you are hear to dance, your dancing to 80's music on a tiny little dance floor. 

Just the combination of a restaurant and dance floor in a dilapidated decor isn't that bad when your talking about a small room to begin with. But to charge people a $15 cover just to do so is outrageous.
author: M C.

description: The people watching is hilarious. The view of the city is nice but you will see some strange. Creepy out of towners and old people making out like teenagers sends out the weird vibes. This place is for your old uncle after popping some Viagra. Drinks were so-so.
author: Jonathan W.

description: FYI, they only allow one credit card per table. And there was a cockroach at our table. Wtf!
author: Natalie S.

description: Old school lounge with killer view. Love the 70's style dresses worn by the waitresses.  Takes me back to the old days. Drinks are VERY strong.  Almost too much. Matre'd was very nice. Dance floor very small.
author: Cat M.

description:
Went there with a group to celebrate a bday. 

Top stars and ratings to Rikki and Sebastien for reserving  tables, drinks, and entrance in advance. Excellent service.

I go 1-2 times per year and like the place because of the usually short line, nice view and good dancing. This past weekend, I didn't care much for the music, it was great util midnight, then the music changed. When half the dance floor leaves, that should be a clue to the DJ that this is not the music people like.
author: Peter J.

description: Warning! This place has really gone downhill. They used to feature great live MoTown bands, with vocalists. Now it's a crappy DJ and they've raised the cover (!)
author: Robert Y.

description:
I feel somewhat bad about giving this place 2 stars, as I always have an enjoyable time while I'm here. But here's why it only deserves 2 stars...

$10 cover charge to get in ($5 if you have a hotel key... yes, I borrowed some dude's hotel key to make my cover charge less). Somehow I've managed to get around the cover charge almost every time, or at least make it less than $10. I'd never pay $10 to get into this place. There are better bars and dance clubs in the area that are free to get into.

The decor in this place is DRAB. Completely old fashioned. The Starlight Room is grandparents house meets night club.

Pretty much everyone in this place is a tourist, but you get a few of those regular douchebags who "know the owner" so they're there every night. There are a lot of older people in this place. I don't really want to be intentionally  rubbed up against by a 50 year old creeper on the way-too-small dance floor. No thanks.

The music is okay. You get your standard top 40 here, the norm.

Bartenders are friendly. That's a plus.

The view is incredible. Pretty sure about 90% of the people that live in SF that actually come to this spot is ONLY for the view, and nothing more. However, there are way too many other local places with a view to ever have an excuse to come here.

So why have I been here on multiple occasions? Because I'm with a group of friends, I'm not completely sober, and someone comes up with the brilliant idea that we should all go to the Starlight Room.  When I sober up, I realize I don't like it-- each, and every.single.time. However, come with a group of friends, and you're going to have fun anyways.
author: Ashley D.

description: Located at the top of Sir Francis Drake hotel.  We wanted to have a different experience and yes, we got one.  The host was very personable.  He sat us within a few minutes (I got the seating karma this night) and event got a window seat.  Wow.  Dancing with the view of SF is really cool.  We can even see the lighted Christmas Tree on Union Square.  Music was upbeat.  Really really enjoyable place.  Its a must try if you are in SF bay.
author: Madelene Z.

description:
There comes a time in everyone's life when signs of old age are unwittingly bequeathed upon us. We notice this when our joints begin to creek, muscles hurt for no particular reason, and a game such as bowling or softball leaves us sore for days. When this time arrives, most of us tend to sigh and admit defeat while others feverishly deny it by saying "I used to be able to (Insert amazing feat of superhuman abilities here)." 

Your crows feet do not lie. Being able to do something in the past admits you can't perform the same thing now. You're old. 

And you go to the Starlight Room. 

The music varies from 70s-80s to hip hop, trip hop, rock, and lounge music. Everything can be played except any music above 80 bpm which would undoubtedly explode any hearing devices some patrons wear and cause hip replacement surgery cases  to sky rocket. 

Proof this place is old? During Wednesday night Indulgence, the fire department is there partaking in the festivities wearing full uniform. You can't fool me. Underneath that jacket hides a defribillator. I see the hump. And those lovely lady lumps from the Go-Go dancers. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LgLCqhkraxI I even took a video because one day I'll be too old to remember what I had for lunch.

A varied crowd from the freshly graduated "I want to grow up but can't really afford the $10 vodka/cranberry" to the "I need a cane to get to the dance floor" comes mixed in a unique combination of random chaos theory. The great thing is that it works. Everybody's got a place in the Starlight Room. The 3 room areas are spacious, the view from the top of the Sir Francis Drake is breathtaking, and during the holiday season, Macy's lightshow is visible and adds to the ambiance by reflecting cool Christmas light patterns off the disco ball.

That is, if can remember it...
author: Jason C.

description: The dj is great there, the view were great but the crowd was just not exactly what I m used to. I feel like a little too tourist there and a bit older than I thought it would be. The place was great but not quite for me and my friends. I always see the light from union square and always wonder how it is up there. I wouldn't mind coming again if I have the right people with me.
author: Carol H.

description:
I've been hearing about the Starlight Room since I was two and a half feet tall. That didn't set me up with any unrealistic expectations, surprisingly.  My only expectations were of the view. I mean that's all I ever heard about it, coupled with silly stories told behind grandiosity. Funny how the stories didn't stick, but rumors of the view did. The view came through. I took a million and one pictures that I will keep under my pillow. 

Moving my eyes from the beautiful outside to the beautiful inside, I spotted divine household accoutrements that would fair well within my humble abode - mostly sofas and chairs. I didn't take any home with me, but there's always next time. 

As superficial as I tend to be with regard to aesthetic design, the mishmash deejaying and interesting array of people didn't phase me. Although, an interesting array of folk is something I do quite enjoy, mishmash musical adventures are not. I heard music from every genre that night. Maybe we can attribute this to it being a weeknight.

Mr. Denton, I plan to return to your room sometime in the near future.
author: Jaime L.

description:
I am writing this review especially for the 
'Sunday's Are A Drag' Brunch.

First of all..... The Starlight Room looks great in the day light.  They lightly block the windows, and create a Stage in the center of the main room.  For the brunch ...... a buffet of quite good food.  Everything from Chicken and Waffles, 
French Toast, an Omelette Station, Prime Rib Carving Station, all kinds of yummy things....  Good desserts, and a selection of juices..... They encourage you to go back multiple times.  Extra points for the guy who busses the empty plates!  He does not let dirty dishes linger!  Then.... it is Showtime.  I've seen Donna Sachet around for years.... but.... I had no idea how talented she really is.  She is the Star of the show, and the MC.  She sings in her own voice..... and is completely hysterical when she is talking with the audience.  She goes by every table, and makes everyone feel so welcome..... like she is doing the show just for them.  She looks every person in the eye as she makes her rounds.  The other performers are fantastic...... Each one with a different style.  My Republican parents LOVED it!  I did not tell them it was a drag show till we got there!
author: Bryan M.

description: I went there with my girl friends. It was one of girls' birthday. The waitresses there are dressed up in really elegant and beautiful long gowns. The service was extraordinary. The receptionist helped us manage two reserved tables. I really thank his kindness. The view in the dancing room is brautiful. Haha we went there at about 9. And the danving room slowly got crowded at about 10. They mixed up old and mainstream music. It is good place to hang out with friends. If you were tired, you could go to the dininv area to take a rest. Recommend!l
author: Nathalie Y.

description:
Starlight just had a million dollar renovation and it is more lavish then ever.  Now the room matches the million dollar view.  The drinks are haute couture of the whole mixology trend and the decor is reminiscent of times past in the most opulent design.
Sunset cocktails with tasty bar bites make for a very romantic date.  
San Franciscans it is time to revisit Harry Denton's Starlight Room.
author: D B.

description:
A bunch of us crazy girls celebrated a birthday at the Sunday's a Drag this morning.  I can call my friends crazy.... they're all crazy for being friends with such a train wreck.... ME.

Upon entering the Sir Francis drake, my breathe was taken away.  Not just from the stairs, not from the hike in high heels from the parking garage... it is a beautiful hotel.  

The whole point of going to the show is not just the food, but the service and mostly the entertainment.  I was amused throughout the entire show.  Those queens are fucking gorgeous.  I fucking heart them.

Here is a list of what I consumed this morning in the Starlight Room:
bacon (fuck it was good)
bacon (I couldn't get enough of that shit)
eggs benedict (I almost broke a tooth on the muffin)
macaroon (fucking delicious)
bacon (yeah, again)
spinach salad (needed a bit of balance)
2 cups of hot tea (the vanilla bean with 1/2 a packet of sweetener)
1 slice french toast (it didn't need syrup... it was too sweet)

The performances were fun.... I laughed so much, I think I may have peed a bit.... TMI?  Too bad, the show was worth it!
author: Emily S.

description:
I'll have you know:
I AM ONLY A FAN OF THE VIEW.

THE END.

$10 cover. Should be paying ME to come here, shoot.
Drinks were expensive.
Overcrowded through and through (I was basically dancing with the window).
Intensely small dance floor.
Bartenders were J-Shore (read: doucheholes).
DJ was good but mean (Nate Dogg passed the day before; I requested a song by him and he gruffly replied, "I ALREADY played one by him"... WELL SORRRRRY! Sheesh).
Lots of creepsters (aka old men).
Too many dancing hoes. (See above for why I felt bad for them)

But PRETTY VIEW!
author: liz c.

description: Bunch of old people behaving like teens grinding on each other. I was in shock. Only nice part is the views and the strong drinks. I think the staff should have controlled some of these people, especially the older lady who flashed everyone her genitals. I felt like I was at a comedy club the whole night watching old people get down to Rick Ross the boss. Not coming here again.
author: Tatyana N.

description: I just had an awesome time at the "Sunday's a drag" brunch and drag performance   The food was pretty good and included a prime rib carving station and omelets  to order. Salads and eggs Benedict were yummy. There was also a lot of fruit and even chocolate covered strawberries.   Now to the performers: Miss Tia was my favorite.  Her eye makeup was fantastic.  I wish I could do something that glamorous.   Our mc Donna Sashay was so hilarious ! And she sings so well. Part of her act is to talk about the conference for forensic toxicologists. It's supposed to be random but I actually get emails about that conference!!
author: Stephanie L.

description: On top of the world at the Francis Drake Hotel in SF. This place has a great view of San Francisco. Great Atmosphere, good good, what more can you ask for?
author: Eddie G.

description: As it turns out, the 50 dollar charge which I thought was the credit card limit is actually a pending charge that is reduced to the cost of the drinks you ordered after a few days. I do wish the staff informed customers of this instead of assuming we are aware of this "industry standard". However, I still recommend The Starlight Room for its atmosphere.
author: Rosie B.

description:
I found myself at the Starlight Room on a Wednesday night and found this place popping!  I have no idea what the cover charge was since we were on a 'list'.  We also had a large table reserved, only to have it given away when Barry Bonds showed up.  (We arrived after him, and were given a smaller table.  Hey, hook us up then if you're going to give away our table!)

It was definitely crowded and lots of people were on the dance floor.  There are great views from up here and it's a cool little place to vibe on a weekday right in the midst of Union Square.  The music wasn't too bad either.  The drink menu is extensive and expensive, if you can even read it in the dim lighting.

There is a bit of a snobby crowd going on here as girls are dressed as if they are going to be on the red carpet.  (There was a cat-fight that broke out in the ladies' room over a spilled drink!)

Overall, it's a cool place, on a Wednesday night.  The crowd was young - late 20s and 30s.  But with a private elevator that zips you straight to the top, it's definitely a pretentious crowd.  They don't appreciate any loitering near the elevators at all.  I'm not sure if they had an enforceable dress code or not, but I do recall one of the guys in our group in sneakers.  I would go back, as long as I get on that 'list'.
author: Teri C.

description: Aside from the nice view of the city, this is the sort of place I could see myself in when I was in college trying to impress a girl or seam classier than I actually was.  It's very much a vodka tonic or heineken beer place.  I feel like it's also a decent place for NYE, again, if you're trying to impress someone.  I really did not like how when I first stepped into the lounge the bouncer grabs me in the chest region, as if I were storming the beaches, and says something to the effect of "ID and WHERE DO YOU THINK YOU'RE GOING!".  I mean, c'mon dude you're 2 feet taller and have about 200lbs on me.  We needed to walk through a curtain in order to enter the lounge, and proceed to the checkin.  Did the bouncers need to flex his authority at that point?  Was I going to checkin and make a run for the bar to choke down as much alcohol before he got to confirm my ID?  Maybe once I figure out how to move faster than the speed of light that abruptly stopping someone when they first walk in might necessary as a pre-caution.  Tsk tsk
author: Kyle I.

description:
Sunday's a Drag - HOLIDAY EDITION  (that is the name of the Sunday Brunch at the Starlight Room).  This is something that has been going on for a few years, so a group of us decided to go.  You get two things when you go - a buffet brunch and drag show.  

Brunch - Um, 2 stars.  Not the best.  You had an omelet bar which was probably the best part.  They have a meat carving station - not sure what the meat was but it was pretty bland and you had to ask for more than one piece if you wanted more (and you will because they give you a pretty skinny piece).  Bacon was good.  Other stuff was okay - nothing fancy or very tasty.

Holiday Drag show was fantastic.  Hosted by Donna Sachet - she does a great job.  All of the performers were fantastic as well.  They definitely have the performance down!  The holiday show was great, because at the end you get snow.  Oh, and don't be surprised if you go and get pulled up on stage!
author: Jason I.

description: Cocktails are overpriced, but the view is fantastic. The music is really cheesy but fun for dance parties with all girls.
author: Suzanne B.

description: I really was digging this place. The ambiance was romance and maturity and sexiness all at once. Came here for a cocktail with the beau after a nice dinner. The drink was fabulous. More on the expensive side. There was a dance floor with a few brave souls (it was on the earlier side). My only complaint was the DJ. Definitely room for improvement in that area. I'd go back again.
author: Judi B.

description: We stopped by a rainy Sunday before Christmas.  Very classic old time bar. Bonus was meeting the stars of the Drag review!  Harry was at the bar and gave my newly-college-graduated son some great "real world" advice that I hope he takes to heart.  Great guy.  The Bloody Mary is probably one of the best I have ever had.  Classic, simple, great ingredients.  As Harry told me, it is all in the horseradish.  He is so right.  We can't wait to go back next year!
author: Teresa A.

description: Only reason I am giving this a 2 is because it had a nice view. The waitstaff was horrible. Didn't ask us hardly how we were doing. Took too long to take orders and give us our drinks. BUMMER
author: Emily H.

description:
Five stars for the view, four stars for the kitschy, bordello-like decor complete with red velvet seats, heavy drapery and doorman in a tux (their schtick I guess), and 3 stars for the drinks (too pricey and was not bowled over, did not even finish it).

Love, Love, Love it though when the DJ played "I left my heart in San Francisco" as the last song of the night.  Just the right note to end a wonderful evening with friends, complete with the blinking lights of Union Square.

A place to visit if you are ever lucky enough to visit the Bay.
author: Caren L.

description:
This is the place you wanna be on Wednesday night when you are in San Francisco! 
Located inside the elegant Sir Francis Drake Hotel!

Great place to hang out with a group of friends!
Such a happening place on Wednesday night!

Make sure that you dress proper for it!
Just like most club the guard usually pick and choose for who can come in and who cannot.

So ladies.. be as pretty as you can!
You do want to look hot here!

And guys, please don't be too casual.. You want to look good, chic, fashionable and elegant to get in, so the guard will not have a second thought and should let you guys in right away!

Beautiful people!
But also be careful there is some fool drunk people will buzzing around you, so make sure that you bring some guys friend with you to protect you from those people.

I my self almost let my inner tiger out! 
Thank God one of my guy friend pulled me away and protect me from those drunken fools! So I can keep Inner Tiger sleep and sound inside and be a Lucky Lady!

But overall, I love to be in this place!
The music rhythm is keeps us groovin', the drinks give us a fun buzz.

The bartender was pretty cool give us some entertainment by throw, turn and spin those glass shaker giving us some acrobatic shows! 

Fantastic! And that is what we're lookin' for!
author: Lydia P.

description:
hmmmmm this place was kinda fun and exclusive....  I like the fact that it was at the top floor of the hote, and overlooked the city. I was at a press realease shoot for designs by Danielle Pette (She's awesome!)
And my secreto crush came with me (He's awesome) unexpetedly had a hellova time. I'd definitely go back. This place is a great spot to go chill with close friends, and just have a close knit kick back, knock back a few drinks, and dance the night away (haha cheesy line). LOVE it, will definitely go back. It also held that my friend is the bouncer there! =)
author: Shai W.

description:
Two words...oh my.
Oh my.
Ok, maybe that was 4.
author: Drea L.

description:
Wonderful night!
Bit of a fuss to get in as they had a private party first, so they opened late. Had to wait in the lobby downstairs in the bar.
Music was great. Motown and current music was wonderful. Danced for hours! tables were reserved at a fee so we stood or danced. Mixed crowd, 20-50s mostly couples dancing. 
Great drinks on the pricey side.
Superb view of the city
author: Katrina N.

description:
Every Sunday Harry Denton's Starlight Room serves a buffet style brunch and then has a drag show. There are two shows/seatings each time and usually 3 or 4 performers.

Harry Denton's itself:
Well, the space is designed a bit oddly. Like the bar area...they built a bar right where there should be a window, so they've obstructed the view. I hope they have attractive bartenders to make up for it. For brunch the whole "we're on the 21st floor of the Sir Francis Drake" is wasted because they hide some more windows with a stage backdrop and put the brunch buffet right in front of what appears to be the largest set of windows. The people making your omelets would have a fabulous view if they turned around.

For the drag show brunch they put a few tables where there probably shouldn't be any for traffic flow reasons, and the first time I went there people (especially one server) were bumping into my chair over and over again. Other seats have a partially obstructed view of the stage.

The food:
Sorry, but the brunch is pretty horrible. I'm not a big fan of buffets and cafeteria style dining anyway, I really want people to come to my table and bring me food to order and not stand in a line for some old, cold, limp mass-produced crap. At least with Harry Denton's the service didn't suffer from the fact that it was a buffet...so many times it means the servers and other staff just treat you like cattle, but at Harry D's the servers are still friendly and eager to get you a cocktail and plates are cleared away quickly but not too quickly.

Did I mention the food was horrible? If I ever have brunch there again (like, if my dad and stepmother were visiting, I might take them) I think I will just have an omelet and then some dessert. Don't eat anything from the warming pans! Seriously awful food. At the end the chef came out and everyone was supposed to applaud her and I was applauding because this was her last day before she went off to have a baby. Please-oh-please let the new "chef" serve something better...or better yet, couldn't they do away with the buffet, charge a cover charge for the show, and just make a normal brunch menu? Gak. Please?

The cocktails are somewhat outrageously priced, but tasty. I think you're paying for the view, but on Sundays there really isn't one.

The show:
I'm happy I found this show...it's too bad they were closed on Easter when my mom was in town. Really, this is a great place to take visiting family (especially if they like generic brunch buffets) with a drag show that isn't too intimidating and is really fun. They have a nice variety of performers, and although most of them are lip-syncing there are a few (including the MC, Donna) who sing. Actually, Donna is pretty good. My bf says it's because s/he chooses songs wisely and knows her range. Whatever, she's a great MC.

Other highlights of the show are Cassandra Cass, who is very beautiful with a lot of energy and great costumes. I hear she is also at Asia SF, so for that reason alone I want to go check that place out. And...I can't remember her name (or maybe I never quite caught what it was in the first place) but there is another performer who did Reba McIntyre the first time we were there and did Lucille Ball the second time, and she was really amazing. Her vitameatavegamin skit had everyone practically rolling in the aisles laughing, which was quite a feat considering she lip-synced the whole thing and had to act it all out at the same time.

We were there on the one year anniversary of the show and Donna did this really great number that included two shirtless guys with bowties and even ended with Harry Denton himself on the stage doing some chorus-line kicks...they should do that every time.

Conclusion:
If you're looking for a place to take your out-of-town visitors on a Sunday, to give them a slightly titillating San Francisco experience in a harmless environment, and they wouldn't know good food if it hit them over the head, or if you just REALLY LOVE drag shows, then I recommend Harry Denton's Starlight Room Sunday's a Drag show. Heck, you could always eat before you go.
author: Laura 'jinx.tv' K.

description:
One of my favorite places to go in the city, mid-week. Harry Denton allows Sebastian Entertainment to take over the venue on Wednesday nights to spin hip-hop tracks and old skool favs. The crowd is always such a great mix, it's hard to categorize it. A lot of European folks tend to hear about this place and check it out.

There's usually a line to get into the elevator to go upstairs to the lounge and cover is around $10 if you aren't on the guest list. Drinks are expensive but generously made. I've always had a great time here, dancing the night away. The deal maker is the amazing view you get of Union Square and the city. It's simply breathtaking!
author: Kalpita P.

description:
Came here on 2/29/12 when my Niece was in SF visiting and/or working on a short term internship.  I was quite disappointed in this place even though the waitress was quite the tall cutie.  First off all we ordered were a few appetizers and drinks this evening and it took forever for them to serve my drink while my companions received their drinks and others around us received their drinks.

So -1 Rating for their crappy Bar Tenders that can't keep their orders straight, which is quite sorry as this place was not full at ALL.  The Server was VERY nice but what can they do when they have IDIOT bar tenders working for them.

I doubt I'll ever come back to this overly rated pretentious place as there are soooo many better places in the city.  Perhaps this business needs to take a serious look at their staff and NOT depend on the fame of their name and once in a while gorgeous view to attract people.

Needless to say I won't be bringing my friends or family to this place anytime soon.
author: Arthur Z.

description:
I love this place.  Very classy, romantic, beautiful, high energy.  All glass window dance floor & for most of the club - a 21st floor view of San Francisco from the center (Union Sq).

Dancing is great, the age distribution includes not just 20's & 30's - and all seem quite cool.

Club staff are not friendly to customers, though, e.g.- on Halloween as they cleared the club, I wasn't allowed to even retrieve my suit coat from my chair 100 feet back.  Pretty bad imo.  Would like to say its a one-off but there's more...

Otherwise, a fab place!
author: Jack F.

description: Good views. Okay cocktails. Terrible service. Don't go here unless you don't mind being late to whatever you're doing afterwards.
author: Geoff B.

description: Went for a 30th birthday party. It was a great idea in theory, but in reality it was like being trapped at a bad wedding. Except instead of an open bar, you have to pay a million dollars per drink and you aren't partying with your drunk relatives, just old strangers. I've heard brunch can be nice though.
author: Karen G.

description:
Only thing that bumped this up from a 2 star to 3 star is the location. What a view! The insides look posh and there are usually hot girls(paid working girls) here (and a few real hotties), but over all it's more of a ghetto fabulous wannabees. Really the music is really last decade news and most djs don't transition that well. Burlesque dancers in the lounge area are hot! The vibe's more a poser and wannabee crowd. Drinks are expensive and really you feel like you get stuck in a small space. And you don't want to leave because the cover was so expensive, plus to get to another venue takes effort going down stairs and walking around to the nearest club. If you've got a tourist in town who's never been here or seen the city take them here. If you want to have a good time without feeling like you're just watching your wallet drain away come here.

Really though. What an awesome view!
author: Jason S.

description:
Saw the drag show as a groupon customer. It was great that they allowed one groupon per person at the tables. The place was overly made up, a left over from another age and just plain cheesy. 
Perfect for a drag brunch! 
They were entertaining for an an audience that was composed mostly of tourists, and folks like us, drag aficionados. 
The "gals" were talented. The brunch itself was fair,. And the service was passable. Overall, it was worth the groupon price we each
author: lily l.

description: Came here for a night out with the ladies on Saturday and we loved it. The music was great, they played a mixture of 80's, 90's and today hits. The appetizer menu was not so great and serving sizes were very small, but besides that the music, view, and the whole atmosphere was fantastic. We will definitely be coming back!
author: Amalia G.

description:
This review is for New Year's Eve.

Harry, you devil.
author: Sir M.

description:
This place was a life saver! I was in Frisco for 3 days during the week and had a hard time finding a club scene on a Wednesday night. This was probably the only place that was bumpin that day! Indulgence was what saved us. The place was a full blown dance club on a Wednesday night!

Other than the event, the place was really fancy! We only paid $10 cover and felt like we should have paid $30 or more. The dance floor was surrounded by a 180 degree view of the city, NICE! Coat check was free, but a tip was appreciated.

I had to give it 4 stars because the place did get very very crowed! The dance floor was impenetrable and still, more people were piling in.

If you don't mind a very crowded club, then this place is great, even on a Wednesday night!
author: Steve M.

description:
I came here for drinks and appetizers. The place is beautiful- you can't beat the view, looking down Union Square or up to the sky on a clear night. And the service was prompt. The food and drinks were nothing memorable- just fine. 

The crowd was also significantly older... Not that there's anything wrong with that. I just didn't find this to be aimed at the under 30 crowd (at least not on the Friday night I went- and it wasn't being used as a club). I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here.
author: Sonia M.

description:
Went here with some friends for a birthday trip in San Francisco. The view is great but it was hard to take any pictures from up there due to the loud speakers so you'll have to take my word for it. Drinks were expensive but the live band and DJ made the overall experience worth it. Better than any place in Monterey, that's for sure. 

I'd love to visit in the day next time I'm in the city. Not a place to go to meet women. Starlight room is more of a date location. We had an expectation of dress code here, but people walked in in sandals and hooded sweatshirts... must be a California thing... I was slightly disappointed.

P.S. Don't expect a table unless you agree to a $300.00 bar tab!
author: Matt A.

description: The venue was really nice and the drinks were good. The bartenders and waiters are also really nice and welcoming, but I don't recommend it for people who are about 20-30, because even though the music itself was okay, a lot of the people that were there were kinda old. Definitely not for the younger crowd. And they didn't start playing the good music until after my friends and I left. In the beginning the music was old school like 90s and 80s and some early 2000s. Then they started playing hip hop and house music. But really there were hardly any people around my age and I'm 21.
author: Marquis L.

description: The Sunday's a Drag Brunch is great fun!!!  Be sure to have reservations and bring your wallet because drinks are not free.  The brunch is good enough but the show is what makes it.  Great place to take your mom (I did) as it is during the day and a welcoming show.  We were a group of twelve, but be forewarned - they do not do separate checks so have everyone in your party bring cash if you are splitting checks.
author: Bryan H.

description:
This is definitely a must go place in San Francisco.  It's on the 21st floor of the elegant Sir Francis Drake hotel.  

The cover charge the night we went was only $10.  That was Saturday.  I had a cosmo and it was really good.  I like a lot!

The dance floor was packed and crowded, goes very well with my taste.  And they played music that can really get anybody to shake their booties :).  Very nice party place indeed.

And who wouldn't love the view.  I love the city of San Francisco at night.  And to see it from a lovely place, really sets the mood.  I heard they offer brunch and dinner here.  I am excited to come back and dine here.
author: Pam S.

description:
I asked where the smoking section was and the pretentious door man that checked my ID said on the first floor on the side walk!  He could have said he don't have a smoking section instead of being such a smart a**.

The crowd consisted of sleazy guys that did not know when to stop staring and prostitutes...not like I have a problem with working girls..I just don't want to hanging out on their corner them.

It was fishy was poorly lit! This is what hell must be like! One plus was the view!!
author: Musenge L.

description:
Sweeping views and better service have once again made this venue popular to many - especially out of town guests who would like a short walk to this venue in Union Square. Nice to see things have improved. 

Sebastian Entertainment -www.sebastienpresents.com - has the longest running Wednesday night party in the city here. S.E. has the pulse on what clients want...and S.E. has delivered for over a decade.
author: Michael G.

description:
If I ever need someone rubbed out by a guy named Ivan, I now know where to come.

It's only when you actually see them together that you realize that Russians and Persians are destined by Almighty God to party together.  Never before have I seen so much chest hair, 4-carat gold-plated neck gear, or bootleg Armani/DG. gear.

I did, however, appreciate the opportunity to pay $15 for a martini.  You don't get that option every night.

Lots of deep pile red carpet, too.  I anticipate that's so that they don't have to do much cleaning after Ivan the Iceman gets shanked at his table.
author: Ben P.

description: great area, amazing views, very good Sunday brunch, and a great show, with talented performers...just the slight down-side was the price/cost per person...
author: Ara L.

description: This review is for the Sunday's a Drag Brunch only. First of all, I want to say that we like this room. It is old school and very San Francisco. The Sir Francis Drake is a charming old hotel and as far as we've ever known, it has had a good reputation. That is why we thought we would have a good experience at the brunch. As it turned out, we had such a bad experience that we couldn't believe it.  It was clear from the beginning the staff didn't have their act together. It started out with bad service and then the afternoon only went from bad to worse. It took forever and a day for the wait staff to take our drink order and then forever to get our drinks. BTW, a pitcher of Mimosas (a carafe, mind you) is priced at $60. Yes, you heard me...sixty dollars.  Cocktails are priced at $13. Only New York has worse cocktail prices but that's the Big Apple for you. Anyway, the tables are small and barely big enough to eat a meal comfortably on. Halfway into the brunch, there was little food left on the buffet tables. We could not believe it. While I will spare you the other gory details, I will tell you I would not recommend this brunch. That it is ridiculously over-priced at $60 a pop (not including cocktails and tip) has got to mean they cater to the tourists. That others have raved about it is surprising considering the unfortunate experience we had. Needless to say, we were extremely disappointed with what we thought would be a fun afternoon. What a shame. We actually were looking forward to this experience but it certainly didn't work out the way we thought it would. Definitely would not recommend it.
author: Rabbit B.

description:
This place is definitely not for the young adults looking to experience anything hip. If you like to chum with 40 + year old people when you are in your 20s, looking to hang out at a cool trendy place with people about your age and NOT wanting to get down to KC and the Sunshine band, not a good place for you to go. If it weren't for being with my silly and fun sister, I would have been bored shitless because it was too old for me. I had to drink quite a bit to have a good time. After about 7 cocktails, I got my ass on the dance floor and hustled my heart out to the Bee Gees, but I won't be going back until I am closer to 40. By then, they'll be playing "Old school Justin Timberlake" tunes. 

Basically, if you do decide that you must go just to see the panoramic view of San Francisco or if you are staying at the hotel, then expect the place to be shoulder to shoulder packed and lacking service due to all the hustle and bustle. The poor servers have to wear black formal gown in heals all night because that's there uniform, so that sets the tone. The MC is very retro and plays much R&B and Smooth Jazz for your listening pleasure..... The drinks are made very well. Yeah, that's about it. There are many other places to go to in San Francisco. Go here if you must.
author: Dwan M.

description:
I went here Sunday night (4th of July) for their holiday party.  My friend had a comped bottle of vodka for her birthday so we sat down and were immediately waited on and before I knew it I had an ice-cold Vodka Soda in my hand.

Despite the fog, the views were great.  The decor was very subtle and relaxing with comfy booths and couches.  Small sized dance floor and the place was not packed (which was great).  I heard it gets really packed for their mid-week parties on Wednesdays; but I work during the week, so I won't be heading there on a Wednesday anyways.

The servers were all dressed in elegant dresses and the bouncers had tuxedo's on.  They definitely fit the vibe of the place.  Overall it was a fun night.  The DJ was good too - I'd definitely recommend this spot to a friend looking for a more relaxing lounge with good music.

P.S.  I gave only 4 outta 5 stars b/c the bouncers let some guy in wearing 2 polo shirts with double popped collars (white and blue).  Patriotic yes, but we aren't in Jersey "bro" -- The Situation called, he wants his style back!!
author: David W.

description: Great views, great drinks and great people. Michael has to be the best manager of any lounge/nightclub I have been to. He and his staff know how to go above and beyond to service their guests. They took a bleak looking night and turned it into a night to remember. Thanks all at Starlight!
author: Elle T.

description: This is such a classy place with a great view of all of downtown. So beautiful and elegant. Even our cocktail servers wear long black flowy dresses. How nice...I went there on a weekend and had bottle service in one of the booths...I had so much fun and I had such a great time. Their view of the city is just magnificent and they also have a dance floor too. There is an admissions fee but I think it's all worth it.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
Despite the "mature" crowd and stodgy decor (including but not limited to the male employees in tuxes and women dressed like Vanna White a la Wheel of Fortune), my girlfriends and I had fun dancing the night away here. No lines and it helped that we were hotel guests... as guests we only paid $5 cover as opposed to $10. I think $10 is a little ridiculous for this "club" to charge. The dance floor is teeny tiny and despite them playing Top 40, it's not very hip -- their live band ran us off the dance floor a few times -- but I suppose the view is worth it.  Bonus? We all hit the sack at different times so it was really convenient to just take the elevator down to our rooms. Bottom line: If you're not staying here and you're under the age of 35, I wouldn't make this a destination, esp. if you're looking to get your groove on. 

Minus stars for:
-Price for what you get: drinks are rather expensive and watered down... 1 gimlet + 1 Ketel One Vodka Cranberry ran me $22! 
-Older crowd (like 50+!)
-Decor/live band
author: Mindy J.

description:
When I read people griping on Yelp about how this place is packed with old folks, I knew it would be right up my alley-- The elderly, more often than not, have got it right! 

I came here for the first time two years ago on my birthday for weekend night dance-party table service and we very much enjoyed the views-- both of the ice rink below and city beyond, as well as the indoor views of older, gold-chain-wearing, off-duty-limo-driver-looking dudes trying to get their swerve on with their "working-girl" dates.

We returned for my birthday this year on a Monday, so no cover and the bar was nearly empty.  The views were just as stellar, the space just as charming, the bartender was entertaining and open to experimentation (I was with a couple of cocktail snobs)...  We had just come from a completely unsavory experience at Top of the Mark. Never again will I cheat on Harry when I want my old-school SF special-occasion fix.
author: Heather H.

description:
I had been to the Starlight Room once on a visit to San Francisco, but hadn't been back since moving here.  I came here for some after-work drinks and appetizers on a Friday night, rolling in around 6:30 before the place started getting really busy.

The host gave us a great table looking out to the western parts of the city; at 20 or 30 floors above the city streets, there really aren't any bad seats in this place, but this one was particularly nice.  We ordered some speciality cocktails.  My wife got the "Old Havana," the Starlight Room's take on a Mojito.  I enjoyed a Partida Margarita with plenty of salt.  We also ordered the "Mezze" plate, which included a very tasty hummus along with pita bread, olives, radishes, and tomatoes.  

The staff was particularly courteous and we were not disappointed with our drinks and food.  Overall, 4 stars for this downtown establishment!
author: Tim N.

description: Experienced Sundays a drag today! Fabulous...and my daughter Madellyn enjoyed it well. Food was good but the performers are what made it great! Lots of energy and great performing! I'm now a fan!
author: Diana D.

description:
A great place for a drink and a chat. The cocktails were amazing. Old Havana for me please, while my wife enjoyed a Bella (peach puree with lemon, pineapple & cranberry juices). Although drinks were great, I would only give the appetizers 3* and would pass next time. 
Now, the 260-degree, top floor city views, on the other hand, only added to the already romantic and elegant ambiance. A place really set in time. The view, drinks and excellent service will make you return again and again.
author: Bryan A.

description:
Perfect for dancing!

My mom's friend was visiting from Canada and wanted to go dancing, so I looked up placed on yelp and settled on this. I'm so glad I did. We arrived on a Friday night around 9pm and they didn't charge us a cover.  We parked for free on Bush and Powell, right by the Stockton garage (which was only $8 for the night).

Almost all the tables were reserved but somehow we managed to get a great booth near the dance floor and band. It's a really cool atmosphere with comfortable seating and really great music. My mom is 60, her friend is 50, and I'm 35 (all women), and the variety of ages in the club was perfect for us. Ages ranged from 21 to 70, with most people in their 30s and 40s, I'm guessing.  The ethnic makeup was a nice variety of white, asian, black and hispanic. The crowd was okay looking, not bad, though if I was single I might have been disappointed.  The music was really impressive - the live band played a lot of great 70s music, nice variety (of 70s plus other decades, including the recent "Crazy") with lots of energy for dancing.  The singer was awesome - he sounded like Stevie Wonder,  great range, style and tone. He was also great with the audience, moving around occasionally, made lots of eye contact, plus he's hot.  The guitarist and tenor saxophone player both played lots of incredible solos (effective melodic builds and structure, great music references, tons of energy), and both were also great supporting players. The keyboardist and drummer really kept the music moving well, and the keyboardist has a nice voice for backups and lead vocals.  The DJ spun great tunes for dancing (the live band and DJ traded off). 

The dance floor is a great size, at times filled and sometimes empty, but never made me feel crowded or self-conscious (a few people sitting can see the dance floor, but if you don't want to be watched, no problem finding a spot). Some men asked all of us to dance at various points in the evening (we stayed past midnight), but none of them became persistent, so that added to the experience.  I wouldn't go here to meet someone as a single person, but it's perfect for couple and those who just want to have a great time out, drinking and dancing (and if someone in your party doesn't want to dance, there's no pressure with the way it's set up - my mom sat in the booth for much of the night).

The host, Robert, and our waitress were both very attentive, friendly and efficient. We had drinks when we wanted them, and were not pressured to buy more when we were finished. We also felt safe to leave our belongings at the booth unattended, but I also brought my purse to the dance floor because their is a shelf on the edge where you can place drinks and belongings - perfect. The view is incredible, most of the night I felt like I was dancing with San Francisco.  The bathrooms are also nice and I never had to wait. The live music was piped in, too, which I appreciated.

The drinks were tasty. I ordered a Devilish (very light and refreshing, nice girly drink) and a Napa Crush (tasted more like alcohol, still sweet and delicious). My mom ordered a martini (thumbs up) and a Brambo (I think that was the name, it was really good with sweet and sour flavors). Her friend ordered two Cherry Bombs, which she obviously liked (less sweet than my drinks, good for both men and women).  All drinks were $10 each, except the martini ($10.50).
author: Rebecca D.

description:
So after Cityscape, we checked out the Starlight Room (Sir Francis Drake Hotel). The view is  ok (26th floor) compared to Cityscape (46th floor).

There's a cover charge of $15 (by the I'm not a fond of) but whatever, it's my first time. Saturday night was packed, that included a bridal party. For the first time, we felt we were the youngest patrons in the crowd.

There was a live music but unless you are drunk then you won't care. In short it wasn't that great but they did a good job in hyping up the patrons.  We decided to just hang out at the bar. Cocktail prices were pricey, beer and Chambord sour for $20 something. The bartenders were friendly but my Chambord sour tasted like cough syrup, yuck. They do not have hypnotiq or the mix for my hurricane, boo!

Oh well, regardless we made the most of our cover charge. Hhmmm, I might check this place out on Wed night, I heard it's poppin. (dj = hiphop)
author: jubi l.

description:
I love this place. Breathtaking view, nice music on Wednesday nights, friendly staff. We were on the guestlist, so it was free for me and $5 for the guy. The front door people were really friendly, we got there really early so the place was still pretty empty. The bartenders were extremely friendly and fast. 
Really love the Wednesday night music, nice hip-hop, r&b, top 40. I danced like there was no tomorrow:-) 
I think that this along with the Cellar on Sutter will remain my two fav spots in the city.
author: Anisha N.

description: As my husband said, "...ummmm, a little...seedy?". Yep, kind of...icky. Just not super impressed.
author: Kate C.

description: I was there last Saturday. The door guy there pretty rude. I am arrived a little bit passed 10:30pm and I tried to bargain with them because their website said Guestlist close at 11 not 10:30. He just simply showed me the exit. I actually call them twice before this event and want them confirm with me this schedule. but nobody call me back. If I did not have a group of friends wait for me inside already, I will argue with them.
author: snowwhite w.

description:
Attention:  Only rating the Sunday's a Drag show.  

Really good show.  Went for mother's day Drag Brunch show because mom is on the East Coast and what the hell.  It was a great show.  Wish the show was longer which means it was good.  We lucked out an had a table next to the stage.  Get there early and see what you can do.  Good to be close.  The Sister of Perpetual Indulgence were in the front row so it was like two shows in one.  

Food was not the focus.  Don't expect much more than average brunch.  Your paying for the show.
author: Doreen D.

description: We came here to celebrate a friend's birthday during their "Sunday's a Drag" brunch. The brunch ain't all-that and their drinks are crappy (and not included with the price of admission), but the show is something you must experience once. The host, Donna Sachet, is darn funny!
author: Tina A.

description:
A late cold rainy night. . . so we duck into the Sir Francis Drake in all it grandeur.  We were not dressed in blazer and gown but the door man was really cool and let us in. Live Jazz and a very eclectic mix of people. The Drinks were a bit pricey but very well made. 

But not our scene. Cool if you are older or want to hang with older folks. Oh yeah it was a Tuesday evening.....We heard they have a pretty good DRAG show . . . maybe we will check that out next time.
author: Keenan K.

description:
First things first, everything in Downtown SF is EXPENSIVE, especially for a grad student looking for some fun. But if you know me you know that empty pockets wont stop me from gettin giggy with it, yeah, I just said that. So, I went to Starlight with a couple of hotties on a Wed night. The DJ was sick and the crowd was pretty mixed. Everything from your low-end douches to your Suit's were getting down and dirty on the dance floor. The women... well let just say that my eyes were wide open all night, hard thing to do for an Asian. 

Getting right to it... The music was good, but it was a Wed night not sure what they play on other nights. The girls were plentiful and the crowd was all about having fun. The down side is as is everyplace DT San Francisco is the high admission charge and cost of drinks. 

All in all it was a good time. But I'm a firm believer that its the people you're with and not the venue that makes a good time.
author: scott l.

description: Great venue for society cabaret shows. We saw the 1pm "evening with Molly Ringwald" show and it was the perfect intimate setting for classic jazz. Comfortable tables, great service and cocktails. A bit pricey menu, but expected for such a posh setting. The French 75 was a good choice to celebrate Bastille day. Molly and her jazz trio were great. She stayed and signed CDs after show and the pianist & drummer also chatted and signed my CD. The society cabaret founder was a gracious host and did a nice intro to Molly, his childhood friend.
author: Laurie F.

description:
I think the only thing that I liked about this place was the view and the well mixed drinks.

Maybe my experience here wasn't that great because I was clearly the youngest person there that night and they weren't really playing the kind of music I was used to. This lounge is pretty small with booths and tables on both sides and a very small dancefloor by the window. Overall I just wasn't feeling this place and left after just two drinks.
author: Tracy Y.

description:
Disclaimer: This is for the "Sunday's a Drag" brunch and not the evening festivities.

My first foray into drag shows, and I was definitely entertained!  Like many of the other recent reviewers, I was drawn in by the Groupon bargain.  Rather than being treated like second class patrons, the host courteously gave us a couple of options on seating for the brunch/show.

They manage to cram in more guests than you'd expect, but everyone seemed to have a decent view.  I'd recommend getting the earliest reservation available for your show, so you can leisurely enjoy your brunch prior to all the excitement.

Favorites among the cuisine included the omelet bar, carving station, vegetarian frittatas, and chocolate dipped strawberries.  Their drip coffee was also decent (always a plus).

The show was hilarious, and we especially enjoyed the drunken appearance of Judy Garland!

Minor drawbacks:  It happened to be a warm day and their air conditioning (or lack thereof) could not keep up.  The omelet chefs had a hard time keeping up-- they just needed another person, but they were all very friendly.
author: Jamie B.
