Everything is clean, and the bathrooms are enormous (at least the girls is), I think this is the one SF club where I have not had to stand in line.  And from the 30 story height you get some killer views of the City.  Despite all that I felt a little out of place.  The DJ was OK, but he wouldn't play our song request ... I guess because it wasn't a top 40, or Michael Jackson circa 1984 (not that there is anything wrong with that).

Definite 5 stars for the Sunday Brunch show.  The buffet was super good ... they has this smoked salmon dish ... I can't even explain what it was but it was good.  And truffle deviled eggs!  There was so much good stuff to choose from ... even for those who have to eat gluten free, you won't be sad that you have to bypass the fresh croissants and chocolate french toast (well OK ... that one does hurt a little).  But you can console yourself with a Bellini (oh, my kingdom for a good Bellini).

Just be sure to make and early enough reservation because you can't get up during the show to get seconds, or thirds.  You should probably be sure to finish eating before the show starts anyway, because eating and laughing at the same time usually result in choking.  This show is so San Francisco and should be seen at least once by locals and tourists alike.
author: Karly L.

description: WACK !!!!! I was there last night and pay for my drinks with a $100 bill and got $40 back on fake bills !!!!!! Wtf ??? Never going there again . It was dark for me to check my change . Thank you for nothing !!!!!!
author: Alfonso L.

description:
This review is for Saturday night only!

Finally a place where the grown and sexy 35+ crowd can go chill or  get their "boogie on" to a live band or a DJ and not feel like somebody's mama because the crowd is too young or worry about getting shot because the crowd is too young and ghetto!!

The view is breathtaking, the club decor is asthetically pleasing and the drinks are delicious!  The crowd seems to be there to dance and have a good time.  Not just sit back and floss or just people watch like so many other night clubs out there!

I do not go clubbing very often but whenever I get into the mood to go dancing, and chill with "the upscale crowd", this will be one of my top destinations! Holla!!
author: Tracy M.

description: My boyfriend and I wanted to try a fun place for sunday brunch! We enjoyed this place so much.  The brunch spread was wonderful.  The performers were a lot of fun!  The place itself has a timeless quality.  I loved the whole experience!  I can't wait to go back again.
author: Kristina F.

description:
Picture a dirty, polluted lake where the ugliest, oldest, sickliest fish go to spawn.  Now adjust the fish population so that there are at least 3 male fish for every female fish.

Throw in some watered-down drinks, antiquated decor and staff with an attitude problem and there you have it - Wednesday nights at the Starlight Room!

Now I must go vomit.
author: Oscar M.

description:
Hi. 

Wednesday night, 12 year anniversary party. 
No cover if you have boobies and are cute & young. +1
Foreign (not the Chinese ones, duh) bartender likes boobies, so get ready for winks and mad hook ups. +1
The crowd consisted of rich boys and their fathers and grandfathers. And the rich boys mothers. And then there was the young ones, lookin for some free drinks.Money in the bank, shorty what you drank. -0-
The music was Top 40s, and the DJ gets to your request quick. Great view of SF from the dance floor too. +1

I saw Sean Penn in the stairwell and the first thing I said was, "Aren't you hot in leather?" And that, ladies and gents, is what two Long Islands will do to you. However, he welcomed my friend who is very blessed (boobies) and I to join him at his booth. +6000000000000000

Come only Wednesday. I heard that is the least douch-ey night here, according to my friends the bouncers. Who have to wear bow-ties. Sexay. 

Sean Penn. Yeah. ok. *screams.
author: Christina L.

description:
For a bar atop a classic city hotel, it's pretty average. We each had a Cable Car, which tasted like liquid candy, $10. And a very generous plate of house made (I think) parmesan potato chips for $7. The 21st floor view should be spectacular on a clear day, but this being San Francisco, it was like a bar in the heavens as the fog floated by the windows...which were unbelievably dingy, by the way (docked a star).

But, good, classy, friendly, old school place for a cocktail (NO beer on tap, btw). I doubt I'd check out the "club" scene here later at night.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
OUTSTANDING place. Great cocktails, amazing view, and a much more freindly staff that you might expect at such a swanky place. 

Yes,the drinks are a little pricy--it's not a dump, after all. The Starlight Room plays fun dance music, it's a great friends-in-town place, or special-occasion place, and also terrific if you feel like treating yourself to a nice cocktail and a beautiful view. Staff there are FANTASTIC:) You should go--really.
author: Jennifer U.

description:
Wednesday's Indulgence

Pluses- great views, usually fun upscale slightly older crowd, dj plays current dance hits

Minuses- high drink prices, staff rude/mean/major attitude (you can ask or tell me, or even gesture me to move from the aisle before physically grabbing my arm to move me...not cool!)
author: Rice C.

description:
My girlfriend was worried we would need to pay a cover or wait in line, but I dragged her here on a recent Saturday night.  She need not have worried because they were glad to have us.  Even though the bar was very busy, bartenders poured us free drinks.

A Drake hotel guest in the elevator on the way up said "You're brave to go up there" to us.  He must have known we would get hit on by a lot of older gentlemen staying in the hotel, which is basically what happened.  Still, our drinks were great and I can't ask for better service.  Besides, my friend is single and I like talking to people from all over the world!  Everyone who spoke to us was interesting and fun.

I checked out the dancefloor, mainly to see the view, but the bar area was definitely cooler and a better place to meet people.
author: Zedar B.

description:
My wife and I were on TV after we went to this place.
Samantha Brown was taping her "Great Weekends" show.
It's a swanky little place.  Wear a blazer.
You can see my head in the shot while she's walking with Harry while he's talking about the history of the place.
author: Kev M.

description:
One of my very hip co-homosexual friends decided to make his boyfriend dress up in a tuxedo and drag him and several of his other friends to the Starlight Room for a birthday gathering, despite my pasting of negative Yelp reviews to him over instant message.

I put on the velvet suit jacket, a tie, and some newly dry-cleaned pants and made the trek to Union Square to go hang out with what I thought would be an over-priced yet classy shindig.  I was only half-right.

The cover charge was $20, and I felt like I was standing in line at a Vegas strip club, which is something that no self-respecting gay man should ever have to do. Once inside, there was a Sly and the Family Stone cover band blocking the nice part of the view facing Union Square, so my $20 didn't even get me a nice view.

While I stepped away to get my drink, Harry Denton himself came over to say hello to my group and took a picture with them. 

"Did he at least buy you a round?" I asked when I returned.

Not a chance.

My $10 vodka gimlet was fine, but disastrously overpriced. It was made from Absolut (you know, the vodka/lighter fluid that you can use to make a cheap cosmo or light your barbecue?) and served to me by a bartender in a white jacket.

The highlight of the trip was watching a couple begin to have "relations" in the window of the hotel across the way. 

I think we stayed there all of 20 minutes, meaning that I basically paid $1 per minute for my trip to Harry Denton's Starlight Room. I could have called Miss Cleo and had a very enlightening conversation for that price.

The one highlight -- those famous elderly twins, Marian and Vivian Brown, were in the lobby of the hotel on our way out. I asked my friend why he didn't stop to get his picture taken with them, and he chalked it up to being "creeped out" by the experience.

We wandered down Geary to Polk and had fantastic cocktails at Lush. And the best part was that we were the nicest dressed people in the place.
author: Steven P.

description: We went to the Drag Show on a Sunday and had a very fun time!  It's inside of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel.  Brunch was being served with the show but we didn't want to eat so we just had to purchase a couple of drinks - no problemo!  The drag queens were great and one of them must have had her pee-pee cut off because she did a friggin contortionist move that made my boyfriend say "NO WAY!, That has to be a woman!"  Very nice hotel, elegant and classy!  We didn't stay overnight but after reading the reviews, I would'nt mind giving it a try!
author: Ruthie V.

description:
This is for the SUNDAY'S A DRAG - DRAG QUEEN BRUNCH.

And the review is:  AWESOME!!!

If you haven't been to the brunch on Sundays, you need to go SOON before it is sold out every weekend!  A group of us went for my birthday and had SOOOOOOOO much fun.  The queens are gorgeous (especially CASSANDRA - we're STILL talking about "her" a month later!) and extremely entertaining.  
And believe it or not, the food is really good!  It's a brunch buffet for $40 and includes juice and coffee.  If you're like us, and you know you Yelpers are, you will indulge in the champagne so expect to pay about $100 by the time you're done.  However, for 2 hours of entertainment and more time with the brunch, we felt like it was a good deal.  Plus the service at the Starlight Room is always classy and quick.  And on Sunday mornings you can actually see the city from up there!  Not like at night when you have to point out different lights...
Go to the DRAG brunch soon!!!!
author: Plaid B.

description: While this place has a wonderful view, I don't think it is worth the cover charge, or the pretentious attitude from the guy at the door or the mystery man at the podium who decides if you get a table or not, to sit down. If you like snobby, pretentious, cheesy, and not sitting down when you are drinking and dancing, than this is your place. Personally, I used to like Harry Denton's when it was down by the Embarcadero. When it was there, it was more fun and more down to earth.
author: Shannon K.

description: Good cheesy fun.  Swanky interior, waitresses in black evening wear, and a DJ playing an odd mix of music that might feel like you're at a wedding reception.  I've always hit this place late in the evening, near closing, after a good number of drinks.  The view is gorgeous.  It's a fun place to let loose and act the tourist (which I am).  I don't think locals go here unless dragged by out-of-town friends like me. But once there, even they can't help but enjoy the silliness of it all.
author: Cherie C.

description:
This is a strange place. David Lynch would feel right at home here. The concept is that this is a swanky place with tremendous views of the City. The reality is that everything is skewed. You notice a pair of well-dressed, put-together older white women. They're chatting up two twentysomething Persian guys. Over here is a plump fifty-year old man is a suit and tie. He's buying drinks for a table of Asian girls who probably have fake IDs. Later on in the evening, all of them will be drunk and dancing to "Jump Around" from House of Pain.

I haven't been in over five years, and I'd need to be (a) pretty drunk, and (b) surrounded by persuasive friends to return.
author: Timothy O.

description: Very nice place to dance , and have drinks. The live music is very nice and it blends well with the DJ. Some weekends the live band will play Jazz/ Blues,and others  will play old school R&B. Check the website for the bands and DJ. But overall its a really good time I been a few times and the view is awsome.
author: Van Y.

description:
Best place to view the city after dark! 

With all around windows, from high atop the Sir Francis Drake Hotel, you'll love the view.
Add to the view: a jazz combo, waitresses decked out in evening wear,  and strong drinks, what's not to love?
You wouldn't be surprised to see anyone of the Rat Pack at the other end of the bar.

No cover on Sundays, Mondays or Tuesdays, from Wednesday on its $10 after 8:30PM and $15 on Saturday.

Drinks are a little spendy, but no more than you'd expect in a major city starting at about $10. 

If that doesn't phase you, they have a menu of 'Million Dollar Cocktails', starting at $80 for the 'Heavenly Dram', a drink that combines Macallan's 25- year-old single-malt Scotch and Garvey Pedro Ximenez Sherry (1860) or if you've won the lottery try the 'Drinking the Stars': a mixture of Chateau de Ravignan 1979 Armagnac and Dom Perignon. Starting at only $375 for a 750 ml (bottle-size) drink and $650 for a magnum (aprox. two bottles). Bottoms Up!
author: David M.

description:
I am honestly at a loss for words.  This place is terrible and I'll tell you why.  I met some friends here a bit late, say 1:00 am and within in 20 minutes they turn the lights on and start moving people towards the door (I was sitting there already) but apparently sitting is not allowed you need to stand and wait for the elevators by the bar.  Sorry I didn't know the rules.  This place and its hired help needs to take etiquette manners.  Now I remember why I've not been here in almost 5 years.  See you in 2012 when another friend twists my arm in to taking another bad trip at the Starlight Room!

Don't waste your time.
author: Tom C.

description:
FANTASTIC view of Union Square, convenient location.

Drinks:
Asked the lady what kinda Scotch they had she said,
"Oh, we have a WIDE selection. McCallan 12, McCallan 18 . . . ummm"
"Do you have Yamazaki 12?"
"Never heard of it."
"Laphroaig"
"Huh?"
"Talisker?"
"..."
"Nevermind, just gimme McCallan 12"

After a couple o Scotch and pacer diet cokes, I asked the same lady,
"What kinda tequila do you have?"
"Do we have to do this again?!?!"
"Nevermind, just gimme Patron"
She was super nice though. 

PIZZA OF DUCK CONFIT, PIZZA PARMA, and CHILLED MONTEREY BAY PRAWNS were quite yummy. We liked the green crystal rock salt on the BIG prawns, very festive and punctuating.
author: DANIEL T.

description:
Cool views of the city of course, but the whole scene felt a bit awkward (and frankly, we felt way too young to be in here). Definitely worth a stop if you like city views. We were up here at sunset and it was actually really nice. It was a Sunday evening so definitely quiet. 

The service was nice, given that it was so dead. I felt bad for the waitresses dressed in those dresses.

Drinks were pricey, but to be expected as it is at the top of the Drake hotel...
author: Purvi R.

description:
The view is magnificent. This is perfect place to go if you want to relax after a long day of work and sit back with a cocktail. Upon entering the Starlight Room I was greeted by a friendly staff. I sat at the bar to order drinks and the bartenders Jay and Kenny took care of me. I told them I wanted something sweet and they came up with a special concoction that didn't even have a name. The drink they made me contained a lot of alcohol but I couldn't taste it because it was masked by fruit flavors (orange/passion fruit/pineapple). But I highly recommend the orange flavored mojito, the Cable Car, and the Lemon Drop. The bartenders are really creative with mixing different drinks to suit your needs. The drinks are a little bit more expensive but well worth it. 

On Wednesday nights they have a promoter (Indulgence) that draws in a younger crowd (20's and 30's). It gets packed on Wednesday nights because the DJ's spin some wild mixes. On the other nights, they have a live band that plays jazz. But overall, it's a great view and a good drink. What more can you ask for? 

The dcor is nice with a chandelier at the entrance near the bar area. Everything is covered in scarlet red (Harry Denton's favorite color). I prefer reserving a booth as it is more comfortable. But the side seating by the windows are also good if you want a view and to be away from the crowd. I recommend ordering the crab cakes for appetizer - it's the best thing on the menu.
author: Candace F.

description:
It's not glamorous. The decor is very old looking, kinda heavy smelling, not fresh. Looks like my grandma's house. Also, there's a lot of old people hanging around. The view of Union Square is not that great. Cheesecake factory is better for the view imho. The drinks were expensive.The service was slow. Overrated! next place please...:)

I think the music also changes from night to night, which might change the way the space feels. The night we went my friend was disappointed about the music for example. First there was some weird band, then it turned into San Jose style DJ music playing semi-ghetto songs. Doesn't really fit the space. I think with the design they have, they can turn the place into a piano bar and just keep it that way.
author: Honor G.

description:
If you want to hang out with the hopes of maybe seeing one of the raiders then please indulge....

great view.
awful clientele.
even worse ambiance.
author: Solbiato S.

description:
It's more like "why not?" instead of this is a great place. Nice views, crowded, and the music is more geared for a 40's crowd (Saturday). I came with my date a few years back and her friends. We ended up sharing a table with Barry Bonds, Bobby Bonilla, and some other baseball player I didn't remember. We were doing fine until I mentioned that Barry didn't play that day because he was supposed to be on the Disabled List, yet was able to hang out that night. That got a sour look from the HomeRun King and laughs from the rest. I got some snide remarks from him later and we decided to leave. 

If you're in town, or have guests in San Francisco, this is a relatively safe bet to take them here.
author: Gabriel B.

description:
I've been wanting to go to the starlight room for a while after hearing of juicy rumors like people taking their pants off and gorgeous views. Well as a bunch of us had already been to chevys happy hour and then found ourselves in front of the christmas tree in union square, we got the idea. We HAD to go to the starlight room. It was destiny. 

After walking in and narrowly escaping the awful table that is in the way of EVERYONE, we got an awesome booth and then a couple minutes later our waitress arrived.

"Know what you guys want?"

"Uhm, no. Can u give us a minute?"

**walks away**

We got that attitude all night long. The attitude like, "I'm serving a whole bunch of drunks from out of town so if you can please tell me what you want now, I will not kill you." 

Aside from the treatment, there were some pretty good cocktails on the menu and ate the most delicious salumi plate ever. 

I gotta say though, Top of the Mark is far more superior in more ways than one.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
came here last Wednesday for a ladies night with Selena W., Nicole S., Cherylynn N., Jolene T., and Jerad L. [yes, booboo is one of the girls!  haha] 

initially, i was impressed by the impeccably dressed waiters, red velvet upholstry, crystal chandeliers, thick drapery, and the warm wood trim.  then i realized it looked a lot like Rouge [which is also owned by Harry Denton].  also, like Rouge, Starlight Room is SMALL.  the dancefloor is miniscule...i have more room in my walk-in closet! LoLx  the DJ was so-so, playing top 40`s and old school music. 

the view, however, was breathtaking :]  at 21 floors up, you get an awesomee view of union square, macy`s, neiman`s, and the westin st. francis hotel :]  the view was the best part of my experience here ;D

the crowd.  what can i possibly say about the crowd?  let`s just say that most of them were old enough for me to call them mommy and daddy.   i felt like a baby...or Lolita with Humbert Humbert staring at my tits.  hahaha  the average age [not counting me and my girls] was around 45.  i`d just like to say at at 23 i was the youngest by 4+ years out of my group, and that a majority of my friends are over 3O, so i`m no amateur to hanging out with my favorite old farts LoLx  

this might be a great place to find yourself a sugardaddy, but seeing as i`m not currently in the market for one, i think i`ll pass.
author: Dee W.

description:
Last time I was here, it smelled like vomit everywhere I turned.
It wasn't me, I brought visitors from out of town so I was watching my intake.
Good view, Ok music and I would go back for Salsa lessons night!
author: Yamil A.

description: came here with my buddy a few days back. First off, the girls look like second hand dolls, which to me is a complete turnoff. We go to order our drinks (expensive) and she laughs at me. Five minutes later , some panzy ass in a black bow tie inspects my id for like 2 minutes and then tells me that he will not accept it.  NEVER GO HERE . nothing is worse then a shitty place with a shittier staff
author: Marty F.

description: I had a blast here, good mix of people, good mix of music.  Great view, fun people watching.   I'm much more at home in a dive, but since I was all dolled up, it was a nice change of pace and a chance to meet people I'd might not otherwise. Just try it once.  I did and had fun.
author: Meg W.

description:
Why I could give this place a high rating:
A) Tonight I met Harry Denton (the owner)- such a nice jolly old man! I approve.
B) Barry Bonds decided to spend his evening there too tonight. Yes, he had an entourage.
C) Nice view of the city.

Why I gave this place a 3:
A) Dance floor is always overcrowded.
B) The scence fluctuates from week to week, sometimes quality, sometimes not so stellar.
C) Layout is just awkward.
author: Melanie K.

description:
Terrible!  The place is for people who think they're cool and don't realize even that they're not. 

I went on a Weds night, supposedly the best night.

The Good:
View of the city

The Bad:
1)   First of all, you wait in a slow line to go up the elevator (this is a hotel)

2) Crowd is very fake and is White, Indian, Asian and some Black Folks

3) The DJ was terrible.  He must have been the hotel DJ cuz no real club would ever hire his ass.  He played music that did not flow togther and there were silences as he changed records.  I could do better with a tape deck.  His music ranged from 70's to Top 40. 

4) The people there really thought they were hot shit...but they really were just fake and corny and DIDN'T EVEN REALIZE IT.  :)  They were the kinda folks that need to hear the following:

"Stop trying so hard to be cool.  Just be yourself cuz right now you just look like a jackass."

5) Drinks were expensive and the wait at the bar was too long (cuz its too crowded)
author: One Black Mans POV.. ..

description:
My friends and I have been going to lounges that played hip hop and club music, so we wanted to change the scenery and experience some oldies.  Thus we went to Starlight.   

The band that was playing Friday night was absolutely fantastic and specializes in oldies music.  The DJ spinned various music during the break ranging from Hip Hop to 80s disco, which were really easy to dance to.  We danced for 4 hours straight with the view of the beautiful city as back drop.  

Overall, we had a blast.  True that the decor and the ambiance were not really my taste, but I love the crowd in this place.  People were there to have a good time, which we did.
author: Gin H.

description:
Two things I won't easily forget about Harry Denton's Starlight room.

1) That silly, stupefied grin on Harry's face in all the promo posters.

2) The lowest common denominator, and it don't come cheap at Harry's, that's "Fa sho fo real", as the Souls of Mischief would likely say.

For all the unreality and sheltered superfluity that is San Francisco, this place is as good as any.
author: randolph m.

description: Ok I love this place and have reviewed it before, I have been here over the past 3 years for different occasions. Once for a birthday which was very fun, my husband's company Christmas party which was a blast and great food! Today  September 29th 2013 I went to the noon drag brunch with a friend and we had a blast! This is the perfect blend of brunch, entertainment and just a bit of the cheesy sparkle that the place offers! It was a good mix of people, good food and beautiful entertaining queens! Make sure to arrive early to enjoy brunch.
author: julie q.

description: Absolutely beautiful. I went here for Valentine's Day weekend. It was so much fun to get to go to the top floor of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel. The view was incredible. Windows wrap all the way around the restaurant. There were beautiful chandeliers and the booths had 1930's style stripes. I can't wait to come back for a meal in the daytime and just look at the view. The dance floor is small but there are windows on 3 sides of it. The night I was there they alternated between a live band and a DJ. Both of which were fun to dance to. The crowd is pretty varied. It is 21 and up but I would say its geared more towards over 30 but it really varies. The Starlight Room is perfect for a night of getting dressed up and celebrating in a beautiful location.
author: Kari G.

description:
Had a great time here Memorial day weekend.

The Patron Shots were very generous

and general cost of the drinks are priced about right for the Area and setting, Ive seen worst i.e more.

Dancing area could be bigger but what do u expect from a "restaurant turned Club"

I believe I met Harry Denton himself.???a gentlemen offered to help take pictures and get a great pic of us with the square in the backround.

 As I left i saw the posters in the elevator with the gentlemen likeness. LOL
author: Kirk D.

description: This place is amazing! They have a live band Friday and Saturday nights, the Fred Ross Project they ROCKED the place! The DJ was also really awesome. The dancefloor was packed when I arrived at 10:00pm. The view from our table, and the dancefloor, was unbelievable. Excellent service, in an extraordinary atmosphere! All of my friends had such a good time. I can't wait to go back!
author: Michelle W.

description:
Maybe I'm getting too old to be drinking on a Wednesday night, but Starlight Room last night was not awesome.  Years ago, I used to have a ton of fun here, but now, the crowd is terrible.  As a girl, you cannot be left alone for a second, otherwise you'll get pounced by any number of much older men that really have no business being out at midnight on a weeknight.  Girls are way over dressed and in super skanky dresses, and the go-go dancers in Vegas-style costume were over the top.  

DJ was awesome until he started he started to spastically cut out big chunks of the music.  When no one is singing along, it just sounds terrible.  I won't be coming back.
author: Olivia T.

description: Went to the Sunday's a Drag brunch this past weekend. The brunch was amazing and the show fantastic!  Anything you would want in a brunch they had.  Everyone is able to see the stage. a great value for the price. Performers interact with audience.
author: Roxie P.

description: So so so so so awesome. Faded old world glory. The maitre'd takes your arm and walks you to your table. The cocktail waitresses actually wear cocktail dresses slit up to there. Amazing view, great dancefloor. Good drinks. Fantastic destination spot. Talking to the gal at the door, it sounds like they have a cover most nights, up to $20 on Fri/Sat but it never starts until later. I'd recommend this place as a great spot for a cocktail or two before you hit the club. My dirty martini was perfect.
author: Kathy M.

description: ha ha. Really? I had one drink and it cost 50 fucking dollars?!? . No really, Harry, your place sucks. Grossly overpriced and high on the douche-o-meter.
author: Dru P.

description:
What a DUMP! I could care less if this place is packed full of tourist or  if the crowd has more then it's fair share of less-then pretty faces...

but, let me repeat... THIS PLACE IS A DUMP! it's dark, dingy and you can almost feel the dust mites in the air. And the "decor" It looks as if it was remodeled by a mortician! wtf? and who is this Harry Denton??? i think he was trying to build his own mortuary parlor? - WTF! ohh, and the drinks are way over priced! 

it get's one star because i have to, but it get's five WTF's because it deserves them!!!
author: Steve B.

description: if you love attending weddings or bar/bat mitvah's this place is for YOU! its got everything - old ladies in high heels, dutch uncles with hair plugs, velvet seating. Since teh music starts early the crowd is older, and it gets younger and tougher looking as the night goes on. Live music and DJ - tons of great music - old and new. Everyone around me was HAPPY. That is the sign of a great nightclub.  And the coat check is free. Just go there and let it seep in. You might not like it at first, but it will grow on you.
author: patricia d.

description:
My good pal Super Fun Jen and I went for a night out on Saturday a couple of weeks ago. Tried getting into Slide but the line was ridiculously long. So we ended up at the Starlight Room. 

I've been here before but it's been years since. The only thing I remembered was the plush, red dcor (booths, long velvet drapes, crystal chandeliers) and the stunning views. This place was voted as one of the best over 30 singles scene (rated 9.4 in city search). Ha, my ass. More like over 50 single's scene... 

If you're a girl looking for a Silver Fox/Sugar Daddy (guys, you have your choice of a Cougar), then you are at the right place. My friend and I were like prime cuts to a prisoner on his last meal. We got drinks flowing all night to us because well we look good and we are on average 20 years younger than most of the guys.

The place was packed with older folks lost in some sort of time warp, corporate types having their holiday party and/or tourists that read the wrong travel book. 

Bartenders made decent stiff drinks but you had to know or be friendly with the bartenders first in order to get a drink at the bar (i.e the bar was 3 deep with folks trying to get a drink).

Despite the cheese factor, we had a good time and many stories to tell. Three stars for that.

Good story: my friend had danced with this guy old enough to be her dad. Let's call him Fireballs. She told me that she knew she was dancing with an old guy when he started to twirl her to 50 Cent.
author: Vanessa J.

description:
So this past Saturday night I went to the Starlight and it nice place but the live band was not so nice. The drinks were good and the have a ok cocktail menu I tried the Cable Car and really liked it . It was very easy to get a table without having reservation. Well me and my date sort of just took a table that had a reserved sign on it. 
Other than that I think anyone can enjoy the okay view of the Union Square area and the tiny dance floor with all the rhythemless people.  And with a $15 cover charge yeah try to enjoy yourself as much as possible and help yourself to a table.
author: Karim R.

description:
Honestly, this isn't a review because I never actually went there.

That's right! Myself and some girlfriends went to the top wearing our normal street clothes on a Saturday night at 9:00PM. We were greeted with very loud music, musty STANK and everyone dressed up in Tuxes. The place wasn't full and the hostess said, "that'll be $45 dollars."

I was confused and afraid. I've been to much nicer places with better views of the city and was never asked to pay 15 dollars a person to get in. I'm never going back. It's not my scene but it's also stinky, upscale and too expensive.
author: Adam C.

description:
Thanks to previous reviewers' warnings about palm-greasing, I called ahead for a table and had no difficulties. The crowd was somewhat upsetting; I did not need to see Wilford Brimley look-alikes shakin' it to Depeche Mode.

On the other hand, the views are stunning, the drinks perfectly balanced (if a bit weak), and while they were playing the standard set of 80s synth-pop dance songs, I've never heard them mixed better. This review would usually lead to a two-star rating; the extra star is for playing the original German version of "Der Kommissar."
author: Joe G.

description:
Wednesday night...

I liked this place a lot.  I heard that Wednesday is the best night there.The place was crowded (some company was throwing a corporate party there as well) and the crowd ranged in age, style and cultural diversity.  They played a mix of both hip-hop and house and not just played out radio bs. either.  The view was nice too.  I wouldn't say that I would go there to meet people , but if you bring your own friends, I couldn't see why you couldn't have anything less than a great time in a classy atmosphere.
author: Janette T.

description:
If you haven't been to the Starlight Room, you've missed out on some amazing views of our lovely city. It's a very "glamorous" place (in my opinion, the glamour of it all is deteriorating with the ghetto debauchery flowing into the city to shake it's booty on a nightly basis). I have been there on a Wednesday night (their big night) and all the B&T swims over from 111 Mina. If you want to go big on Wednesday, it's not a bad place but just prepare yourself for the crowd. Their food is okay and they serve late so if you have downed too many cocktails you still have ways of saving your self from your drunk self.

It's MUCH better for organized events. I have been there on a couple of occasions for prearranged parties and the class of the starlight room was definitely better preserved.
author: Rada I.

description:
The crowd here is definitely older than most clubs in the city, which doesn't sit well with a 24 year old like myself. I have enough trouble as it is trying to meet a girl around my age in SF. But I guess if I was older, I could potentially see myself in a place like this.

The interior is nice, the views are pretty tight, and there's lots of booths. However, the drinks and cover are too expensive, the dance floor is small in relation to the rest of the club, which probably has something to do with the older crowd, and the bouncers can get annoying.

Maybe I'll give Starlight Room another chance in about 20 years. I'll probably still be younger than most of the people here.
author: Bruce D.

description:
I started off at the car show at the Moscone center, had expensive top shelf margaritas at Chevy's, and then after a drunken bumble to Union Square to check out the giant towering Christmas tree, we decided to hit up Harry Denton's Starlight Room. The elevator took twenty years (where we rambled on and on about how Harry Denton is known to run around with his pants off on Sundays), and once we go up there, it reminded me of an old movie theater. Red and luscious with a tacky feel to it. We didn't have too much trouble getting an intimate booth and the view is definitely spectacular. I tried to follow along with the ingredients on the cocktail menu, but I had no idea what half of them were. I didn't know if I was a country bumpkin or had failed at being a worldly alcoholic. After looking up "creme de mure" in Wikipedia on my iphone, I ordered a "Starry Night," and found it to be quite the bubbly treat. We all shared a salumi plate and gushed about how much we love prosciutto. One day when I have some money to blow, I'll come here again. Until then, this place is a little overrated in my book.

Oh, and I guess I got so impatient with elevator on the way down, that I suffered through 21 flights of stairs.
author: Natasha P.

description:
Having been here only a few times my experience is limited but enlightening. Considering all three times have been consistent in experience it is fair to assume a general prediciton of future encounters with Mr. Denton. The jolly man is always in attendance suit and tie.  The waitresses wear lovely gowns and the goers are matched in dress.  The room atop the Sir Francis Drake Hotel makes for a lovely view of 
Union Square.  I've met a variety of interesting folk here surprising enough...ones similar to myself equally surprised in such a meeting. "What are you doing here?" "No, what are YOU doing here." "Same thing you are.' Same thing we all are doing go fish.act like you're not and when the opportunity arises....hold tight reel er in.
author: Angela O.

description:
All tastes are subjective, but there are certain things that are just facts...like the fact that Harry Denton's Starlight Room was so awful that I had to sign up for Yelp just to warn others away. I think the decor is fine and the vintage jazz playing when I entered was charming...that's all subjective.  The fact that the hostess proceeded to place me and every other single woman who entered after me into a netherworld without view or service is a fact. I couldn't see the band through the barricade that I was seated behind, though I could hear them warming up in cacophonous attempts to match the piped in music. (That was painful.) 

I couldn't enjoy the reputed view, despite the fact that there were small tables with views available.  I was able to enjoy the view of all of the couples enjoying the view. So much for something to pleasant to ponder while I enjoyed my drink... the one I ordered in an attempt to make the best of it.  

I should have known better --  that drink arrived ten minutes later despite the fact that the bar wasn't busy.  I also had a good view of my server drinking her bottled water and chatting up the bar tender, before she leisurely sauntered over to my table with my drink, plopped it on the table and then remembered that she ought to put a bar napkin under it. (When it's not called common sense, it's called "training." Harry Denton's could use both.) When the server asked me if I wanted something from the menu and I told her I didn't think I could order, because I  couldn't read the menu in the dark, she made a lame attempt to explain the menu to me, which only convinced me that it was more boring than it was abbreviated. (Apparently Harry Denton's is just a place to get drunk, which may explain why there is no need to be attentive to service.) By then, I knew then I was in the wrong place.  

I bolted my drink and tossed my credit card on the table.  Time ticked by, which I passed by watching the effusive host escorting couples to their tables with views and by trying to ignore the racket the band was making. Finally, my "server" decided to check on me and when she saw my credit card she said "Oh, are you done?" (This lack of common sense is a kind of stupid that defies training.) 

I have left restaurants in a hurry to leave the bad memory behind, but in this case, I signed the receipt and  literally ran from the establishment. I mean really ran and so fast, I nearly knocked over my chair and the look on the host's face said he was wondering if I was a dine and dash. (Ha! Dining would have required a legible menu and service.) I will never, ever go back.  Subjectively, I am pretty sure this may be a portal to hell. Objectively, it was an excruciatingly long experience in inconsideration.
author: Sheila S.

description:
The Starlight Room ironically gets just one star...

The staff here is a total pain in the ass, I don't know how many times we were asked to clear a "major walkway" ... Even when we were nearly pressed up against the windows in one oddball corner of the place, I think the penguin in the corner asked us to squeeze over even more to make some space for the imaginary people who were walking through.

The drinks are hella expensive, but that seems to be a SF trend lately.  Think like $10 mixed drinks -- roll in here with a couple ladies and you're dropping $100 in a couple hours.  Also, it's crowded at times, the view isn't that great, and on hip-hop night, the music was kinda sketch.
author: Matt B.

description:
Uhm, if I have to wait in line forget it.  
The only reason I made it in here is because I was with someone who knew somebody and we therefore did not have to stand in line and I paid no cover.  
GREAT view of the city...... but seriously, you can see the city from so many other places!
Too many people, stuffy and hot, and small.  
Go if you want to sound cool when you tell people what you did over the weekend.  Don't go if you actually want to have a couple drinks.  Go if you want to meet people who also want to sound cool when they tell people what they did over the weekend.  Don't go if you want to dance rather than bounce up and down(since there is no room to do anything else).
Everyone should try it at least once, right?  Just do not go without proper expectations!
author: Amie W.

description:
It amazes me how much people know, and how much people "think they know". First of all about what it means to truly be a socialite, and secondly, to know that a drag show is just that, lip syncing.

So, Harry Denton, what a doll, couldn't hurt a living thing (that's where him and I differ the most), but truly, truly the most charming and hospitable host. 

Here is a little food for thought for those who can't appreciate the 1930's posh elegance of the lounge. If every club, bar, and lounge in the city looked the same, life would be boring!!! And 2, when you have your own lounge, you can decorate it the way you want, and see if someone doesn't like your taste. 

On to the food. If you have ever eaten at one of those brunches done by the corporate hotels, you know which ones they are, you spent the night at one on your senior ball. You would know that the brunch menu isnt that much more decadent than going to Denny's. The brunch at Harry's is varied and cooked very well, however its really hard to appreciate it when you arrive late (second act of the show) and wait until your 5th mimosa to enjoy it.

The queens. I have seen a lot of drag shows in my time, and it is true, there aren't many good ones left. Come to think of it, there aren't many of the great drag queens left, bless their souls. But if I were to suggest, which I am, a show where you get a great blend of drag talent, old & new, elegant & sassy alike, then this is the show for you. You can bring your boss and his wife here, you can bring your folks here (explain to dad first), or just come with your friends and enjoy a great breakfast and some cocktails on Sunday morning, like a true socialite does. 

The last show I attended was with my best friend, well bf at the time, and his sister visiting from Florida. I believe it was the normal cast including Cassandra and a queen I have never seen before but loved her performance of "Here Comes the Rain Again" by the Eurythmics. And the Lucile Ball Veggie Vitamin performance by Holotta Tymes was incredible, makes me tinkly myself just a little every time. But if you havent seen her work, her wicked wicked way, Lady Tia. Just when I thought I had heard enough of Jennifer Hudson and "How much I am going to Love her", Lady Tia done turned her out one more time in a vocally and physically perfect sync of the song. Had chills, no doubt, I had chills. Our guest videotaped the entire performance and still calls us from Florida to tell us she showed it to someone else who is visiting SF in the near future.

So from a real socialite, Thank You Harry, and Thank You Ladies!
author: Michael M.

description:
Good live music, great atmosphere, and delicious drinks (ummm...you have to have a cable car if you visit). I hear it's overpriced, but I have a connection here ;)

Haven't been to brunch yet, but I've heard it's a riot.
author: Aunt B.

description:
Took a friend to the Starlight Room for the Drag Brunch as a belated birthday treat.  Unfortunately, the beginning of our experience was marred by the chilly demeanor and attitude of the hostess.  If this girl was part of the drag show, her name would have been -- Ann Arctica!!!  When we asked not to be seated directly at the stage, she literally huffed and mumbled something under her breath.  Ms Arctica then moved us to another table;  where she dropped the menu, turned and was gone before it hit the table.  Talk about frost bite!   

Luckily things improved from there.  Our waitress was all smiles, the buffet was luxurious, and the show was very entertaining.   Great  place to take visitors for a uniquely San Francisco experience, despite the cold draft by the door.
author: Kraig B.

description: 21st floor of the Sir Francis Drake hotel?  The venue is stellar overlooking San Francisco.  I arrived on a Wednesday night and it was rammed!  The crowd was decent as well as the staff.  The decor was nice but nothing too crazy.  All in all, Starlight didn't really standout to me as I thought it attempted to (I'm that hard to impress).  It deserves a 3.5 star rating with the potential of being a true 4 star but hey, what else do you expect to find on a Wednesday night?  I would definitely come back here the next time I visit San Francisco though
author: Greg L.

description: Had a blast here!  Went for drinks and appetizers and good conversation.  Crab cakes were just okay, but the flatbread was delicious. View was awesome, both the City and the bartender!  Only downside was for the smoker of the group, who had to go 21 floors below.
author: Jean A.

description: Famous place with great views, cheesy music, and a $10 cover. It feels like you're at a nice 90's wedding.
author: Andrew K.

description:
our experience on a random wednesday night...

1. no cover ($5 guys)
2. beautiful view of union square etc
3. good music
4. see #1

drinks are expensive and depends on the crowd you go with but definitely worth to check out if you're in the area
author: Jasmine W.

description:
I asked my friend who lives in the city for recommendations and she suggested this place. I've never been there, so I agreed. Once we got there, I got the feeling that something was not right. So we asked the doorman if we could walk around to scope the place for a bit. Being the nice, cute girls that we are, he let us in.
Thank god we did not pay cover charge. Because when we stepped inside, immediately I noticed that most of patrons are at least 40 and up. Talk about old cougars! Yikes!

Laura, if you're reading this, I'll never ask you for recommendation ever again!
author: Ari C.

description:
Fabulous view, check.
Nice loungy decor, check.
Great cocktails, check. 
Crappy waitress that was too busy flirting with the table next to us to do anything in a reasonable amount of time, check.

I'm sure glad I wasn't trying to get drunk.

I can't comment on the clientele as others have since this was a Monday night and it was fairly dead, a double whammy for our crappy cocktail waitress.
author: Jason M.

description: I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. View is nice and music is pretty good.
author: Johanna W.

description:
I took three friends with me to see the Sunday's a Drag show. This was my third time.  Donna Sachet does a great job with her quick wit and ad libs. Having seen two previous shows, I was disappointed that the comedy routine was not part of this show. Previously they did a very funny Lucille Ball skit and a send up on an aging Cher with "If I Could Turn Back Time."    That drag queen was not there. Harry or Michael (producer) if you read this, bring her back! A definite +. 

Cassandra is absolutely drop dead gorgeous. Having seen more than a few drag shows around the country she stands out in a class all her own. If you've never been to a drag show you'll be amazed.  

The food was very good and tasty. I was disappointed in the Bloody Mary. It's one of my favorite drinks and their version lacked spiciness and was rather bland and watery. (Think just tomato juice with vodka and ice and an olive). Skip the Bloody Mary . For $10 a pop I expected better.  I ordered a mimosa and our friendly server suggested a variation called a Bellini. No disappointment there.

All in all, a very fun way to spend a couple of hours on a Sunday. We had great seats but almost all are as it's a very intimate setting.

Just one aside. I have no idea why a couple would bring a toddler (= crying baby) to a show like this. At least they whisked the kid away from the front row when it started boo hoo'ing.   Brain check parents. Brain check.
author: mark z.

description:
Ok, this place is cheesy, I'll definitely admit that, but who cares!! If you're going out around Union Square, that's pretty much what you're going to get no matter where you are in the neighborhood.

So, beyond the cheese, sitting at the top of the Francis Drake, drinking a perfectly chilled martini, looking out at the entire city and being with someone you love, it really couldn't be much better. Yeah, the martini was $10, yeah, the place is covered in velvet and yeah, it's definitely filled with tourists, but it's out of the ordinary and they make a mean drink.  

Definitely a great place to take a date, just make sure you preface your visit with a little disclaimer about the cheesiness and you'll love it!
author: Craig E.

description:
Good entertainment value!!!  

So my friends and I just wanted to relax after a busy day and we decided to try this place.  We get there in jeans, tshirt, hair tied up and see people wearing ball gowns.  Old, old people.  

Then there is this couple-- really old.  Sitting there.  Not talking.  Unhappy.  They leave for about ten minutes (I *wonder* where they went.....???) and they come back all over ea/other flirting/touching/laughing.  Pretty gross.  They are really old.  Like dinosaur old.  Pretty funny though.  

Then there are other old people dancing in ball gowns.  To ghetto music.  Pretty good, but for real laughs, go to the top of the Hilton when there is a conference and you'll see people that work w/ea other embarrass themselves fully to the point of office gossip for at least the next couple of years.
author: F K.

description:
"Where the cable car's meet the stars."

This guy harry denton is the bomb.  I mean check out the hot chicks that he's sandwiched between.  Heh google their website if ya wanna know what I'm talking about.

One cool thing was that when you're takin a pee there's a window over the city that faces the hilton or somethin.  These chicks were in their room waving at you with your bird in hand.

I woulda gave this place 4 stars, but I got stagefright, so only 3.  

Oh yeah and my friend (we'll call him Hans to protect the innocent) banged a married chick that he picked up here, so yeah, I guess this place is actually pretty good.
author: Rocco B.

description:
It's like the bar equivalent of Disney World for middle-aged professional types here on business. Definitely amusing, & I'd even say it was fun for a little while. 

The guy checking IDs at the elevator (I guess I DO still look 12) wished me a Happy New Year on January 23rd, & explained that it was New Years for the entire month of January. Also, the bartenders were talkative & helpful. And the view is great. But that should go without saying.

On the downside, it's expensive, cheesy, & [as previously stated] full of socially awkward middle aged business people.

Still, I could see how it might be fun as a novelty on occasion.
author: Pete J.

description:
Cocktail waitresses wear long velvet dresses, the bartenders wear tuxedos and act like douches, drinks are ridic redonk expensive, all the tables are reserved and there is usually a cover.  The clientele are mainly old folk, but there are usually some youngins tossed in the mix.  

Reason I give this place 4 stars.......because I've never had to pay to get in here, usually have been hooked up with free drinks, the dance floor is a riot, especially when you get to  dance with some old dude in a suit.  I've never followed the dress code to get in.....AND, the view from the dance floor is absolutely breathtaking.  I love you San Francisco.  You make my heart putter.
author: Christina S.

description:
Pure class.  Circa 1960.
Went to a private event here last night and had a blast.  It starts when you're greeted at the street by the From the long black dress-clad cocktail waitresses to the exceptional sunset view of most of the city, The Starlight Room delivered big time.  
The drinks are not cheap, and you have to look like you bought your clothes, not picked them out of a trashcan, but from what I understand, hosting the event there was much less pricey as it would appear.  
The dance floor is at one end, overlooking most of the city, and the dining room is dimly lit just enough to make its viny booths glimmer.  Alas I did not sample any real food so I cannot comment on the menu.

If you have $100, a swanky date with an appreciation for the classier things in life, and an old suit, you should go to the Starlight Room and paint the town red.
author: Eric S.

description: I'm taking out one star because their bouncers are D-bags that have an attitude.  Still not a bad place for Wednesday nights, but yea the bouncers really piss me off, haha.
author: Angela H.

description: View is great, but they really need to charge a higher cover to keep the riff raff out.  Way too many loser wanna be's.  Bouncers seemed to let anyone in the door...this place could be really cool..but they just let it get too crowded with too many twenty somethings without any money or class.
author: Christopher C.

description: The view would have been nice minus SF's famous FOG. Very glamourous atmosphere, even the cocktail waitresses wore Floor length gowns. However, it was a casual dress code, maybe because it was hip-hop night.  Booth and bottle service is thr only way i ever feel comfurtable in lounges, clubs, etc.. Ours was Complementary tonight for four friends so def worth it. Music was a great mix, free coat check and cheap valet. I stayed an hour, I get board easily at those places and hardly ever visit night clubs for my entertainment but overall, it was a classy joint and was worth checking out if you were curious about it's reputation.
author: Alicia L.

description:
This place has been open since forever, and it seems like most of its patrons were born then too. I went on a Wednesday night when the crowd's a bit younger (beginning with the 20s) but the dirty old men with their gold digging gfs were there in droves even then. But hey, if money makes you classy, these people are like the classiest people on earth!

Fun dance floor, a bit crowded around the bar, bottle service is marked up about 500%, but if you're on the list they treat you like a star. Great SF views, a place to take the out-of-towners to see the city.

I had fun here, but I don't know if I would make it a regular (even though I got VIP treatment when I did go)...
author: Christy M.

description:
Fun to do once!

I must say some of the other reviews are a bit harsh. If you are looking for some off-kilter fun and you are a tourist in town, give this place a try. We went with about 20 other people in town for a conference and we tore this place up.
author: John T.

description:
I've been a few times.  Had fun because when you're with friends, you can pretty much have fun any place, but...it costs too much to get in, the crowd mostly consists of tourists, and the drinks are pricey (but good).

Good news is that the dance floor has amazing views of the city, when it's not fogged up from everyone's heavy breathing that is.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Went on a Friday night, and the coverage was only $5? I thought it was $10 last time I went.

View: I didn't think it was that spectacular, maybe because it was foggy that night. The building isn't high enough, or isn't situated high enough so you get blocked by other buildings around. 

Music: went in at around 10, the music was for the older crowd. I didn't know the music, but i knew they were not normal club music for the young. Tried to dance, but it was awkward, maybe I am awkward. Most people dancing around that time are old. However, as it gets later in the night, the music changed to the normal club music, which makes the room HOT!

Drink: reasonably priced. Folks, this is one of the best spot in SF, so no $5 cocktail OK? go to a college bar or something if you are looking for cheap drinks. The cocktails were well made, my Cable Car was very very tasty. I licked the cinnamon on the rim...YUM!

Restroom: amazingly clean!! Unlike many other club/bar when it gets late and drunk people start puking.

Host: the host who led us to the seat was a sweetheart! He watched my purse when I left it on the seat and hit the dance floor. By the time I came back, he gave me a little sweet talk, warning me that there are people here just waiting for purses like that to be left on the seat.

Overall, it's a great experience. As busy as it is around union square, I didn't have much trouble finding street parking around at night both time I went there.
author: Yuchi C.

description:
The view was about the only thing this place had going for it. 
I had a friend visiting from Boston and he wanted to see a local Boston DJ here. This place was not conducive to a DJ at all. It's a small venue with a tiny dance floor, cramped hallway with an overcrowded bar. It couldn't pull off a club vibe and the music was too loud to lounge, which by my definition is hanging out, talking, and chilling with friends, but it it was to noisy to have a conversation. It's too bad, because most of the space is taken up by tables that would be perfect to lounge at. Clubs can be loud, because you spend most of your time dancing. The crowd was a weird mix and mostly middle aged, I'm guessing, hotel guests. To boot the service was awful, with a horrible bartender that took forever to serve us. I can't believe we paid cover. There are sooo many better places that don't charge you. We only stayed for a short time and then went someplace better, which pretty much could've been anywhere in the city. 
So to sum it up: too small to dance, too loud to lounge, and the service sucks!!! 
It has potential (cool venue, cool view) if it came to terms with the fact it is really a lounge and fired that awful bartender. If you like to be shoulder to shoulder on the dance floor, squeezing and fighting to get to one end or the other, and spending the other 1/2 of the night waiting for drinks, this place is for you! I'll stick to the real clubs. You know, with perks like room to dance and the ability to get a drink.
author: B J.

description:
We went here on Weds. for my roomates birthday. The elevator up to the lounge is a lot of fun, and the whole really dark/heavy curtains/GORGEOUS view/2 bar thing is definetely nice. 

The crowd was really odd. There were some very old people and some some young beautiful types, and literally everythign in between. Honestly, I thought it made for a very interesting mix. I coulda done without the dueschy 35-55 y/o bankers laming up the joint, looking awkward and sexually frustrated but also pompous and monied. Oh well, I guess even suckers need somewhere to drink on a Weds. 

There's a dance floor, it was perfectly adequate, there's TONS of seating which is great, and the music was relatively average, which I expected. I wish I could give 3.5 stars, but oh well. It doesn't 4. 

But it does warrant a visit if you've never been. Just take some friends, because it's a real crap shoot on the crowd.
author: Jake R.

description:
A very nice place to dance and enjoy your evening with friends or date. The cover is $15 and drinks are OK. The dancefloor is a good size and theres a band and DJ. The view of Union Square is romantic after hours! Music is soul, disco, 70's-present. The place is always jumpin.
It's classy so dress to impress.
author: Smooth R.

description:
Came here on a Friday night after a visit to Bourbon & Branch.

Live music was playing, and the band was awful. Lots of poor 70's covers and the singer was Idol style reject bad. No lie.

The drinks are a little pricy, but made well. Dance floor was crowded, but the crowd seemed like it was a mix between stuffy businessmen and cheeseball older guys. I guess it is typical meat market hangout.

I also ordered 2 pizzas to share with friends, the prosciutto pizza didn't taste that good... it is pretty damn hard to make prosciutto taste blah, so that is saying something. The margherita pizza was good though, so I would stick with that as a snack.

Summed up: great views, bad music, kinda scummy folks, decent food and bev. Hence the 2 stars.

QUICK NOTE:

Just saw a review down below saying typical "east bay/ south bay" crowd. Are people really still that pretentious to this day to assume that all people from 40 miles away are different than the scum in their own area? Get with it ya closed minded douche. If you only want to hang out with people that you feel are cool with your "scene", stay home and call your friends over for a circle jerk to avoid people different than you.
author: Justin M.

description:
Great views, blocked by horrible interior architecture. Mirrors everywhere, but no real clear views more than the immediate window you are at. They played crappy top-40 music until the funk band started at 10pm, but by then we finished our pricey-but-delicious drinks and were done.

Too bad, as this place COULD have so much more class... but it ends up coming off like a bad Vegas bar with snooty service.
author: K. C.

description:
this place is definitely a must for visitors to SF.  I know that there are long lines and overpriced drinks and its stuffy inside and you can't ever go to the bathroom...but you might see T.O. there....or Randy Moss. 

The views are also amazing, until it fogs up inside from the heat. 
ok, this review hasn't been very glowing, hence only 3 stars.
author: Roy N.

description: My fiance and I went here Saturday night, right after he proposed, for a celebratory drink.  We had a great time, beautiful view and live music!  Harry Denton himself actually brought us come complimentary champagne!  A great place to go for a special occasion.
author: Kristen V.

description:
This place needs a younger crowd. I think me and my friend put together were still younger than the youngest person there. The drinks are a little pricy but they are worth it. They always have a table with fresh roses so you can hand them out like phone numbers. The crowd is pretty wild so be prepared to be broadsided from all directions. The music is usually live so it is enjoyable. 
Starlight is really nice to go and just relax and throw back some drinks because the dance floor is usually too crowded and especially for the view. If it wasn't for the view this place only gets one star. Go for the view; but don't get broadsided.
author: Jim L.

description: Pricey? Sure, but worth it to check out a San Francisco landmark. Service was friendly and efficient. Drinks total for the three of us, with tip: $54 (a beer, and four mixed drinks). I walked out with a nice buzz and a smile on my face.
author: Allison L.

description: Went to the Starlight Room after getting married at City Hall with the wife and best man and his girl. Great view but slim on food choices. Their truffle chips are to die for. I recommend get something to eat before you come. Drinks are great and my friend was comped a drink while he waited for his 1928 Irish whisky they didn't have on hand. Friendly staff also helps the place. Would definitely go back for drinks and good ambiance.
author: Ez E.

description:
It really is all about the view.  Rating the view would be 5 stars.  Romantic yes, but exceedingly overrated as a nightlife hangout.  Old folks galore trying to recapture their dying youth (sorry).  Cheesy lounge band but with GREAT drinks.  DJ played some dope old school hip hop but seeing old folk trying to "get down" with it, kinda killed the music vibe.  Sure I'm a young, but i know what i like, and i did like the place, but i dont know if ill be going back here anytime soon.  

I would say, this place is a "holiday" hangout, (valentines, anniversary, etc.) not a drinking hangout.
author: Bernardo C.

description:
I wish, I wish, I wish.. that I could give this a 4+ star review.. being I have been here many times, and a few of my friends work here.. but I cannot.. because it is always hit or miss.. and suprisingly.. the more dead the venue, the better.. in my opinion..

The minute sebastion shows up for wed. and packs this place with what appears to be a clone of everything you despise about tools who spend their entire pay check on an overpriced sport coat to wear with their designer jeans and white nikes and brushed back .. gel'd I just flew in from Long Island guido hair.. you're going to wish you didnt just spend 20$ to park your car across the street.

Most of the patrons on busy nights are snobs.. pimps (read: literally) and wanna be big shots who constantly attempt to park their leased mercedes in the valet/taxi curb out front.. only to be asked to move it upon exiting..

To get a drink here is damn near impossible on a busy night as the bar is slam packed with shoulder to shoulder people who arent moving.. and dont dare try to squeeze in to get a drink.. heaven forbid you bump into their sportcoat..

I love the staff here, most are very friendly and the drinks are incredibly crafted (you'll pay for that, trust me).. 

My suggestion to you, avoid Wednesday nights here and if you really want to experience it, come on a weekend where the crowds aren't too overly bearing.

Now the last two Wed. I was there were event nights, 10th aniversary and Valentines Day.  However I have attended on slower Wednesdays but I still found it to be a little to packed for me.

My favorite part about days where this place is too packed is when the security prods people like cattle asking them to move in a direction.. "keep moving" they say..  its fun watching people ackwardly try to move around.. the layout of the venue is very long and narrow and has a HUGE bottle neck between the seating and the bar, so its quite the spectical to watch.
author: Oliver S.

description:
2 stars because its probably the best thing going past 10 p.m. on Wednesday nights (after 111 Minna shuts down).  The place has a great location & nice 360 views.  The major issues (in no particular order) 1) overpriced drinks 2) horrible bartenders  3) creepy ass clientelle headlined by Harry himself  4) South/East bay losers

It's ok if you're wasted and defintely worth it if you have Thursday off from work and are looking to drink (and blow cash) on a Wed night.  However if any other venue stepped up to the plate to compete on Wednesdays (say Slide), most locals would abandon SL room forever.
author: T D.

description:
I've had the pleasure of visiting on several occasions.  For a private party, we rented out the entire venue and produced an incredible event.  The staff were exceptionally helpful and pleasurable to deal with throughout the entire process. I highly recommend the venue for an event. 

I've also attended the Sundays Are A Drag brunch, a full drag show served after a mouth-watering breakfast buffet.  For the person that has seen it all, the Sundays Are A Drag show is an absolute MUST.

The Starlight Room itself is looking a little, uh, worn.  It's my understanding a renovation is planned for the near future.  Honestly, for the panoramic views, great food/drinks, and friendly staff, I'm not that worried about an old chair or two.
author: Ben S.

description:
1 star = Good View.
1 star = I saw Barry Bonds there.
1 star = Barry Bonds had Asian Fever!
author: Justin C.

description:
My girlfriend and I play a dancing game when we go out.  It goes something like this:  you imitate someone one the dance floor (the weirder the better), and then the other person has to guess who you're imitating.  I know, mean, right?  Sometimes you just have to make your own fun.  To the point:  the Starlight Room is a GREAT place to play our game.  

Why?  Mostly tourists, young and old, equally cheesy.  I saw an old man with a cowboy hat on, busting a move on the dance floor.  I saw an older gentleman getting groovy with his wife who was at least 20 years his junior.  I saw some really, really funny dancers.  Not that I'm Miss Dancing Queen- but hey, I'm sure people make fun of me too.

Music:  a mix of 70's, 80's, 90's, and "today."  DJ as well as a live band.  Great views of the city.  Nice bartenders.  When I requested my usual song, MJ's "Human Nature," the DJ said it's too slow of a song.  

I came after work in my casual Friday clothing.  Women were wearing sparkly dresses, and you could tell some of these ladies haven't been out dancing in ages.  

There is a cover, but it's okay because you can actually spend some time kicking it here, having fun with friends, and people watching.  Doubt I'll be back, but hey, glad I went.  And, no, it wasn't my idea to go here.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Once was enough. I was invited to come by a friend to meet people. I was bored out of my mind. The music sucked and the room is filled with a bunch of posers. Definitely not my scene.
I will say the view was nice though.
author: Megan Z.

description:
The view makes up for the expensive drink prices. TRUST ME...   You will impress any girl up here...  Pencil this place in on your next night out on the town...  

Never been to there club on the weekends, and I don't think I want to know what kinda people club here :(
author: Robert M.

description:
cover charge... cmmoooon.... with drinks that expensive you shoudlnt need a cover.

wonderful views though, but I did notice that the windows were really dirty, that should be fixed.

Great live music but a weird crowd...
author: Shawn A.

description:
Christmas Party

I've been meaning to review this since last year.
-Great views
-Decor was like Moulin Rouge but dirtier
-Buffet food was good
-Drinks were good and the night's drink of choice = Cable Car
-Good time because it was FREE and surrounded by friends 

Once the party was over at 9pm the soporific old fogies from studio 54 era came rolling in.  We promptly bounced to avoid any cougars & panthers from pouncing on me and my posse.  I probably wouldn't come here normally, but it was fun to go once.
author: Po L.

description:
Update: 1 day after I phoned the Starlight Room to make a complaint, the company's general cashier telephoned me and resolved the issue. In the spirit of good customer relations, he stated that he would credit $21 to my credit card account, which amount is equal to the $10 cover charge and the $11 refreshment cost. Despite this resolution, I added only 1 star to my original review because at the time of my visit no employee told me that the Starlight Room would place a hold on my credit card for an amount equal to 125 percent of the cover charge cost and a $50 hold for the cost of one drink ($9 plus $2 tip) despite the fact that I did not start a bar tab and paid for the drink by signing and closing my credit card authorization ticket in the amount of $11 when the bartender served it. The general cashier told me that within approximately 2-3 days after the original transaction date an $11.00 charge would have replaced automatically on my credit card statement the $50 hold charge for the drink. He said that he does not understand why it happens, but frequently the Starlight Room bar automatically places a $50 hold on one's credit card for approximately 2-3 days. Furthermore, before using my credit card at the bar, I used it at the door to pay the $10 cover charge by signing and closing the credit card authorization ticket in the amount of $10. The general cashier told me that the Starlight Room automatically placed a hold on my credit card equal to 125 percent of the $10.00 cover charge because such is a frequent practice of the business. He told me that within approximately 2-3 days after the original credit card transaction, a $10 charge would have replaced the $12.50 hold on my credit card statement. When I visited the Starlight Room, no employee informed me that the business would place a hold on my credit card for an amount equal to 125% of the cover charge cost and a hold for $50 for the cost of the drink. This worrisome, time-wasting experience has taught me one thing: in the future I will refrain from using a credit or debit card to pay for entertainment or drinks if I am not familiar already with the establishment's business practices. Instead, I will pay cash.

Original review, February 5, 2012: Do not use a credit card or a debit card to pay for anything in Harry Denton's Starlight Room, 450 Powell Street, San Francisco, Ca. Do not risk using your credit card, and carefully review your bill to see if it has overcharges before you pay cash for anything at Harry Denton's Starlight Room. If you must go to either Harry Denton's Starlight Room or the Sir Francisco Drake Hotel, which are both in the same building and appear to be part of the same company, I recommend that you not risk overcharges on your credit card by paying with your credit card for anything in either establishment. Pay cash only. I was a guest in the Harry Denton's Starlight Room on a night in February 2012 when there was a $10.00 cover charge. A live band was playing that night. The band did not impress me. I thought the band was mediocre at best. Harry Denton's Starlight Room charged $50.00 to my credit card (not a debit card) for the $10.00 cover charge. I signed a credit card authorization ticket for the $10.00 cover charge and have a copy of it. I had one drink at the Starlight Room. The bartender gave me a credit card authorization ticket to sign for the $9.00 price of the drink - Bacardi light rum and orange juice. I think the drink was overpriced, and the drink tasted bad. I think I added a $2.00 tip to the credit card authorization ticket when I bought the drink and before I tasted it, but I am not sure because I do not remember exactly the amount of the tip, the bartender did not offer to give me a copy of the ticket, and I forgot to ask for a copy. The total of the charges to my credit card should have included $10.00 for the cover charge, plus $9.00 for the drink, plus what I remember was a $2.00 tip, which should have been a grand total amount of $21.00 charged to my credit card. Instead Harry Denton's Starlight Room charged my credit card $62.50, which is a $41.50 overcharge. When I telephoned Harry Denton's Starlight Room the following day to arrange to receive a refund for the overcharge, the person with whom I spoke was not very helpful. He acted like I was to blame for the overcharges. He had very poor customer skills and was very insulting. He said I would need to telephone the Sir Francis Drake Hotel General Cashier if I wanted to speak to someone about receiving a refund for the overcharge on my credit card. Harry Denton's Starlight Room is on the 21st Floor of the Sir Francis Drake Hotel. This gives me the impression that Harry Denton's Starlight Room and the Sir Francis Drake Hotel are both part of the same company. I live in San Francisco, but I will never go to the Starlight Room again, nor will I ever go to the Sir Francis Drake Hotel.
author: Jack T.

description: I really had a good time here when I came with my girlfriends, Wed nights are the best because it's hip-hop =) and then I went on a thurs and it was super slow. So if you come, I would forsure recommend Wed night. And what I also enjoyed about this place was that there was plenty of seating for people.
author: Adrianna C.

description:
Cool Place to bring visitors.  VERY EXPENSIVE !!! and very crowded !!

Had a bad experience there with a bouncer/security guard, but I took care of that personally...

Otherwise its a cool place to stop in, then leave promptly!!!!
author: Anthony M.

description: Went to SF to celebrate 30th birthday of my best friend forever Joey!  Went to starlight room for brunch and all of a sudden a Drag Queen floor show broke out.  Good times ensued!  Had one of the most enjoyable times in recent memory.  Really well done brunch with the show.  I will never forget this great, great entertainment.  They involve the audience and make sure a good time is had by all!  If you go to SF you must include this in your itinerary or you only can blame yourself.
author: GAIL W.

description: Always such a fun time! Great panoramic views, live band plays classic and current music, and it's such a romantic place to take a date...make sure to get a table or else you'll be standing all night in the crowds.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Came here again on Wednesday night & had a great time, mainly because of my company. The dj was playing so many good songs. The place was packed...lots of hot guys & at least 3 for each girl =)
author: Krista T.

description: If you wanna learn how to be a woman, come to Harry Denton's Starlight Room and watch the 'ladies' strut their stuff at 'Sunday's a Drag' Brunch.  This place is incredibly fun and did I mention something about ladies?  I sure did!  The drag show is just filled with shiny earrings, big necklaces, huge curls, tons of make-up, beautiful costumes, and some of the most gorgeous, fierce (yes, I used that word - shush!) drag queens around.  The food is very good too.  Eggs Benedict, an omelet station, fresh fruit, salad, french toast, and everything that's good and bad if not in moderation!  It is worth the money if you are willing to spend it on someone special.  You need to take a special person for sure and someone who will enjoy it and, um, isn't scared of big, TALL, beautiful 'women'.  Awesomeness, for sure!
author: Dorothy S.

description:
I was telling my therapist yesterday that I was really pissed off that I couldn't seem to meet a man. She asked me how I was going about it. "oh the usual," I told her, "love spells, candle lighting, chanting, you know, that kind of stuff." 
"okay," she sighed with her blank slate face, "that's one way to go about it, but you might also try leaving your apartment."
"leaving my apartment?"
"why not?" she asked me.
"hmmm, why not?" I answered
So, I decided to cast a love spell and leave my aparment and meet my future husband. I said goodnight to Dieter and headed for Harry Denton's Starlight room. I mean, where else would one go to meet the future husband?
So, I get in and am immediately greeted by a 60 year old German man. 
"My dog is German!" I tell him, "where are you from?"
"Berlin," he tells me.
"oh," I sigh, "Dieter is from Leipzig."
"Can this Dieter, can this dieter buy you a drink?" he asked.
"no, dieter doesn't carry money around with her. she doesn't like purses."
"Well then I will buy you a drink!" he tells me.
I then proceeded to drink the nastiest martini ever. I got so mad that I left. I didn't even get the dude's name. 

But I can't wait until our wedding.
author: Ahnui Y.

description:
The sniffing / petting boy from the Nite Cap (http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?userid=op_PKWquyGZyYQkGv9V20w&q=Nite+Cap+) had texted me during the day asking to do something later, don't ask how he got my number I don't want to talk about it.

I had told both GBF#1 and GBF#2 about him, I mean how could I not tell them,  after all it's not often I get sniffed or petted by boys.  They both told me to suck it up and let him take me out but make sure he paid for everything.
