I wasn't sure how long I could stand being sniffed and petted again, so I told him I'd go grab a drink somewhere with him if he promised not to be all touchy feely kissy kissy with me cause I wasn't feeling it.  I thought this might scare his off, it didn't.  I than said I wanted to go some place that was nice and close to my hotel, no more Tenderloin dive bars for me.  

He came back with the Starlight Room I said OK.  

We enter the Sir Francis Drake hotel and ride the elevator up to the Starlight Room.  The elevator doors open and we are greeted with a red carpet, oh la la much classier than the Ha-Ra and Nite Cap from the night before.  We are next met with a cash register, $5.00 cover to get in and check this place out, cheap cover but still a cover at a hotel bar that's kind of funny.

We head to the bar, I review the cocktail menu and go for the Sun Splash, it had vodka and pomegranate and some other things in it and for $12.00 it wasn't bad, actually it was good, so good I had to have two of them.  

The place has some nice comfy booths to sit down in but it was freezing in there and the lights were so dim I couldn't see five feet in front of me and the sound was so loud I couldn't hear myself think.  It was kind of miserable in there for me, the Nite Cap was looking better and better as the seconds passed, ok not really it wasn't looking better.

Once the dancing started and the music got louder the petting sniffer took me around the bar to show me the views and the sites and where he lived in case I was interested in heading there anytime soon.  The views were nice but didn't mix well with the lights, temperature and music.  After my second sun splash I had to tinkle I head to the ladies room and there is a gaggle of females in there having a MySpace photo shoot, I push my way past them and head into one of the three empty stalls.  What happened next shocked me, two girls went into the stall next to me and started taking pictures!  WTF who does that people?  I finish, wash my hands and headed back out to my benefactor for the night and as the girls stumbled out of the ladies room I realized what they were, they were the female version of the douchebags!  I did not have to head to the Marina to find San Francisco douchebags I found their female counterpart in the ladies room at the Starlight Room!

Don't come here unless you have a benefactor to pick up your tab for the evening it's not all that great plus you had to deal with a gaggle of female douchebags!
author: Me H.

description:
Ah, nothing like a welcome to San Francisco from a couple of out-of-work drag queens.  No sooner had I landed in SF (well, Oakland --- Yay Jet Blue!) than was I whisked away to the Saint Francis Drake Hotel for the  "Sundays are a Drag" brunch buffet at the Starlight Room for a friend of a friend's birthday.  

Now, I have always been a friend to the female impersonator, (just ask Sweetie, Shaquedia, Sherry Vine, Peppermynt Gummi-Bear or Edie in NYC) but sadly, as became painfully clear in my hour and a half romp through more Cher, sequins and polyester than you could shake a stick at, the heyday of the drag show is far behind us.  Shows like this are meant for straight girls, their giggling friends, and their uncomfortable boyfriends.  Sadly that means playing up every clich known to, ahem, man.  I Will Survive (the Diana Ross version, no less)?  Check.  If I could Turn Back Time?  Check.  Celine Dion? Oh hell yeah.  Madonna?  You bet.  I was impressed with the fact that host Donna Sachet actually sang her own stuff (and wasn't half bad!)  And there were moments of brilliance including a hysterical version of Tea For Two - But overall this proved to me was that there's clearly no market for innovative drag shows in SF.  As Pryor says in Angels in America, "you know you've hit rock bottom when even drag is a drag."  This isn't rock bottom, but it's certainly scraping the bottom of the barrel.

Oh, and the food was pretty mediocre with the exception of the chocolate covered strawberries.  Two stars for the Starlight Room itself (glamor galore) and one for sheer novelty of experience, but for anyone who's seen real drag talent, this just doesn't cut it.
author: Sam P.

description:
our first mistake was that we came straight after a late happy hour (~9ish).  we were the youngest people in the entire place by about 2 decades (other than the staff, of course).  despite being pretty empty, all the tables had "reserved" placards on them.  on the dance floor, they were playing old school disco and it was all 50year old ladies trying to relive their youth.  the space was beautiful (very classic with beautiful chandeliers, wood panelling, elegantly dressed staff, and of course unparalleled views of the city), but i have a story to tell....

it's now ~10pm, and i glumly clutch my drink waiting for time to pass as my roommate keeps insisting that the demographic will change over the course of the next hour.  sure enough, somewhere around 11, the old people suddenly vanish (bedtime, i guess), only to be replaced by a completely b&t demographic.  it becomes stiflingly crowded.  hip hop blasts on the dance floor.  

my friends leave me for a couple of minutes to refill their drinks, and suddenly random men start eyeing me like hungry wolves on the prowl.  i put a sinister scowl on my face--"don't even *think* about it!"  i stick to my friends like glue for as long as i can manage.

toward the end of the night, a random guy approaches me.  "what your name?" he asks.  i mutter something unintellible and then, "what's yours?"  30sec pause, "um, it's bob."  "why'd it take you 30s to remember your own name?"  "well, i'm kinda slow.  actually the name's bob-ooo."  "your name is bob-ooo?" (hear skepticism ooze from my voice)  "well, actually it's harvinder."  i give bob-ooo-harvinder a withering glance, and try to dodge away.  a random bob marley look-alike grabs at my hand and i recoil.  at my recoiling, his arm shoots out and grabs me by the waist.  when the hell did this man learn that if a girl recoils when you touch her hand, you should try to grasp her entire body???  i'm getting good at these withering glances.  i tell my roommate, enough is enough--we're leaving!

man, i never knew a place this elegant could be such a haven for sketchy poseur trash.  i'd like to visit again (it's a good place to go when all dolled up), but i think i'll go on a night other than wednesday and just for after dinner drinks with friends....
author: Roshni R.

description: Really nice place to have a drink. You feel like you're back in the 40's or 50's which is the feel that they're going for. Great views of San Fran too.
author: Dana P.

description: Found myself in Union Square on a Saturday night and was not sure what to do. I saw the red neon light that said Starlight Room and thought why not? Well, let me tell you why not for me. First off, when the door to the elevator opened, all you could hear was 80's music blaring. The cheesy door guy tells me it is $15 a person. When I look at him like he must be crazy, he says it's the hottest club in SF, and that we will have the best time ever. So, I peek my head in and all I see are people who look like they are from the 80's and also happen to be 80!!! Thanks, but no thanks. I think the old light might be out at The Starlight Room.
author: Lisa A.

description:
think old school Vegas...
* fantastic views of the city & even better people watching: cougar-town contingency, Don Johnson wannabe, wedding (?) party, grandmas in sequins, & a quarreling Italian couple just to list a few!!!
* delicious cocktail offerings - the elderflower infused gin was a hit
* a fun, energetic band
a great place to mix things up!
author: Anna S.

description: I'm a big fan of big panoramic city views and not a very sophisticated or seasoned nightlife critic, so I have to give this place some stars based on the view (and the kitschy old-school club feel) alone.  Amazing.
author: Rick H.

description: This is a great place to get a drink before or after dinner.  The best time to go is on a clear day or night.  Drinks are a little pricy but with the view and the nice atmosphere its worth it.
author: Hillary B.

description: Went with the wedding party after my brother got married.  What a blast!  Its likely we were the youngest ones there by years, but who cares?  They had good drinks at reasonable prices considering the location.  The funk band was really good.  Can't go wrong with Prince!  Fun, Fun, Fun.
author: Kate H.

description:
I just went here for the first time last night (Friday night).  And it was a lot of fun!  A lot of very friendly tourists in town, had a lot of fun meeting people from around the world.  There was a good mix of ages, I think the youngest person I met was 26 all the way up to a 75+ year old guy.  On average, age is 30's-40's.  

It was way better by the end of the night when the dj started playing.  There was jazz-type band that played, they were good, but I prefer dancing to watching slow jams.

The staff there is super super friendly and really went out of their way for us.  The only slightly annoying pretentious people were a couple of bouncers, but hey, at least they are cute!  The bartenders were pretty awesome as well.  

Some key points that stand out for me:
*Remember to reserve a table if you want to hang out and chat with friends before the evening heats up!  
*Dress code - you can go in jeans and a nice top, all the way up to a nice evening dress, it all fits in here
*The food and drinks are pricey, but it is a hotel bar, and you do get a magnificent view, nothing like dancing next to huge windows overlooking SF!  totally amazing
*Very very small wine list, no beer on tap, but plenty of premium spirits
*Food selection is so so, would be nice if they gave reserved tables some light snack, esp considering we ordered food/drinks and our tab was well over $300.  Some pretzels maybe??
*Not a place I would go to ALL the time, but definitely a fun place to go with friends for a special occasion
*We did not pay a cover charge - not sure if that was just because it was a Friday night or because we got there fairly early (around 7:30)

Go with good people, a good time is what you make it!  I'll definitely be back.
author: Drea C.

description: I was excited to come back to the Starlight room after years of not being there. I remember good ol college days we used to hit up the starlight to dance our booties off with the tranny hookers, it was hillarious watching the lame guys falling for them. The place is newly remodeled and it looked nice, best part is of course the view! I was kinda bummed tonight, I was hoping on trying something there but all we got our hands on was alcohol. The pisco drink that tasted like apple pie was yummy and the pineapple tasting one was good too. I was nice and tipsy leaving. It was kind of disapointing they didn't plan very well with the food. The crowd wasn't that huge compared to other yelp parties and they just didn't serve enough. People were literally hovering and running toward the kitchen grabbing food as soon as it left the kitchen. I saw some balls that I overheard someone say was chicken nuggets and I saw something served on spoons. Bummer! I was hoping on at least snatching a ball before walking out but no luck. 3 stars for the amazing view and my friends enjoyed the whiskey tasting.
author: Karen T.

description: This place used to be great but it is well past it's prime. When I was there 15 years ago the place was clubby, swank and cool place to have a drink with a great view of the city. Now the place is a trashy night club filled with Euro-Trash wannabes with more attitude than CV. There's better lounges and drinking establishments in the neighborhood.
author: Scott K.

description: we went here on a random night(wednesday i think?) and it was poppin! definately a classier crowd. But, seriously, what can beat dancing the night away with beautiful women, 30 stories up over-looking union square? i dont remember what the cover was(usually too drunk!) and i dont think i had many drinks there because i was already hammered, but yeah I LOVED IT! they even had a tv where u could watch yourself dance, but that was kind of weird when u are so fucked up :P
author: Andrew T.

description: I had higher expectations from what I was told.  The view was good but I prefer a more contemporary setting.  If what you want is a brothel feel from the 40's and music from the 2000's then give it a go.  Did not enjoy the environment or my drink.
author: Chris J.

description: We rented this room for a private party.  Although the room is a little tired (they are renovating this fall), the view can't be beaten and the service was beyond five stars!  The staff were phenomenal and invisible.  I was given major kudos as having picked this venue, but all of that was due to the attitude of the staff.  They were ready to run with anything we asked, including a palm tree made from pineapples with a plastic monkey hanging from it.  Would be happy to serve as a reference.
author: Lynne L.

description: If you have never heard of it or never been you must reserve a Sunday for "Sunday's a DRAG" at the Starlight room in the Sir Francis Drake hotel. Reservations are required so plan ahead but you don't pay until after the show. It costs $44pp which includes a 45 minute show and brunch, totally worth it. Drinks are pricey at $10 but not bad for the venue just don't over do it if you want to keep the cost down. We went to the first show, 11am seating. Stop by the omelet bar first or like me you will run out of room on your plate and have to top your other goodies with the omelet. The omelet was the best and overall brunch wasn't bad, my only suggestion is they need to label a couple of the dishes (the egg muffins and the sausage topped biscuit). Every performer was great, fabulous time, "Tina Turner" was energetic and had the moves going on, Cassandra Cass, a blond bombshell, you won't believe your eyes, the host Donna Sachet sang her own songs and was a wonderful host. Don't be afraid, it is a fun time and one more item crossed off my bucket list.
author: Dianne M.

description: This is difficult because the ambiance was what my friend & I were hoping for...Was glamorous, vintage & very chic, but that's where it ended! Nothing else about what was going on around us last night( it was a Sat night mind you), was glamorous or chic. We get to the floor and before the elevator doors even open we hear blasting disco music! Disco and a 1930's themed restaurant don't mesh! You have a theme and the music needs to match or else what's the point? Jazz, big band, swing, Latin jazz all would had been ideal choices, but disco!? So, we get a couple drinks and then try to look for a seat...NONE to speak of! We ask someone where we can sit and he tells us every single table and chair are reserved till after 12:30am. It was about 10. We went and stood in the only place available knowing that if this stays as is we won't be there long & we had just paid $15 each to get in! Finally some live music started and it was live versions of the exact same songs we had just heard! Made no sense and he totally butchered the originals. We lingered & people watched and I swear to GOD! I have not seen so many creepy, sleazy men in one setting in all my life. So many men whose names coulda been or were Guido were there lurking in the most perverse and disturbing fashion! We didn't feel comfortable making eye contact cuz men were just on the prowl. Was not an option to just chill out. More leopard print on middle aged Miami blond types then I have ever seen in real life! We left after an hour as it was getting far to cramped to to even be able to stand. I guess the main issues was nothing about the crowd nor music matched the elegance of the venue....NOTHING! And at $15 a head I expected a whole lot more! I may give it another try, but clearly the night REALLY REALLY matters & I will never go back on a Saturday night again.
author: Unicorn U.

description: Sooooo much fun, dancing and joy, but what the heck lots of good looking men too, girls!....cheers to harry and his staff!
author: kit a.

description:
i suppose this review is a bit skewed, since last night was the first time i've ever set foot in this san francisco establishment.
 
(the bachelor with chris o'donnell and renee zellweger, anyone? ... anyone?)

my roommate molly is a coordinator for aids walk san francisco, and last night they had their team leaders/key volunteers mixer at the starlight room.  im always down for free wine and hor d'oeurves.  (just fyi, im not THAT girl.  i  was actually a key volunteer last year, and will be again this year. so there.)

this review is really for harry denton, who is THE MAN.  i was sitting in a booth with 3 of my girls and molly's bf niko, and harry came over to chat with us.  we think he took a liking to niko, because next thing we know, harry brought over a round of free shots!  

and oops, he brought over one too many, so he poured the extra shot into niko's glass!

and then... ANOTHER ROUND!  and oops, ANOTHER EXTRA SHOT?  he didn't mean to, he swore.  and in it went into niko's glass!

hilarious!  this man is such a character!  we definitely enjoyed his company - he is FUNNY - and hospitality.  finally, he left us girls with 2 VIP passes each, and of course, 8 VIP passes for niko.

cheers to you, harry denton! :)
author: Helen L.

description:
i come here every third Thursday for the Dresscode party & i would be here every Thursday if they had a Dresscode party every week (which they should!)

cover is cheap i you come early or if you happen to know the right people ;) drinks are a little out of my price range but i can afford to splurge every know & then... plus i'm usually drunk by the time i get there. the DJs are amazing & i am always down for a dance party 21 floors up!
author: Lizzy L.

description: This place was about as happening as a Tuesday bingo night at the local old folks home. The decor here is strongly reminiscent of a cruise ship.
author: Sven S.

description: Picture the scene. You're in the Russian Mafia and possibly wear a pinky ring. You own a business that takes cash only but, you're interested in stealing anyone and everyone's leather jacket with their car keys. You want to make sure it's hot and swampy in your club and you like it when the staff is hungover and rude. TaaDaa you're home!
author: Stephen S.

description: Great views, pretty good DJ, good size dance floor, but the crowd and staff are a bit shi-shi.
author: eric a.

description: I had a lot of fun here with my friends a couple of weeks ago. We went before  8:30 so there wasn't a cover charge, which was good since the drinks are pretty expensive (what do you expect for a ritzy union square lounge I guess). This is definitely a very classy place with awesome views. I'd recommend this place for a night on the town!
author: Allison K.

description: I went here for their Sunday's a Drag brunch show and had a pretty good time.  The brunch buffet was fine, the show was okay, and the ambiance was all right.  I'm glad I went but probably wouldn't go again unless I had out of town guests or got a better price.  They could stand to replace the upholstery on the seats, and work on improving the buffet offerings.  It is a very "San Francisco" thing that is great fun to do one time.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: What to do on hump day after work? Let's go dancing!! Where? Starlight! My friends and I love the fact that it's on top of the hotel overlooking Union Square. I'd press my forehead against the cool glass window while admiring the night view from above. The place is classy, drinks are good even it's on a pricier side but they give you quality alcohol... cheap alcohol gives me headache! Music is a mixture of R&B, Pop and 80's. The toilet is well decorated, clean and a selection of hand lotions, eau de toilette, even chewing gum for you.  Of course you'll tip the lovely attendant. She's the only one stuck in there while everybody is having a good time!  The crowd is well dressed and non-agressive.  Then again there's no guarantee but so far we like the atmosphere there.  The best place to take a picture with your friends together is by the bar area where there is a wall of old picture frames with the famous :) Go early, there is always a LINE.
author: Bella A.

description: Eh.  There are views, though I'm not sure I really remember seeing them, and I went with a bunch of French people, which always makes for a good time, but I could not have been less interested in the venue.  Maybe totally empty, with an excellent martini, and, oh, Dean Martin playing, and I'd have liked it.  (Um, then I would have loved it!)
author: Laurel B.

description:
Wow, I had been here on friday and saturday nights, because of my turn on for women in tneir upper 30;s to 40's. Anyway, it's ok and the women are aggressive which is great, because there is not to much competition. Anyway, I was told by one of the door staff at the Clift hotel that everyone goes to this place on wednesdays. So, I had a girl with a girl I hadnt seen in awhile who seemed promising and a guy friend was with us. We had a good buzz on beforehand from a wine event.  

We sat at one of the couches and ordered a few bottles of champagne and every appetizer on the menu.  I was saying this is the place everyone goes to on wednesdays explaining why we were here since it was not that crowded. All of a sudden the place is hopping, hired sexy girls are dancing on the state. My date and friend were debating which two dancing girls were sexier.. The verdict brunette was a much better dancer, but my guy friend and I would rather have the blonde. I would have rather had the waitress, they wear the dresses with the long slit on their leg not sure if there is a name for that, but it's so sexy.

So, my date and I she did the same thing as every other  date we had, she dances like a freak then I have to have her home by 2 am since she has kids. Talk about a ..... tease.  Anyway, this is going to be my going out night. Good ages, classy, but not to classy. I think it is interesting how places have their nights. On Wed, there is no place better than this. 

I heard the great Paris Hilton say amateurs go out during the weekends,the real partiers go out during the week. So, I had always thought it is more laid beack and more of a bond with people who go out during the week.
author: Andrew K.

description: Well, that was crap.  We went in, were told the cover and found a nice spot by a window.  Five minutes later, we were "politely" asked to move since we hadn't put our names in at the front.  How were we to know?  No one told us.  That, on top of morbidly expensive drinks, we left.
author: Travel M.

description:
wedneday night....


"dad? is that you?"


"uhh lets go i think your grandparents are here"....

at least it was a nice view... but i think you must have at least 2 kids in high school to be allowed in.
author: Ashley H.

description: Was on my way there for some live music event that I had been invited to by a friend. The first thing I had noticed was how filthy the place was. I know this is supposed to be a nice hotel but the place was surprisingly an absolute dump. I think the windows had dirt and fingerprints from the fifties. Went on up to the 21st floor for the show and loved the sign in the elevator that said this was voted as the number 1 nightclub of SF. Maybe back in the sixties. The club was very humid, boring, nothing was going on yet, standing room only. Bad drink selection and the prices were outrageous. We all left after about 15 minutes. The place was just old. I am all for an old rustic club and bar but this place was such an awful dump. Not worth my time.
author: Sasha V.

description:
a very, very unfortunately use of this space.

the views from this hotel bar/lounge are incredible.  there are 360 views of the entire city, which look even nicer after a few glasses of champagne.

Unfortunately, their wednesday night parties are just plain crowded and trashy.  Ladies, until they clean this place up (which is destined to happen), be prepared to fend off icky guys who can't dance.
author: Zuzzi E.

description: My red Hatters and I went to the Sunday It's a DRAG brunch.. and this is a must for everyone. This was a classy place and the people were friendly.  I wish it went on longer but it is worth the money. The food was YUMMY and plenty!
author: Michelle A.

description: Come on OVERRATED. Lots of Old Guys with not money looking for women trying to sleep their way to the middle. With that said it is good service. Go with your friends or a date and it will be fun.
author: Pink G.

description: Very nice decor, especially the half moon lounge-type seating. The $10 cover ($5 if you are with a wedding party) is actually worth it if you catch the live band. Oddly enough they were playing classic and new hip-hop/dance music such as "This Is How We Do It" etc. The "bouncer"/crowd-control worker really loves his job and it shows. So, you better not loiter around a table or else...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Went here once in the past, didn't like it. Initially thought I might be older than (36 years old) most persons here--as I entered the room, I saw 4 old women dressed in hoochie mama clothing----I was thinking---damn,  dress more appropriately for your age.  Saw several older individuals there.  Music was ok, eh the oz was better when it was open
author: Jer W.

description:
Ok I used to be the GM of this joint for like 5  or 6 years a couple of years ago and when I go back they still treat me like I own the joint. Or maybe in my own mind I think they treat me that way. Nevertheless I found myself there while in town a couple of weeks ago. Now mind you it was my last stop after a ballgame and trips to Tommy's, R bar and Cantina so to say I was a bit inebriated is being kind.
That being said I had a blast! My new lady friend from out of town was equally impressed. We drank, we danced, we galavanted and cavorted like sailors in a far off port. We even snuck up to the star on the roof when no one was looking. It is still the best view in town. 
The bar and wait staff (many of which I hired several years ago) were very kind to us and fed as many delicious cocktails. 
Now since it was Wed. night and Indulgence was in full swing the place was packed with lots of ladies in little attire. Kudos to you Sebastien for still packing them in after all these years.
Kudos to both Harry and Michael Pagan (current GM) for keeping the place looking good after all these years. But especially Kudos to the staff for doing what you do! It was good to be home for one intoxicating evening.
author: Bill H.

description: AHHH!  This place is totally expensive and cheesy, but sometimes a girl wants expensive and cheesy on her birthday!  We went on a Friday night, and had fun dancing to the ridiculous wedding band (and the DJ who played Justin Timberlake while the band was on a break.)  We couldn't get a table reservation, but they put us on a list and we didn't have to wait very long for one to open up.  I'll totally go back the next time I feel like dressing up and dancing!
author: Angela M.

description: always a fun experience at the starlight room....great views, many interesting people, patrons and customers alike....nice drink menu to boot....whenever i stay downtown, i have always enjoyed visting as well as taking people that have never been....
author: Jason Michael B.

description:
Thought I was in a geriatric ward for a second.  But no, it's the Starlight Room.  

After spending the first few minutes mentally blocking the crowd, I was able to enjoy the fantabulous view of Union Square and downtown SF, which is just about the only thing this place has going.
author: Ange L.

description: Douchebag central. You gotta come here at least once though. Make fun of the people, check out the view, have a drink and then leave. Again, I didn't pay and it wasn't my idea.
author: Heather L.

description: Awful crowd (mix between much older, sweaty, overdressed out-of-towners and young, scantly clad kids with far too much money to tip the hostesses).  Ridiculously overpriced drinks ($14 for grey goose martini).  For a $15 cover, without a live band mind you, I expect to at least have the opportunity to WAIT for a chair/table...but no.  Every single table says "reserved," and as other yelpers have pointed out, you have to "take care" of the hostesses to get one. It's stupid. The view is remarkable, but $60 for three drinks and cover with no seat= boo.
author: Jenni D.

description: When I was a young...er...We would catch the drag show at the local gay bar on Saturday night and then dance he night away.  Sunday brought hair-of-the-dog brunch.  Starlight Room combines the two--old-fashioned drag with brunch and a little hair of the dog on Sunday morning and Sunday afternoon.
author: Franklin R.

description: Ok I admit it the boyfriend got the romantic edge with this one.  Arriving at 8pm on a sunday night we were there a full hour before the DJ got there.  There were only a few people there and we ordered the over priced drinks and a dessert (before dinner but who cares!) The view was amazing, when the Dj arrived we were alone on the dance floor getting our groove on looking out over the city.  Awww.  I say think outside the box with this place we were there for an hour and a half, pretty much ignored everyone else in the room and did our own thing in a relativley elegant enviornment. It was a romantic little outing that put everyone in the right mood for later in the evening. ;-)
author: Rebecca B.

description: This review is for the Sunday drag brunch...at only $35, it is a steal to get both a live show and food.  That said, you are clearly paying for the entertainment and not the food.  The buffet has been prepared hours (days?) in advance and is super dried out (dessicated ham, anyone?).  The show, on the other hand, is fresh and entertaining, host Donna Sachet  sings her own tunes and Cassandra  is amazing to look at.  The other two performers are super entertaining as well.  The crowd is really mixed, from retirees on a Sunday outing to younger people.  It is definitely worth a visit though.
author: Marina F.

description: Decent view, decent drinks, old furniture and outstanding "uniforms."
author: Mr G.

description: I have been here several times, twice to the "Sundays a drag brunch",  it is so entertaining and the buffet is great too. It's a fun place for a celebration.   The Starlight room is beautiful and sexy and a must see destination, the views are spectacular....and the staff is all beautiful.  Don't miss happy hour, and try the pizzas....yummy.
author: david R.

description: Went here for a couple drinks on my birthday last year and was fairly disappointed.  Considering all the hype it gets plus the fact that it's in the movies, I thought it would be a little bit classier.  Instead of classy ambiance, what you get at the Starlight Room is cheesy worn out 1920's brothel decor.  While that does have some charm in itself, the interior literally looked like it hadn't been changed (or well kept) since the 20's, which really was more depressing than classy.  The view is really not as fantastic as everyone says either-  the windows are small and the building is far from being one of the taller ones on union square.  Oh yeah, and the drinks are RIDICULOUSLY overpriced and small.  If you're on union square, there's a ton of better places to go to than here in terms of atmosphere, drink quality and price, and view.
author: Kristin W.

description: I went to the Starlight last Wednesday and I have to say...I had a blast. I had a conference in SF and went there with a bunch of coworkers. Make sure you ask for Sophie ( I hope I spelled her name right). She speaks German too, which came in handy because some folks were actually from Germany.  She was great. Highly recommend that place.
author: Vince S.

description: Ok, it is what it is.  The decore is pretty swank in that old time loungey kinda way with the red velvet and deep booths.  The staff is nicely attired and friendly.  The problem is the crowd, need I say it?  Douche to the extreme.  But hey, what'd you expect!?!
author: Kyla B.

description:
One word comes to mind when thinking about Starlight - Disappointing.  It's in a good location with an amazing view, but there are several critical problems.  1) The people who frequent Starlight are generally tight-shirt wearing pretentious a--holes with something to prove.  2) The dance floor is too small 3) It takes WAY too long to get a drink and when you finally do, they're watered down 

The best part about my experience at Starlight was closing time when I found a homeless guy dancing around singing "If I only had some change..." to the tune of "If I only had a brain."  It was amazing.
author: Rick G.

description: Last week was my first time at the Star Light room with a friend. We got there around 8pm and got some drinks and food before the jazz band started. This was on a Wednesday so there was no cover charge and Rich Armstrong was performing. The entrees are on the pricey side and so are the drinks, but we got this really good fruity drink (forgot the name) that we both enjoyed. The band started playing and the singer was really great. The decor was alright, and the booth we were sitting in all the way up front was a bit too cold since the AC was blowing right above us, so we were moved two tables back. I think the view is what made the evening the most enjoyable and the fact that the person performing that night actually stopped to have a conversation with us which was really nice. Overall, it is pricey, but if you go there on a weekday and stick to one drink it's pretty enjoyable and the view is well worth it. Also the service was very attentive and all the waitresses and staff were very polite and not at all snobby as you;d expect in these upscale places from our experience that night of course. My friend and I have already made reservations to come back this Saturday since I wanted my hubby to enjoy it and some of her friends. So even if you don't want to spend, please come and check out the lovely view at least.
author: Petra S.

description: Came here for Sunday's a Drag. It was fun! The food was pretty good, too. Drinks were not included in the cost of the ticket though. We got our tickets through Groupon, and I'm not sure if it would have been worth the money if we had each paid full price.
author: Steve C.

description: I'm a big fan of any place that caters to chicks and The Starlight Room makes me feel like a princess! Wednesday night is pretty off the hook. The crowd is cool and diverse. Lot's of internationals. Absolutely breathtaking view of the city and beautiful decor.
author: Malika K.

description: i'm a local but only frequent the starlight room when i have out of town guests.  everyone wants to see the view from the starlight room.  the drinks are quite expensive but such is the price for one of the best views in the city.  i was last there on a wednesday night.  as it turns out, that is their busiest night.  even tho all the tables were reserved, robert the host was most generous.  he was able to move a few clients around  in order to help my group out.  i do think that the $10 cover is a bit excessive especially since the drinks are around 10-12$.
author: R P.

description: Sure, it's kind of a tourist trap, but I was quite impressed with the Starlight Room. The views are absolutely beautiful, and I loved the staff's fancy uniforms. We stopped by for a pre-dinner cocktail, and had a great time. Not sure what the crowd is like late night, but I thought it was a great spot to grab an early evening drink while you're in Union Square.
author: Brianne K.

description: I"ve now been here a few times, and everyone San Franciscan should go at least once.  Definitely better during the week, like Wednesday or Thursday night, when there are A.) more locals. B) less hicks from the Midwest and C) decent Top 40 dance music with a throwback to some vintage 80s songs.  Skip getting a table because I think there is at least a 3 drink minimum per person although you would probably need it if you were serious about spending the whole night there.  Lots of sleazy men lurk, but where in San Francisco aren't there?
author: Amy Z.

description:
I have to be comfortably intoxicated to go to the Starlight Room.

Why?

1) The drinks are exorbitantly priced. And weak.

2) If sober, I notice how many "scrunchy-wearing" tourists there are. I would rather be insouciantly faded.

3) I could picture my own mother here, on a "night out in the big city." Because this place is that breed of oxymoronic trashy-classy.

Three stars for the live music and dancing amongst the stars.
author: Jenna F.

description: The views are pretty amazing but that's mainly referring to the city views.  When you first walk in and see the little booths you'd assume it's pretty classy.  But when you hit the dance floor all you see is bumping and grinding.  The drinks are highly priced and not that great.  But you get a perfect mix of tourist and locals.
author: Jamie Q.

description:
Excellent classy atmosphere. 

Pro's
- Beautiful city views
- Awesome drinks
- Not terrible prices considering how nice the club is.
- Sexy gogo dancers by our table! 
- Everyone gets to play dress up, the girls loved it


Con's
- Windows fog really fast on the dancefloor, ruining the coolness of a dancefloor with a killer view. Gotta find a way to defog them.
- Terrible DJ that closed the night this wednesday. TERRIBLE. if I knew he always played at that time, I generally would leave starlight. It was frustrating for us because we wanted to dance at the end of the night and we were left with him.

Why was the DJ so bad?
- Frequently mixing off time (not a trainwreck, but musically trained ears will hear it. 99% of crowd will not)

- Not sensing the crowd's feel, whether they want to continue listening to a particular song.... for example Ain't No Mountain High enough is on, everyone in the crowd is singing along, having a great time for about 2 mintues, and BAM he changes tracks with no warning slightly off time and everyone in the crowd was confused

- He had what seemed like a 90 second maximum sometimes for songs. It was really annoying, I could never get in a good groove.
author: Brian E.

description: Came here with Juan L after pride and enjoyed watching the fog outside ahha... Great place and very attentive service. .. not really sure If I would pay any cover either.... sure loved how we got everyone on the dance floor though!
author: Christian P.

description: Awful absolutely AWFUL- from the pretentious staff to the oblivious touristy clientelle.  FUCK YOU STARLIGHT ROOM!
author: donna m.

description:
Wow what a great ending to a nice evening with friends. 
While sipping some champagne and conversing with friends I had the great idea to pick up a rose falling from the central vase. I put it in my hair and all my friends complimented me on how well it matched what I was wearing. 
Right away the bouncer, with no life of his own, came and literally threw me and my friends out of the club, but not before making a point to shout at me and try to publically humiliate the whole group of us. 
I am so happy that this establishment has professional doormen working for them instead of those guys you would find bouncing obnoxious people outside of a slummy bar. It truly made me disgusted with the fact that I wasted a perfectly good Wednedsday night I could have otherwise spent somwhere else.
author: Claudia D.

description: Good for the view and atmosphere, and fun for the small dance floor. Reasonably good drinks, but not the best bartenders in the city.
author: Don H.

description: Nice views aside, this place isn't all that its cracked up to be.  Well, that is, unless you like 70s lounge singers and 50 year old cougars eyeing you.  If you want something cool and contemporary, this isn't the place.
author: Aaron M.

description: Flashy drunken, bridge and tunnel crowd. But, it is the spot to be on Wednesday nights. It's the most crowded place I"ve seen on Wednesdays. The place is always packed and the bridge tunnel people break out their party wear/skank attire, and attempt to be cool.
author: Srinivas R.

description: The times that I have been to the Starlight Room, I have had great experiences.  The dance space is large and the view from the surrounding windows are amazing.  The drinks are overpriced, as is customary in downtown bars and clubs, but I found that it is a great place to go on a Wednesday night get together with the girls to shake a tail feather without being harassed.
author: Hiromi N.

description: Went on a Wednesday night and the place was packed!  The music was decent, mostly hip hop if I remember, plus it is pretty cool to have a dance floor with a view of SF below.  All in all, I had a fun time.  Wach out for the shameless couples making out on the dancefloor!
author: shoba d.

description: Best to be there early and get a seat by the window.  Always worth it.  Don't be suprised if you show up late and get bounced...it is crowded for a reason.
author: Chris P.

description:
after dinner @ scala's we headed out here to end my bday night...

this place is ultra swanky.  it's a nice place w/great wooden walls, and a superb view of the city.

i wanted to go dancing, but i didn't want your typical booty shaking, ghettofied place.  i wanted something a bit more classier, and i wanted some ol' school/funk music.  they had a live cover band that covered the danceable songs you hear on 98.1.  

sometimes i like to get down, ol' school style.  it's the old soul in me ;)

i hear wed. nights are real fun.  a group of my friends have been patrons of wed. nights for years.. i'm a bad friend who never joins them.
author: Sheri N.

description:
we had to pay a cover to get into this place...its theme is outdated and the music was ok.  we only wanted to go up there to enjoy the view of the entire bay area.  however, once is enough!

the crowd is much older and usually tourist people who stay at the sir francis drake hotel.
author: lasok o.

description: I went here after a holiday evening of wandering around Union Square. The host was super nice and accommodating and got us a seat by the window even though they were booked up. We each had a martini, me vodka, he gin. It was great experience and a perfect place to grab a drink after a day on the town.
author: Adrienne G.

description: You can't enjoy the view because its blocked by guys staring at you like hungry wolves.  The women are dressed a little too beautfully for a Wednesday and for whom?!
author: Lindsey W.

description:
When I was just a Cal student, I always came to SF not knowing what was up in that building with the star on top. Well last Friday I finally figured it out. The Starlight room! There's a $5 cover charge, the music is loud (you can hear it from the elevator), and the crowd is a little bit older (there were some old, 35ish men on the dance floor... grooving to the sounds of kmel). Buuuutt....there was a beautiful view!! The sky was clear and lovely.. lights of the city just calling..
So we had to walk around looking for a table. They all said reserved but no one really came to sit there. Hmm.......reserved for.... just in case?? Hahah.. some of the older people were kind of dressed more swanky.. but then again it probably is for the older crowd.
Ok so the drinks.. they're about $10 for a drink. They are made a little stronger though, so if you're into the fruity stuff... don't come here. Since the music is so loud you can't really have a conversation around here. 
When the place is about ready to close, they turn on alllll the lights and the place becomes super bright. Then they play church organ music... basically telling you to leave. The place is alright, it was an interesting experience. At least I know now what it is...maybe I'll enjoy it more when I'm 40.
author: Yosie G.

description: We went for my birthday one year.  I was so unimpressed.  Although the view and decor are pretty cool, cocktails were awful, the band was horrendous, and the general attitude in the place sucked.  For a $20 cover charge you'd think one would have a better time.
author: Angela D.

description: "I went there on a Wed night and found the place a little crowded. Little stuffy for a younger crowd, but the view is nice. Great if you are entertaining out of town people. Or trying to impress a date."
author: Palak P.

description: You get all walks of life here--from the locals to the tourists.  If you are looking to party on  Wednesday night (after 111 Minna), this is one of the few places that can be kinda fun. With its dark (as in lighting)ambience and combined with your beer goggles, it's probably best you dont drink too much. :) the music is not bad considering it is still a wednesday night (u know most good djs spins on the weekend). Oh, yeah, there's a $10-$15 charge (i cant remember) just in case you are trying to avoid covers.
author: Bren L.

description: i like this place, especially for out of towners, but the bartenders at the cocktail week opener last night were such bitches.  Bad drinks, unprepared.
author: Lindsay T.

description: I went to this place a couple of times, both on Wed night and it was pretty crowded. The decorations are from the '70s and they have their own fashion if you like the genre. The view from this place is great, being on the 21st floor, the drinks are pretty expensive ($10 and up). The music has been  really various and generally enjoyable. The big drawback from both time I went there was the men/women ratio, something like 4:1 and for me it wasn't that funny to dance surrounded by guys : )
author: Steve E.

description: Harry Dentons starlight room is great... I will never miss a great event there, I enjoy myself everytime... Great waiters and great brunch Thanks you guys Teagan
author: Teagan S.

description: A happening place on a Wednesday night, but one has to wonder what some of the people who are there are doing.  They are neither hip nor attractive.  The music during the first half of the night is early 80's.  Please, it is 2006.  They finally play music from this century in the last hour or so.  Great drinks however.
author: Asit P.

description: View of Union Square-priceless but cover charge is ridiculous. After you pay cover charge then you have to wait to be seated-most tables are reserved????by who.  Would not go back.
author: Zoe A.

description:
We went there on a Friday to check out the place for a friend of a friends birthday. I've head the place gets crowded and that there's always a line to get into the elevator but the wait wasn't that bad. The place is definitely aimed at older people looking to dress a bit on the nicer side. 

The ambiance was excellent with outside windows showing many parts of San Francisco and the inside having the right amount of lighting, seating, and volume of music from the DJ. 

Drinks were high but seem to be in most places like that. I think I got a Long Island or Vodka Tonic for ~ $11.00ish. 

The only thing that annoyed me was the older crowd dancing and making out on the dance floor- seriously people grow up! Also we had a crowd without enough seating so we were blocking a walk way from time to time and kept getting escorted to move from the bouncers who looked like secret service in tuxes and with actual audio equipment attached to their wrists! 

I wouldn't make a night out of this place, but it wasn't bad to start the night and see a great view of the city.
author: Jason W.

description:
the starlight room was the 2nd stop on an all night bender we had in san francisco on my friends 23rd birthday. 

the staff was super-friendly, especially considering the group was four 20something kids that weren't particularly dressed up, and the view was nice though it was pretty foggy out.

we only went in for a single cocktail - we knew it was going to be pricey and this was only a pit stop to prepare us for things to come. our death in the afternoons (champagne + absinthe) were only a few bucks more than the gin + tonic i got at the clift hotel later that night and they packed a serious punch.
author: Dan C.

description: Used to go every Monday night for years to hear a great live swing band and watch the dancers do their thing. Loved the desserts, drinks and the views.  It was always packed to the gills late into the night. Then they pulled the plug on the live music and the swing in favor of a DJ playing "oldies".  Haven't been back since. Too bad.
author: J. W.

description: Came here on a Wednesday night with my girlfriends and was really impressed with what I saw.  We arrived a little late and they closed the guest list but the doorman kindly let us in despite our poor timing.  Otherwise they do charge cover folks.  The played hip hop definitely my style and not that annoying house mess, hottie foreign men galore, friendly bartenders, and a spectacular view!  Will definitely hit up this spot again!
author: Christy B.

description: This is my scene because it is completely not my scene.  I mean, no one would look at me and assume the Startlight Room is a joint I would hit up, but what's not to love about the pseudo-classy middle aged?  I've never been more entertained--good music, interesting people...  Pricey drinks, but I realized as I was sipping my cocktail that I had ordered something at the Cheesecake Factory last week for the exact same price, except at the Starlight Room I was getting a drink with high end alcohol rather than something that was purely syrup.
author: ashley w.

description:
You have to appreciate this place for what it is and not compare it to the trendy up-and-coming nightspots you go to with your frat boy friends or club-hopping girls.

This is a piece of SF history..it's a classic.

Plus, the views are fantastic.

It's a romantic, classy place that makes you feel like you've just had a very special night on the town. It's a very San Francisco place, if you will.
author: Nicole R.

description:
very nice inside. however, everyone working there besides the man saying goodbye was bitter. 
1. Bartender - Of the 3 bartenders I ordered drinks from: The first bartender was a white male who poured me a macallan 12 year on the rocks. Only it was all rocks, barely any whiskey, so i left the bar looking like I was almost done with my drink. 
The second time around, I decided to order cheaper whiskey in case the same thing happened. I ordered a Jack Daniels, neat (no rocks). Either the glasses are really big or they just don't know how to pour a full drink.
The third time around after giving me a spiel about how the house wont allow him to pour a little more alcohol in a drink (keep in mind this is considered a classier place, which typically means they treat customers well while charging them $10 for a shot of Jack), I was a bit irritated.
The multiple bouncers tapping you, reminding you to keep walking and not stand in groups with your friends does not add to the experience.

I had heard good things about this place (before I was 21) from older friends who would go there on Wednesday nights. Wonder what happened.

Music was good though. Crowd very mixed. Saw Some people in their 20s - 60s. This is probably because it's in a hotel where tourists stay and it's a convenient place to go dancing.
author: vishal k.

description: This is regards the "Sunset Menu" happy hour, 'nightly 6:00-7:00pm', which doesn't seem to be mentioned on their website  -your chance for a cost mitigated sit & view in this lovely faux-classy 'top-o-the' room:  About 8 or so well-worked-on drinks at $7, the usual specialty and glorified drinks from $8 to $12 or so, and sharable bites for $7 each. I like being here at this uncrowded time to appreciate the old, the new, and the semi-sardonic way Harry brings it together.  How is it state-of-the-art LED lights, such as must dot the strange string-bead ceiling lamps, end up looking like a silvery disco-y chinese diner from the 70's, and yet there is a nice wood and lush feel everywhere, and yet when the 'disco ball' glow gets turned on for later, full price shinanigans it feels like I'm on a Soma dive dance floor.  I love it.  The food stuffs we had felt too cold, pre-prepared and refrigerated (the pita-type triangles coulda been room temp at least, if not crispy toasted) but gratefully nothing was mayonnaise-y greasy given what we ordered.  stuffed red peppers (ok to good), and the artichoke dip with bread pita  (good).
author: Stan M.

description: umm yeah but noo, maybe if i was 20 years older and didn't get out much id be in love with this place but i get out a lot and i felt like i was at someone's 40th anniversary party or something. i don't want to get old
author: vanessa a.

description: mickey is right. i went here with a girlfriend last month. she wanted to check-out their free salsa lessons. we left after 20 minutes. it was sad to see such a beautiful space with this lack-luster crowd. the views are just amazing, the servers all wear long black elegant dresses, there's that huge fresh roses display in the front.... but then you look around and everyone there is 45+, or hotel tourists. if it had a better energy it could be a really nice bar. oh well, at least they had my favorite hendricks gin which i can't find at a lot of places.
author: Michelle I.

description: Came here on a weekend night with my boyfriend after a lovely dinner at Fleur De Lys. We were tourists, visiting San Francisco for the first time and happened to see an ad in a local tourist mag. The line to get in was long, the cover was high. The view was spectacular, but difficult to actually see out the windows since it was pretty crowded. We had to wait to get a seat somewhere since HALF (yes I said half) of the tables had a "reserved" sign on them. (Do any of you yelpers know what that's about anyway? Do tell! I'd love to know why they would "reserve" half the tables and keep them unoccupied all night?! Is it for Harry Denton's ghost and his invisible minions or something?) The drinks were very much overpriced, but I suppose that's a given for a night spot trying to be upscale. I think most people there were tourists. I noticed a bunch of obviously under-21 girls drinking and giggling... Not really my scene, but the dancing was great! I'm giving it a 3 because my boyfriend and I really had a fun time on the dance floor after we had a few drinks (well... maybe more than a few). I think the fact that it was a teeny tiny dance floor made it funny. (Maybe if I hadn't had those drinks it wouldn't have been. Heh.)
author: Chantal H.

description: this is older people dancing to disco wedding music with $12 cocktails. if you're as lucky as i am, you'll get to see an over-the-hill german lady puke a few times and shower in the only sink while she tells you about the long distance boyfriend she has waiting for her on the dance floor. we mainly came up for the view and even that sucked. the windows looked like they had never been washed. watching 40-somethings grind and make out might be what you're into, but we took a pass. unfortunately it was after we'd already paid the $5 cover. lame.
author: Nailah M.

description: I had enjoyed visiting the Starlight Room before, however tonight, the bouncer was such a jerk that I wold never go back. My friends and I had a couple of drinks, but they wouldn't let us i because we had had "too much to drink." Seems discriminatory to me,.  What a- holes!
author: Megan M.

description: I'd give the Starlight Room five stars for a weekday afternoon in winter and only for a weekday afternoon in winter. This is a lovely place for an empty-bar, stunning-view, break-from Christmas- shopping amaretto sour. It is NOT, however, the place to go for an elegant nightcap after your wedding on a Saturday night. My brand-new husband and I learned that lesson the hard way.  To the strains of  Christina Aguilara, we got ignored by a unskilled bartender, he got the wrong drink, and lots of nice gentlemen stared openly at my boobs. As everyone there was superoverdressed, a sweet inebriatrix told me my vintagey silk halter gown was "cute." The DJ closed the bar with Twisted Sister. Not really my ideal start to my wedding night but, on the upside, we did get to see a really angry drunk girl nearly hurl all over herself in the elevator. And, baby, when that's your upside, you know you're talking good times!
author: Kirsten B.

description: Talking specifically about Sundays Are a Drag:  Who doesn't love the classic combo of Sunday brunch plus drag queens?  Great fun, done well.  And the food's surprisingly good.  The other surprise was how many big groups of retirees were here for the drag show.  Hmm.  So I wouldn't call this edgy, but would absolutely recommend it as one of those "only in SF" things, especially if you want to impress out-of-town guests.
author: Anne W.

description: I really like this place! It is a bit of a hike from the Bart station in 4 inch stilettos but once you get there, and then go up all the stairs, it's worth it when you see the view. There is a $10 cover, but there is also free coat check. My two best friends and I love shakin' it down at the Starlight room and we hear that the time to go is on Wednesday nights (random). There seems to be a lot of Persians/Lebanese guys (which satisfies my slight fixation). However, Marie and I were shakin' it down a little tooo much and some how, my room key that was intricately placed in my wristlet fell out. When we came back to Berkeley at 4am, I saw that we did not have the room key. In this event, one has to page the resident assistant on duty when one is locked out. However, that RA was ME!!! After realizing how screwed we are, we called everyone we knew, but no one answered because they thought it was just another drunk dial (damn the boy who cried wolf). Finally, our friend Jeff answered and we crashed at his place until the office opened and I could get a lock-out key and become a responsible RA again. It was my last week on the job but no excuses!!
author: Leena B.

description: this place was interesting. mostly chicks having their bachelorette parties and older guys drooling over younger chicks. but they did hook us up with double shots of patron for the price of one and let us buy a drink after last call so that's a plus.
author: Brokester C.

description: i can't believe i haven't reviewed this yet! i love the starlight room. they have hip hop on wednesdays and other themes on other nights. often they have classy jazz earlier in the evenings (like cocktail hour-ish) and the most to-die-for view in the whole city. the best part, their cover has never been more than $10 in my experience and they often have a guest list if you know where to find the promoter's website or you get on their mailing list.
author: lisa w.

description: A must-see ONE TIME when you're in SF.  Tolerate the old men - and enjoy the pretty view and jammin' dance floor (sweaty!).
author: Lisa L.

description: Great view from the top but big touristy bar...not where the locals hangs out. Its were your Mom and Dad goes to San Francisco and goes out for the night on the town. Ill give it a 2 stars...Im being generous!
author: Ryan S.

description: If you are in the mood to groove or just simply sit back and watch others grove look no further. This stylish hotspot in the heart of san francisco definitely sees its share of locals as well as tourists. I have been there so many times, but it never seems to get redundant. This place definitely would have gotten an extra 2stars had it not been for the reservation been put down for an hour early. My friend and  her friends got here only to find out that our table had been already taken. But wait thats not the end of it, it was her birthday and I requested a cake, sure enough the cake was as ordered, but one minor flaw, they had one candle too many. That did seem to upset her a little, but after a few tokyo iced teas that seemed to be a thing of the past. The dj however was real cool, and decided to dedicate a whole half hour to her playing her favorite tunes one after the other. Maybe thats a way for the staff there to show "oops we screwed up, so what can we do to better it". Anyways all said and done she is not opposed to going there again which is a miracle cause she is very opinionated lol. As for me I have had a good time almost always I have gone there, so I will continue to go there.
author: Raj K.

description: We had a table for 8 for yesterday's 2:30 Sunday's a drag brunch buffet and drag show. Our table was literally attached to the stage, which made me nervous, but did turn out to be a great view of the show. $40 for the buffet and show, all you can eat. The food was ok... the french toast was WAY too sweet, but the roast with gravy was really good. My friend did feel self conscious eating once the show began, so didnt eat as much as he could have, but that's his own fault. we took another friend's mom here for her visit from out of town. she enjoyed it a lot... the show was well done, and classy. it was the first i've seen in SF, but i've seen tons elsewhere. The performers were very talented, and well-costumed, and also not mean. They didn't pick on any of the audience. They helped the audience participate, but in a fun, nice way. The only reason i leave off a star, is for the food. I know it's not really about the food... but it could be a bit better for the price. Otherwise, great show, and something to take a visiting guest to, or go see yourself.
author: Merredith L.

description: love the place for fun dancing and has good appetizers...nice city site!
author: cecille p.

description:
ok i kind of like this place.  it's not really my crowd though, but that being said my buddy throws a party there wednesday nights and that's the only time i go and i enjoy myself.  the view is cool.  the crowd is kinda sleazy.  when i was single i think i enjoyed this place more.  i think i am just really settiling down now.  
wednesday nights are fun and it is kinda sleazy but that's something i can handle.  drinks are expensive but they're strong so that is also acceptable.  all in all 4 of 5 stars.
author: Anthony Y.

description: I had a lot of fun here but i believe that was mostly based on the fact that I was with a very fun group of people, one of whom was turning 21, and we had all been drinking our way through the day.  As far as the room, they were charging a $5 cover (that was fortunately waived after I made nice with one of the hotel staff members on the elevator ride), which seemed unnecessary last night since the place was far from crowded.  The drinks were good, a bit pricey (as was expected), the staff was very friendly and the view was beautiful.  However, I don't see myself going back here unless my mom and some of her friends are in town because that is definitely the draw.  Between the selection of music and the moves on the dance floor I felt like I was at a wedding, which can be fun unless some weird distant "uncle" tries to start dancing with you.  I would recommend it after a fancy dinner with your visiting older relatives who aren't ready to go back to their hotel and sleep at 10.  They would love to bust a move to "It's Raining Men" any day of the week.
author: Carrie B.

description: oh, the starlight room.  i have fond memories of this bar.  it's perfect on a night earlier in the week when there isn't a crowd.  they have quality mixed drinks and if you're not feeling that a glass of sparkling is always suiting.  it's calm and very dimly lit, so no doubt you will be relaxed in this setting.  the chairs are really comfortable and the tables are ideal for groups and good conversation.  the best feature of this entire place is the vast, endless supply of windows and the views of the city from every side and angle.  it's truely stunning.
author: Steven K.

description: 3 for the entertainment it has provided each time. its a fun place to be witha group and see the entertainment. roshni r's review of this place is pretty accurate...yes what the wise guys do is funny ..why u ask..hmm..only been on wednesday nite...and i have no idea what the scam is with them reserved tables...does the hostess think she can make money from this....what gives?????? nice waste of a place with a great view...
author: jigi s.

description: Another hit or miss place.  Sometimes you will get a great crwod, while other times the place is filled with dick head's.
author: James B.

description: I've been here three times on Wed night so I have a good idea of what this place is like. First, I have to give it to them for the view and for being one of the only good parties on Wed night. And it's also hella diverse. But after a recent experience I have to thrown down on them for their door policy. I realize lots of wanna be trendy clubs give big time preference to girls over dudes. I understand. But what Starlight does on popular nights is pretty wacked. Most everyone waits in the normal line. Instead of letting in a stream of people from this line, the fat bouncer periodically goes down the line and picks out groups with girls. He then brings them to the front of the line and lets them in. It doesn't even matter if the girls are a bunch of 250 pound ho's from Oakland with 4 children each. He only lets guys in from the main line maybe once every 15 minutes. So basically it blows azz. He could at least let in a dude or two once in a while. It's lame as hell. If you want to have strict BS crowd control things just be total dicks like Slide and say you only can get in with girls. Starlight blows ass.
author: Hmmm W.
